Valentina is seeking a 10,000 Grivnya loan. She is hoping to use it as an investment in her working capital. Valentina is planning to increase her supply of assorted knitted wear merchandise for women, thus attracting more potential customers to her kiosk this fall season.

loans.use: To increase supply of knitted wear merchandise for sale

loans.name: Alimaa

texts.en:
Alimaa J. is 59 years old and lives with her family in a ger- a traditional Mongolian nomadic dwelling- in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. She is married to Dorjjav, who helps in her business, and she has a 18 year old son. Her son, Damdindorj, currently studies at a Mongolian National University. Alimaa operates a vegetable growing business in town. She started to plant a variety of vegetables on her own 0.5 hectare field in 2000. Her farming business experienced tragedy when she lost all her harvest in a flood. Today she has gained significant experience as a farmer. She also makes and sells a variety of handicraft items for foreigners, to supplement her earnings selling vegetables. 

She is a hard-working and very energetic person. She has used her earnings to pay her children's tuition fees as well as to improve her family's quality of life. Alimaa is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT. The loan she is requesting will be used to reap a harvest and to purchase more supplies and materials for her handicraft business.

loans.use: To harvest vegetables and purchase handicraft supplies

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a soldier and he contributes to the family's basic needs. She has been operating her business of selling handbags, shoes and second-hand clothing for the last three years, and sells from home to her neighbors and passers-by.

With the Kshs 20,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase a bale of clothing, handbags and shoes. She faces a major challenge with high transport costs and seasonality. She hopes to be self-reliant in her business in the future. 

Mercy decided to work with Yehu in order to obtain a loan to add stock. She lives in her own house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothing, handbags and shoes for sale

loans.name: Rosemarie's Group

texts.en:
Rosemarie D. is from the village of San Andres. She is 33 years old. Rosemarie is the leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Rosemarie D..

Rosemarie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling vegetables in the local community. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosemarie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosemarie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. Her other 9 members also are requesting 5000 PHP each for their additional capital and their group loan has a total of 50000 PHP.  

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en: Batbayar P. is a 45 year old single man with two adult-aged children. He lives with his two children in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. His younger daughter, Udvalnyam, attends university while his older son, Chinzorig, helps in his father's business. His wife passed away in 1991, and since then he has been supporting and raising his two children alone. Batbayar is a carpenter, producing and selling a variety of wood items in the local community. He started this business in 1998 and has gained many years of experience. Even though he has not had enough tools and equipment as are needed for production, he has been making quality furnishings with his son. In the future he hopes to expand his business and improve his family’s financial situation. His business earnings have enabled him to pay his daughter's tuition fees. He is a very modest, helpful and hardworking person. He needs more funds to celebrate his son's future wedding and to purchase new equipment for his business. Therefore, Batbayar is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan in order to grow his working capital.

loans.use: To purchase new woodworking equipment

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a married woman with three children who have all completed schooling.  Her husband is a mason and he contributes to his family's needs. She has been operating her food café business for more than one year, selling from her home to school children and neighbors.  She earns her other source of income from her husband's contribution.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase a bundle of maize flour and a sack of rice.  She faces the major challenge of seasonality, especially during the month of August when school has closed for the holidays.

She hopes to open a big restaurant in the future.  Her major aim of working with Yehu is to get a loan to boost her business.  She owns a house with electricity, but no piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To purchase flour and rice for her cafe.

loans.name: Dashtseren

texts.en: Dashtseren D. is 44 years old and lives with his wife and two children in their own ger- a traditional nomadic housing tent- in the Huvsgul province of Western Mongolia. His youngest son attends a local secondary school, while his wife is currently employed in a tourist camp as a handicraft maker. Dashtseren used to work as a mechanic from 1990 to 2000, and as a driver for a private company from 2000 to 2005. He has been managing his taxi service in a local town since 2005. Dashtseren is modest, open-minded and hardworking person. He needs funds to repair his car. He is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to restore his automobile, which he uses as a taxi.

loans.use: To repair his car for taxi service

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 48-year-old married man and has 3 children. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as an experienced flooring worker for the past 30 years.  He works on floor covering, kitchen tiling, and bathroom tiling. Due to the long experience in this occupation, he has gained a good number of customers in addition of building a good business reputation. He is thankful for his business income, it provides a good life situation for his family and he was able to finalize the education of two of his children. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new tools and supplies for a new project.
In the future, he is planning to open a construction office specialized in flooring and ceramics and he hopes he will reach this goal.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and supplies

loans.name: Dorj

texts.en: Dorj P. is a married man who lives with his wife, his teenage daughter, and his sibling in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His daughter studies at a high school and his wife works as a private businesswoman. Dorj owns and operates a mini-bus taxi service. In 2001, he became engaged in this business, transporting people between the eastern district and Narantuul, the largest market in Ulaanbaatar. Since then, he has built a stable operation. His vehicle is becoming old and damaged due to its long period of usage. He needs funds to purchase a new engine for his mini-bus so that he can keep it in good running condition for the next several years. He is a hardworking and open-minded person and says: "I want to repair my mini-bus before the winter months." Dorj is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to use towards his working capital.

loans.use: To repair his mini-bus

loans.name: Dorcus

texts.en:
Dorcus is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a bus driver, and he contributes to the upbringing of the kids. She has been operating her open air food stall for the last three years, selling at the market to town dwellers.

With the Kshs 20,000 she is requesting, she wants to open a new business selling coral bricks. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation. She hopes to be a wholesaler of coral bricks and to earn more profit in the future.

She decided to work with Yehu to get a loan to finance her new business. She owns a house with no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To start a new business selling coral bricks

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman with no children. She has been operating her retail shop for the last two years. She sells both in a shop and as retail to her neighbors and passers-by.

With the Kshs 80,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase maize flour, soap detergents, rice and kitchen utensils. She earns additional income from her pharmacy shop. Transport is a major challenge for her business. She hopes to make more profit and expand her business in the future.

She decided to join Yehu to get a loan to expand her business. She rents a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, rice, kitchen utensils and soap detergents

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 29-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his mother and brother. He has been working as a fisherman on over 15 years. He cooperates with his brother to support the family's household and take care of their mother. His work depends on the season, in summer the sales are bigger than in winter. So he works hard during the summer season to make a good profit.  Today, he is requesting to borrow $ 1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.  to purchase fishing tools and tackle. 
In the future, he would like to purchase another boat; he feels positive about his business prospects for the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase fishing tools and tackle

loans.name: Nerguibaatar

texts.en: Nerguibaatar O. is a 26 year old single man who lives with his mother and one sibling in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. Nerguibaatar operates a motorcycle parts business in his town. He started his business in 2006 with 500,000 MNT of capital. After years of successful operation, he has managed to increase his working capital to a level exceeding 2,500,000 MNT today. Over the years he has gained much experience in his trade and has built a stable business. His business earnings have enabled him to renovate his house.  He is a very honest and says: "I want to supply a high quality product to my customers." Nerguibaatar is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to buy supplies for his motorcycle parts business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his motorcycle parts business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a member of the Uzima loan group with Faulu Kenya. She is a 35-year-old single mother.  Her child is only three years old. 

Mary has been operating a salon for one year and has one employee.  Most of her customers are women.  She hopes to expand her business and open other business outlets in the future.  She has requested for a loan to buy seats and mirrors for her salon.

loans.use: To buy salon seats and mirrors

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a married woman with four children all whom attend school. She has been operating her business of selling charcoal and firewood to her neighbors from her home for the last two years. With the loan, she wants to purchase five sacks of charcoal and a bundle of firewood.

The major challenge in her business is high transport costs. She hopes to purchase enough stock and satisfy her customers to maximize her profit.

Her major aim of working with Yehu is to get financial support to boost her business.

Flora owns a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

loans.use: To purchase five sacks of charcoal and a bundle of firewood.

loans.name: Derick

texts.en:
Derick is a 30-year-old member of Neema group in Faulu Kenya. Since he joined the group, he has become more focused in his business selling cereals. He started the business four years ago after leaving his job.

Derick has requested 20,000 KES to buy more cereals. He hopes to expand his business and open a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cereals to sell

loans.name: Tulgat

texts.en: Tulgat D. is a 31-year-old married man who lives with his wife and one daughter in their own house in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. His wife works as a private businesswoman. Tulgat runs a taxi service in his local town. He started this business in 2006 after purchasing a new car with his working capital and since then he has built a stable operation. He also started a second business in 2008 by selling a variety of products in the local community. His business earnings have enabled him to renovate his house.  After years of successful operation, both of his businesses have become sustainable in the local market. Tulgat is a hardworking and honest person who plans to save his revenue for his daughter's future. He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase some spare parts for his automobile and more inventory products for his trading business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his taxi and more products for his trading business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 33 years old and a single mother of two.  For one and a half years, she has been selling charcoal.  She also operates a salon for extra income.  She is a member of the Jiinuwe Ngando group in Faulu Kenya.  The members of the group support each other by guaranteeing each other's loans.  Beatrice has also learned how to keep business records and manage her money by saving.  She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy ten bags of charcoal.  She hopes to buy a lorry for transporting charcoal in the future.

loans.use: To buy ten bags of charcoal

loans.name: Toek's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of four members led by Mrs. Toek T., 47, a mother of two young children who attend school. Toek T. is a farmer on a plot of land acquired from her parents. Toek T. is widowed; her husband died of senility years ago. She is able to earn a good income and living standard with her farming. However, some of her crops are not growing well because they need fertilizers. To remedy the situation, Toek T. would like a loan to buy two sacks of fertilizer.

The other joint borrowers are:

T., 26, a local farmer, is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer to support her crop.

S., 26, plants rice and needs a loan to buy fertilizer to increase her crop yield.

T., 42, a local farmer, is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her crop.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
This borrower is married with four children who all attend school. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has been operating her open-air food sales business for the last two years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of high transport costs in her business.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She hopes that she will be able to make more profit and open a restaurant in the future.

Her major aim of working with Yehu is to obtain a loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 22 years old and single. He has been operating a cafeteria with one employee for three years. He also provides motorbike transport for extra income. He is a member of a group in Faulu Kenya and he saves his money with the group on a weekly basis.  He says that he is doing well and he hopes to expand his business in the future. He sees himself owning more cafeterias in five years. He has requested 20,000 KES to build another cafeteria.

loans.use: To build a cafeteria

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a widow with two children who both attend school. She has been operating her secondhand children's clothing business for the last six years, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She also cooks dumplings for sale as another source of income.

With this KES 20,000 loan, Sophia wants to purchase a bale of clothes for resale. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business.She hopes that she will be able to purchase two more bales of clothes in the future.

Sophia decided to work with Yehu in order to get a loan to boost her business and improve her living standards. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes for resale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a single woman with one child who attends school. She has been operating her beauty shop for the last five years, women being her potential customers. With this KES 40,000 loan, Margaret wants to purchase cosmetics for her beauty salon and employ another person. She also farms and sells maize to earn another source of income.

Margaret's major challenge in the business is seasonality. She hopes to improve her business and become the best beauty salon in the future. Margaret decided to work with Yehu in order to get financial assistance to improve her business. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for her beauty salon and to employ another person

loans.name: Dilovarsho

texts.en: V. Dilovarsho has always been a hardworking man who has made sure, from a young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread. He is married with four children. Dilovarsho has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foods. With a small amount of starting capital, Dilovarsho began this enterprise 10 years ago. Thanks to his perseverance and dedication, he has expanded his business and today his whole family is engaged in this business. Dilovarsho needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of goods he is selling. He is requesting a loan of 6,500 somoni for this purpose. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while, to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuffs to increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.en: Abdusalom is 21 years old and single. He owns a grocery store and provides for his family with the revenue generated by the store. Abdusalom is requesting a loan of 8,000 somoni to increase his stock of foodstuffs and to buy construction materials. Abdusalom is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once and in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is to expand his business, save some money, and start his own family. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key factors for success in his small business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Mehrovar

texts.en: S. Mehrovar is 21 years old and single. He sells women's shoes and clothing for teenagers in the central market of Dushanbe. For three years, he has maintained his clientele. Mehrovar‘s business is the main source of income allowing him to improve his family's living conditions and provide them with food. He requests 4,000 somoni to purchase new goods in order to increase his variety. Mehrovar would like to thank everyone for support and promises to repay the loan on time. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing in order to increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en: Jeremiah is 37 years old and married with two children. He operates a retail shop where he sells cereals. He was previously employed. He also works in a quarry to supplement his family’s income. He has become more focused on his business since he joined the Dam Group of Faulu Kenya. He has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy cereals. He hopes to expand his shop and open more shops in the future.

loans.use: To buy cereals

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old single man living with his parents. He is from Lebanon. In 2001, he got the idea of working as a gasoline distributor in his town and the surrounding areas.  He chose this occupation after seeing the need for such a service in his town. He works closely with a gas company where he fills bottles with gas and then he distribute them to the customers. And he also distributes to some markets. Today, he is requesting to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to finalize the registration documents of his Rapid car. He uses the car to make his deliveries.

In the future, he would like to purchase another car and expand his business into other areas; he feels positive about his business prospects for the coming year.

loans.use: to finalize the registration documents of his Rapid car

loans.name: Johnstone

texts.en:
Johnstone is a 39-year-old father of six school-aged children. He is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for the last five years and employs one farmhand. He sells his milk to local hotels and individuals. He also earns income from his small-scale farming of tea which he sells through Kenya Tea Development Authority.

Johnstone has requested this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. By purchasing an extra dairy cow, he feels that his income will increase and in turn improve the living conditions of his family. However, he faces the challenge of animal diseases and poor market prices for his milk. He still hopes that in the future he will be able to buy more dairy cows and build a dairy unit that will accommodate his high quality dairy cows. He is grateful to Juhudi for advancing loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 41-year old married man with three young children, who are attending school. He is the main income provider for his family. He has twenty years of experience working as a farmer. He has been running his own farm since 1990. He uses plastic tents to grow his products. These tents also allow him to better monitor product quality as well as grow his products for more months during the year. He works independently in his business. And he distributes the vegetables and fruits that he harvests to local markets. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.  to purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work and to improve his business.  And he hopes that the loan will help him increase his profits by 15%.

loans.use: to purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work and to improve his business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is an active member of Vision Group which is being funded by Juhudi Kilimo. He is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. He has been farming for nine years and employs six casual labourers. His main products are maize and nappier grass which he sells locally. He also supplies ballast and owns a quarry. His major challenge is lack of fertilizer and manure for his nappier grass. John is 35 years old and married with five school-aged children.

John has requested this loan of 35,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that with this loan, he will be able to provide his family with enough milk for consumption. The extra income from the sale of milk will be used to pay school fees for his children. He hopes that in future his ballast business will improve and that he will have acquired other dairy cows that will increase his milk production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul O. N. is thirty six years old and married. His wife is a vegetable vendor and they do not have any children yet.

His business is located at a busy market known as Nyamasaria in Kisumu. He makes clothes which include trousers, shirts and seat covers, and sells to wholesalers at Kibuye market. He has been doing this for ten years. He says that his business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. 

He is using his loan of 20,000 KES to buy materials to make more clothes and sell to the local people, thus serving a bigger clientele. He hopes to acquire his own shop at Kibuye market in Kisumu. He describes himself as tolerant, respectful and social.

loans.use: to buy more fabric for sewing

loans.name: Benetta

texts.en:
Benetta, aged 57, is a widow with two children and lives in Kangemi, a Nairobi suburb. She sells charcoal for fuel to the local households in Kangemi which is an urban area where most clients are low income earners. She has done this for the last five years. 

With this loan, she plans to buy 12 sacks of charcoal so as to add stock to her business. This is her 1st loan with KADET LTD and she has never borrowed from other financial institutions. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and improve the lives of her two children by giving them their necessary basic needs.

loans.use: Benetta is planning to buy 12 sacks of charcoal at kshs 800 each totalling to kshs 9600, ksh 400/ will be for transport.

loans.name: Grace Jepkosgei

texts.en:
Grace Jepkosgei K. is a 46-year-old lady married to John Kotut Rotich. They have four children, ages 25, 22, 20 and 18. They live in Kapsoya, outside of Eldoret town. 

Grace practices dairy farming as a source of income. She has been in this business for the past seven years with an income of about $90 per month. 

Grace was introduced to KADET LTD by a Credit officer. She is applying for a loan of 55,000 KES from KADET LTD, which will be her 4th loan.  She plans to purchase two more dairy cows. 

She hopes to operate a large scale dairy farm, so that she can supply milk to hotels and sell the best quality milk to her customers. In the future she would like to extend the same services to companies like KCC (Kenya Cooperative Creameries) and Brookside (East Africa's leading dairy).

loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 32-year old married woman from Lebanon. A mother of 3 children, she has started her business offering beauty services to the clients from her home. Her services include manicure, pedicure, tattoo etc. She has been working for the past five years.  Her income is important to help with her household expenses and to pay for her children’s school fees. Today, she is asking for her second loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase beauty products and expand her business. 

In the future, she is planning to open a formal beauty salon to receive her clients.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and expand her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 52, has three children and lives in Baba Dogo, a Nairobi suburb. She operates a secondhand clothes stall in the Mwimto area, which is on the outskirts of Kikuyu town and where most of her clients are low income earners. She has been in this trade for the last 15 years. 

Besides the clothes business, she also sells flower pots. With this loan, she plans to buy more clothes so as to have a variety that will suit all her customers, both young and old. She also desires to expand her flower pots trade so that it can boost her income and give her children a better future. She is the sole breadwinner for her family.  

She has never borrowed from other financial institutions and this is her 2nd loan with KADET LTD.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business and open other outlets in the city.

loans.use: Elizabeth plans to buy more clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Abana

texts.en:
Abana E. K. is married and has six dependents. She has no educational background.

Abana sells locally-made pomade and soap at Elmina and, with the support of her husband, she is able to take care of the family. She will use the loan to purchase more of her pomade and soap for sale.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Abana plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more pomade and soap to sell

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret K. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of her mother.    

Margret has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 4 years, and she works 7 days a week. She sells her products at the market  on a retail basis. She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.     

She also generates additional income through selling clothes. The main business challenges for Margret include transportation and the rainy season.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to educate her children up to university level and to build rental rooms. 

She lives in a home that she owns where she doesn’t have access to electricity but does have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Celso Fernando

texts.es: El señor  Celso Fernando P. P. se dedica a brindar servicios como Operario de Construcción Civíl hace diez años aproximadamente, el solicitante vive con su menor hija en su domicilio ubicado avenida Acomayo Ica ya que se encuentra separado de su conyuge hace quince años. El cliente solicita el cédito para mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que con su trabajo y esfuerzo a logrado construir su casa, se propone otorgarle el crédito por que presenta experiencia acrediticia en tiendas comercialesbuenas y buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Celso Fernando P. P. has been a civil construction worker for approximately ten years. He lives with his minor daughter in his house on Acomayo Ica Avenue. He has been separated from his wife for 15 years. He is requesting the loan to improve his house. With his work and effort he has managed to build his house. It is suggested that he receive the loan because he has good credit experience in commercial stores and good personal and work references.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve his house

loans.name: Salome

texts.es:
La señora Salome S. H.,  tiene 21  años de edad, viven en la comunidad de Thoqo Thaqo de la  provincia de Mizque del departamento de Cochabamba,   tiene dos hijos, el padre de su primer hijo les dejo a causa de un accidente y a su segundo esposo tuvo que dejarlo por el mal trato que les daba a sus hijos y a ella, ahora  ella sola tiene que mantener y alimentarlos a sus dos  hijos.

Esta época por el desastre natural de la sequia su pequeña parcela de cebolla no maduro bien, este desastre le hizo fracasar en sus ingresos económicos que ella esperaba. 
     
Salome es una persona  muy querida y respetada en el lugar donde vive, por lo dedicada a sus hijos  y su trabajo que a veces hasta tiene que trabajar en jornal en la agricultura para ganar algunos pesos y asi mantener a sus dos hijos, ella está solicitando el crédito para   abrir un negocio de tienda de panadería en el lugar donde vive  para mejorar sus ingreso económico y  darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y puedan asistir a la escuela  en mejores condiciones.  El crédito ayudara mucho a sus hijos y a ella en el duro trabajo que realiza.
texts.en:
Salome S. H., age 21, lives in the Thoqo Thoqo community in the Mizque province, Cochabamba department. She has two children. The father of her first child left them due to an accident. She had to leave her second husband because he mistreated her and her children. She now has to support and feed her two children by herself. Due to this season’s natural draught disaster, her small parcel of onions did not ripen well. This disaster caused a failure in the income she was expecting. Salome is very well-liked and respected in the place where she lives because of her dedication to her children and her work. Sometimes she even has to work in agriculture as a day worker to earn some pesos to support her two children. She is requesting the loan to open a business. She will open a bakery store in the place where she lives to improve her income and to give her children a better quality of life. Then her children will be able to go to school under better conditions. The loan will greatly help her and her children in the hard work that she does.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in a bakery business

loans.name: Silvia Anabella

texts.es: Silvia Anabella X. X. D. A.,tiene 40 años D. edad es casada, vive con su esposo y sus seis hijos, cuatro D. ellos monores D. edad, su esposo le ayuda con la venta D. telas, como manteles, toallas, cortinas, y lo que se refiere a telas en su tiempo libre se dedica a tejidos D. tejas tipicos, los venD. por docenas y contra pedidos, tambien en su casa tiene la venta D. huevos, el prestamo lo solicita porque necesita invertir mas en mercaderias para su negocio. El sueño D. silvia es que su negocio se agranD. y poder contar con mejores ingresos y que le permitan sus estudios a sus hijos y salir adelante en la vida. Agradece a Fape y Kiva por el apoyo que le dan atraves del credito.
texts.en:
Silvia Anabella, 40 years old, is married. She lives with her husband and six children, four of them under 18. Her husband helps her with the sale of fabrics such as table cloths, towels and curtains. As for weaving, she weaves traditional fabrics in her free time and sells them by the dozen or by the order. She also sells eggs from her home. She requests the loan because she needs to invest in more inventory for her business. Silvia's dream is to grow her business and increase her income so that her children can go to school and get ahead in life. She thanks Fape and Kiva for supporting her through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric weaving

loans.name: Nimecio Walter

texts.es: Nimecio se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno cuya producción de leche lo vende a Pil Andina (Planta industrializadota  de leche), vive junto a su   esposa y sus hijos  los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar. Es su primer  crédito en Impro y el primero vía Kiva. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de ganado vacuno.
texts.en:
Nimecio raises dairy cows. He sells their production to Pil Andina (an industrialized milk plant). He lives with his wife and children. The children are school age. This is his first loan with Impro and his first through Kiva. He will use the requested loan to buy a dairy cow.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es: Marcelo  vive en la  zona  Kallutaca, Provincia  los Andes, del Departamento La Paz. Se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno cuya producción de leche lo vende a Pil Andina (Planta industrializadota  de leche), vive junto a su   esposa y su bebe, también trabaja como chofer  propietario de una movilidad de transporte publico. El crédito es para compra de ganado. Es su primer  crédito en Impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Marcelo lives in the zone of Kallutaca, located in the Los Andes province and in the department of La Paz. He works raising cattle, whose milk he sells to PIL Andina (an industrial milk plant). He lives with his wife and baby. Marcelo also works as a public transportation driver. The loan requested is for the purchase of cattle. This is his first loan with IMPRO and the first with Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Teresa Beatriz

texts.es:
Teresa de 52 años, vive en una zona urbana llamada “Orquídeas” fue llamada así por la gran cantidad de flores orquídeas en su descubrimiento. Ella tiene una pequeña tienda   ubicada en la parte delantera de su casa, tiene con su esposo tres hijos. 

Ella comenzó vendiendo algunos artículos para papelería y con la motivación de ayudar con los gastos familiares. Poco a poco fue surtiendo el local con víveres desde ese tiempo hasta ahora trabaja desde las 06h15am hasta las 22:30pm todos los días. . 

Con el préstamo quiere surtir mas su negocio comprando arroz, papelería, azúcar y otros víveres. Ella quiere tener un negocio bien establecido con una combinación de tienda-papelería y así asegurar la vejez de ella y su esposo
texts.en:
Teresa, age 52, lives in an urban area called “Orquídeas” (Orchids). It was named this way because when it was discovered there was a great quantity of orchids there. She has a small store located in the front of her house. She lives with her husband and their three children. She started selling some stationery items because she wanted to help with the family expenses. Little by little she started stocking her store with supplies. From then on and up until now she works from 6:15 a.m. until 10:30 p.m. everyday. She wants to use the loan to further stock her business by purchasing rice, stationery items, sugar, and other supplies. She wants to have a well established business with a combination store and stationery shop. That way she will ensure her and her husband’s old age.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stationery items, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
MUJERES ALEGRES
EL  GRUPO MUJERES ALEGRES ESTA INTEGRADO POR 3 SEÑORAS   LA LIDER DEL GRUPO ES LA  SEÑORITA HERMELINDA  GILBERTA O. T.,   ELLA TIENE  25 AÑOS DE EDAD SU NEGOCIO ES LA VENTA  DE FRUTAS, GASEOSAS Y POR LA TARDE APROVECHA EN VENDER  ELOTES AZADOS, INICIO SU NEGOCIO HACE 12  AÑOS CON LA AYUDA DE SU HERMANA ,  VENDIENDO FRUTAS EN UNAS OFICINAS QUE QUEDAN CERCA DE LA VENTA DE SU HERMANA, LA FRUTA QUE ELLA VENDIA SE LO PROPORCIANABA SU HERMANA  LUEGO ELLA FUE TENIENDO SU GANANCIA Y LOGRO COMPRAR SU PROPIA FRUTA, VENDIENDO TAMBIEN GOLOSINAS, TRES AÑOS DESPUES PUDO TENER UN PEQUEÑO PUESTO EN LA 35 CALLE  GALERIAS DEL SUR ZONA 11 EN LA CAPITAL, DESDE AHÍ PUDO TENER YA  UNA VENTA SURTIDA DE GOLOSINAS Y  FRUTAS, SU MAYOR DESEO ES PODER SUPERAR EN SU PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO Y SURTIR CON MAS FRUTAS IMPORTADAS. LAS OTRAS MIEMBROS DEL GRUPO SON  LA SEÑORA  HILDA T.   TIENE UNA TORTILLERIA EN SU DOMICILIO DESDE HACE 8 AÑOS, SU  FAMILIA ESTA INTEGRADA DE  5 HIJOS TODOS MENORES DE EDAD, SU SUEÑO PARA SU NEGOCIO ES PODER TENER OTRO TIPO DE VENTA COMO  LEÑA  Y FRIJOL  PARA PODER OFRECERLA A SU CLIETELA, LA SEÑORA ANA ROSALIA  T. T.  SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE TORTILLAS  DESDE HACE 5 AÑOS, ESTA UBICADA EN SU CASA,  SUS TRES HIJOS  SON MENORES DE EDAD   SU MAYOR DESEO PARA SU NEGOCIO ES CONTRATAR A UNA PERSONA QUE LE AYUDE PARA PODER ATENDER LA DEMANDA QUE TIENEN EN SU NEGOCIO.  ESTAS SEÑORAS SOLICITAN ESTE CREDITO PORQUE COMO ELLAS MENCIONAN QUE TIENEN MUCHO PLANES Y SUEÑOS PARA SU VIDA PERO PARA ESO NECESITAN CAPITAL PARA TRABAJAR EN SUS NEGOCIOS.
texts.en:
Happy Women The Happy Women group is comprised of three women. Hermelinda Gilberta O. T. is the leader of the group. She is 25, and she sells fruits and soft drinks in the afternoons. She takes this opportunity to sell roasted corn on the cob. She started her business with help from her sister 12 years ago. She sold fruit in the offices close to where her sister was selling. The fruit that she sold was provided by her sister. She was earning money, and she managed to buy her own fruit. She also sold sweets. Three years later she was able to have her own small stand on 35th Street Galerias del Sur in zone 11 in the capital. From there she was able to have a business stocked with sweets and fruits. Her biggest wish is to be able to excel in her small business and stock it with imported fruits. Hilda T., another member of the group, has had a tortilla business in her house for eight years. Her family is comprised of five minor children. Her dream for her business is to be able to have another type of sales like firewood and beans to offer her customers. The other member of the group, Ana Rosalia T. T., has been selling tortillas for five years. Her business is in her house. She has three minor children. Her biggest wish for her business is to hire another person to help her. She wants to do this in order to take care of the demand that she has in her business. These women are requesting this loan because they have many plans and dreams for their lives. Therefore, they need the capital to work in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es: Franklin  vive zona  Quillviri, Provincia  Aroma, del Departamento La Paz , se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno cuya producción de leche lo vende a Pil Andina (Planta industrializadota  de leche), también trabaja como conductor de maquinaria pesada en el alcaldía de su zona, vive junto a su   esposa y sus hijos  los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar. El crédito será destinado a la compra de ganado. Es su primer  crédito en Impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Franklin lives in the Quillviri area, in the Aroma province in the Departament of La Paz. He breeds bovine cattle whose milk production is sold to Pil Andina (Milk Industrializing Factory). Also, he works as a driver of heavy equipment in his local town hall. He lives with his wife and children, who are of school age. The loan will be used to buy cattle. This is his first loan with Impro and his first loan through Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bovine cattle

loans.name: Sheyla María

texts.es: La señorita Sheyla María G. B. se dedica a la venta de calzado conjuntamente con su abuela, sus principales clientes son personal del poder judicial, Ministerio de Educación, vecinos.La solicitante es soltera no tiene carga familiar, vive con su madre y abuelita en pasaje el eden Acomayo Ica ,sueña con ampliar su negocio tener su casa propia por este mótivo solicita el préstamo, se propone otorgarle  el crédito por contar con buenas referencias acrediticias y personales.
texts.en:
Sheyla María G. B. works selling shoes with her grandmother. Their main customers are staff from the judicial branch, the Ministry of Education, and neighbors. She is single and does not have any dependents. She lives with her mother and grandmother on the street El Eden in Acomayo, an area of Ica. She dreams of expanding her business and having her own house, which is why she is requesting this loan. She qualifies to receive the loan for having good credit references and personal references.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Escolastico

texts.es: Escolastico vive en la zona  Pomposillo, Provincia  Aroma, del Departamento La Paz, junto a su   esposa y sus hijos  los cuales son personas mayores y tiene sus familias propias. Escolastico se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno cuya producción de leche la vende a Pil Andina (Planta industrializadota de leche). El crédito será para la compra de ganado.  Es el primer  crédito en Impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Escolastico lives in the zone of Pomposillo, province of Aroma, in the department of La Paz. He lives with his wife and children who are grown and have their own families. Escolastico works raising cattle that produce milk that he sells to Pil Andina (an industrial milk plant). This loan will be for buying cattle. It is his first loan from Impro and his first time on Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Constantino

texts.es: Constantino vive en la zona Huacallia, Provincia  Aroma, del Departamento La Paz, junto a su   esposa y sus hijos  los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar. Se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno cuya producción de leche la vende a Pil Andina (Planta industrializadota  de leche). El crédito será destinado a la compra de ganado vacuno. Es su primer  crédito en Impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Constantino lives in the zone of Huacallia, province of Aroma, department of La Paz. He lives with his wife and their children who are school age. He works raising cows that produce milk that he sells to Pil Andina (an industrial milk plant). This loan will be for buying more cattle. This is he first loan with Impro and his first time on Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo vive en la zona Chojasivi, Provincia  Los Andes, del Departamento La Paz, junto a sus hijos  los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar. Se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno cuya producción de leche la vende a Pil Andina (Planta industrializadota  de leche), también realiza trabajos de albañilería en diferentes sectores del departamento. El préstamo será para compra de ganado. Es su segundo  crédito en Impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Eduardo lives in the zone of Chojasivi, province of Los Andes, department of La Paz. He lives with his children who are school age. He works raising cattle that produce milk that he sells to Pil Andina (an industrial milk plant). He also works bricklaying in several parts of the department. This loan will be to buy cattle. It is his second loan with Impro and his first time on Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Verónica tiene 39 años, su actividad es la venta de frijoles y tortillas. Hace más de 11 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que fue por iniciativa propia que ella comenzó este medio de vida, por lo que ha sido muy difícil mantenerlo ya que ha tenido problemas de salud pues tiene 7 hijos es una mujer muy luchadora y responsable, pues siempre ha demostrado ser una buena Madre con sus hijos. Este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como maíz, leña, cal y frijoles. Ella sueña con que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Verónica is 39 years old. She works selling beans and tortillas. She has been doing this work for more than 11 years and began this way of life on her own. However, it has been very difficult to maintain the business as she has already had health problems and she has 7 children. She is a woman who is a fighter and responsible and she has always shown that she is a good mother for her children. This loan is to buy primary products such as corn, wood, lime and beans. Her dream is that her business continues growing.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for work

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario  vive en la zona  “Villa Esperanza” de la Ciudad de El Alto, junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos los cuales son mayores de edad. Mario  es retirado y percibe una renta mensual. El crédito será destinado para la compra de material de construcción para la construcción de su vivienda. Es su primer  crédito en Impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Mario lives in the zone “Villa Esperanza” in the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife and three children who are grown. Mario is retired and receives a monthly income. This loan will be used for buying building materials for construction on his house. This is his first credit with Impro and his first time on Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo vive en la zona  Chojñacollo, Provincia  los Andes, del Departamento La Paz, junto a su  esposa y  uno de sus hijos el cual se encuentra en edad escolar, sus otros hijos son mayores de dad y cada uno formó su propio hogar lejos de la comunidad. Guillermo se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno cuya producción de leche la vende a Pil Andina (Planta industrializadota  de leche). El crédito es para la compra de ganado.  Es su primer  crédito en Impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Guillermo lives in the neighbourhood of Chojñacollo, Los Andes province, La Paz department, together with his wife and their one child who still goes to school. Their other children are grown up and have their own homes a long way from the community. Guillermo earns his living by raising cows and selling the milk to PIL Andina, an industrial milk plant. The loan will be used to buy more cows. This is his first loan with both Impro and Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es: Tomás vive en la zona  Aconi, Provincia  Aroma, del Departamento La Paz junto a su   esposa y sus hijos  los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar. Se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno cuya producción de leche la vende a Pil Andina (Planta industrializadota  de leche). El crédito será destinado a compra de ganado. Es su primer  crédito en Impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Tomás lives in Aconi neighbourhood of Aroma province in the department of La Paz together with his wife and school-aged children. He earns his living by raising cows and selling the milk to PIL Andina, an industrial milk plant. The loan will be used to buy more cows. This is his first loan with both Impro and Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Djamilzade

texts.ru:
Djamilzade E. 24 let. Ona ne zamujem i jivet vmeste so svoyey semyoy v Absheron regione. E. zakonchila shkolu a potom postupila v universitet.

Molodoy chelovek kotoroqo vi videte na fotoqrafii eto Brat Elvini Mahammad. Uje 7 let kak oni zanimayutsya etim biznessom perevozki stroitelnix materialov. Eto semeyniy bizness eyo otec toje zanimayetsya perevozkoy stroy materialov on i nauchil svoyeqo sina etomu biznessu. Seychas oni nujdayutsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kuput zapchasti dlya mashini.
texts.en:
E. Djamilzade is 24 years old. She is single. She lives with her relatives in the Absheron Region. She has finished high school and is now a university student. The young man you see in the photo is E.’s brother Mahammad. He has been in the business of transporting construction materials for 7 years. This is a family business; his father also transports construction materials, and taught this business to his son. At present Mahammad needs 2,000 AZN in order to purchase automotive spare parts.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts

loans.name: Reyna De La Paz

texts.es:
Reyna es una señora D. 53 años D. edad, está casada y vive con su esposo y un nieto en San Rafael Oriente D. San Miguel, ella se dedica a la crianza D. cerdos  el negocio inicio por que  su esposo desD. hace muchos años  se había dedicado a este tipo D. negocio y le brindo todo el apoyo para que ella diera inicio al cuidado D. los cerdos; ella no tiene un horario fijo para la atención a los cerdos.
Hoy Reyna está solicitando un préstamo por que desea comprar más cerdos y alimentación para los mismos. Dicha inversión le ayudara a fortalecer su negocio y ha obtener mayores ingresos para cubrir gastos familiares. Ella corre el riesgo D. que se le enferme algún cerdo el cual sería una perdida para ella.
Su sueño es hacer crecer el negocio logrando una granja D. cerdos más granD. que mejore sus condiciones económicas a largo plazo.
texts.en:
Reyna is a 53-year-old woman who is married and lives with her husband and grandson in San Rafael Oriente, located in San Miguel. She works raising pigs – she began her business because for many years, her husband had worked in this type of business and he provided her with all of the support so that she could start raising pigs. She does not have a specific schedule that she goes by in caring for the pigs.

Today, Reyna is requesting this loan because she wants to buy more pigs, as well as feed for them. This investment will help her to strengthen her business and to earn more to cover family expenses. There is a risk that a pig will become sick, which will be a loss of money for her.

Her dream is to have the business grow and to have a larger farm for the pigs, which will improve her economic condition in the long run.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pigs

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia se dedica a la cría D. ganado vacuno cuya producción D. leche la venD. a Pil Andina (Planta industrializadota  D. leche), vive junto a su  esposo el cual trabaja como albañil y sus hijos los cuales están en edad escolar. Es el primer  crédito en Impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Lidia earns her living by raising cows and selling the milk to PIL Andina, an industrial milk plant. She lives with her husband who is a bricklayer and their school-aged children. This is her first loan with both Impro and Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Eymin Johilia

texts.es: La Señora Eymin Johila  tiene su negocio que es la venta de cosméticos, ella tiene 30 años y es casada. Ella realiza sus actividades diarias del hogar antes de salir a vender a ofrecer sus diferentes productos, Eymin trabaja desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 8 la noche por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar sus ingresos. Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar polvos, cremas, perfumes y tratamientos. Por lo que se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Eymin Johila has a cosmetics sales business. She is 30 years old and married. She completes the daily household chores before leaving to sell her different products. Eymin works from 8am – 8pm, as she is always looking for a way to improve her earnings. She is requesting the loan to purchase powders, creams, perfumes and treatments. She promises to make her payments according to the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Manuel David

texts.es:
Manuel de 43 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil lugar caracterizado por su montañas y caminos de tierra,  Su casa es de cemento y caña, y tienen una hija de 12 años.  

Desde pequeño el papa le enseño a elaborar zapatos y hacer sandalias con tiras. Por la falta de oportunidades el decidió continuar con este negocio desde su casa, comenzando a readecuar una parte de su casa para poder mantener a su familia.  Ahora trabaja en horas variadas y dos personas le ayudan hacer las sandalias y zapatos. 

Para tener mas producción de sandalias quiere comprar con el préstamo tiras, plantillas, hilos y así tener mas zapatos para vender a los almacenes. En el futuro quiere tener un taller de zapatos pero fuera de su casa.
texts.en:
Manuel is 43 years old and lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil in Paraíso, a place distinguished by its mountains and dirt roads. His house is made of cement and reeds and he has a 12-year-old daughter. At a young age his father taught him how to make shoes and to make sandals with straps. Because of a lack of opportunities he decided to continue this business at home in order to support his family. He also remodeled part of his house. Now he works varied hours and he has two people that help him make shoes and sandals. To increase his production of sandals he wants to buy straps, insoles, thread and also, to have more shoes to sell to stores. In the future, he would like to have a workshop away from his home for making shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase insoles, thread and straps

loans.name: Alexis Jose

texts.es:
Alexis José hace 4 años y tiene 1 hijo, su esposa se dedica al hogar.
El se considera un luchador, ya que el negocio al que él se dedica es duro pero se busca la forma de ganarse la vida. El es un vendedor ambulante, vende ropa y cosméticos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7 hasta las 8 de la noche. Es algo cansado pero que tiene que hacerlo por el bienestar de su familia. Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar materia prima pues así podrá satisfacer la demanda. Su sueño es tener un local comercial para vender en un lugar fijo.
texts.en:
Alexis José has one son and his wife is a housewife. He considers himself to be a fighter, since the business that he dedicates himself to is very tough, but it allows him to make a living. Alexis José is a traveling salesman. He sells clothing and cosmetics. He works every day from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. This is a tiring job, but he has to work for the well-being of his family. He will use this credit to buy raw materials for his business so that he can meet the demand of his clients. His dream is to have a store so that he can sell his products from a fixed location.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw materials for his business

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr: yao a ouvert en 2007 son restaurant qu'il a appelé "MA PART", il a ouvert son restaurant près d'un carrefour, ainsi il attire plus de clientèle. il a déjà sollicité et obtenu de WAGES un crédit qu'il a bien remboursé. il sollicite son deuxième crédit pour se réapprovisionner avec 16 cartons de pâtes alimentaires, 12 cartons de couscous, 6 cartons de petits pois, 8 cartons de tomates en boîtes de conserve, de l'huile , du café et divers.
texts.en:
Yao has opened his restaurant in 2007 and named “Ma Part “ [My share]. His restaurant is next to an intersection, which is why attracts more customers. Yao had already obtained a loan from WAGES in the past and repaid it well. He is now seeking a new loan in order to replenish his food stock by purchasing 16 boxes of pasta, 12 boxes of couscous, 6 cartons of peas, 8 cartons of canned tomatoes as well as oil, coffee, etc.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing foods necessary for his restaurant

loans.name: Samuel Isidro

texts.es:
Samuel tiene 45 años de edad está casado,  vive con su esposa y tienen dos hijos de 14 y 12 años de edad quienes dependen económicamente de él. Se dedica a la siembra de papayas oficio que aprendió de su padre que también se dedicaba a este tipo de cultivo, actualmente ha sembrado 80 plantas de esta fruta y don Samuel no posee un horario fijo de trabajo. El tipo de fruta que el cultiva es demandada en el mercado por lo que don Samuel cuenta con la certeza de que su producción será vendida.
Él está solicitando un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes  e insecticidas para darle el tratamiento necesario a la plantación.
Esto ayudara a contar con los materiales necesarios para mantener la plantación en buen estado y que las plagas no afecten su producción, obteniendo una mejor cosecha de papayas y que estás puedan ser comercializadas. 
Él aspira a corto plazo ser un gran productor de papayas, lograr mejores ingresos que le brinden una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Samuel is 45 years old and married. He lives with his wife and their two children ages 14 and 12, who are economically dependent on him. He is dedicated to the planting of papayas craft that he learned from his father who also did this type of cultivation. He has now planted 80 plants of this fruit and does not have a fixed work schedule. The type of fruit he grows is in demand in the market and Samuel is certain that his production will be sold. He is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of fertilizers and insecticides to provide the necessary treatment for his plantation. This will help to have the materials needed to maintain the good state of the plantation and make sure that pests do not affect production. This will also help obtain a better harvest of papayas so that they can be commercialized. He aspires to be a great short-term producer of papayas and earn more income to provide a better life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to grow papayas

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Ana Agentina

texts.es:
Ana de 48 años, vive en una zona urbana llamada “Orquídeas” fue llamada así porque encontraron una gran cantidad de flores orquídeas en su descubrimiento. Ella tiene una “ferretería” tienda de repuestos y artículos de construccion.  

Hace 4 años atrás ella trabajaba como empleada en un almacén de repuestos pero como se enfermo tubo que abandonar su trabajo e iniciar una actividad que le generara ingresos y que le ayudadaza a ganar dinero para poder mantener a su familia. Ahora ella tiene una ferretería pequeña, trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 23h00pm todos los días. Vende tubos, pinturas, materiales de construcción. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar zinc, clavos, ladrillos para surtir mas su ferretería. En el futuro quiere aumentar su ferretería para que los ingresos aseguren la vejez de ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
Ana is 48 years old and lives in the urban zone called "Orquídeas." The area is called this because they found a large quantity of orchid flowers here when it was discovered. Ana has a hardware store that sells spare parts and construction materials. Four years ago she was working as an employee at a warehouse of spare parts but she got sick and had to stop working there and begin a different job that would generate income and help her bring in money to be able to support her family. Now she has a small hardware store and she works from 7:00am to 11:00pm everyday. She sells tubes, paint, and construction materials. With this loan she wants to buy zinc, nails, and bricks to supply her store. In the future she wants her hardware store to grow so her income will provide for her and her husband in their old age.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tubes, nails, zinc

loans.name: Azanmassou

texts.fr: S. a ouvert  depuis plus de 9 ans une imprimerie qu'il exploite. il réalise de grandes recettes à l'approche de la rentrée scolaires, et comme ce moment est arrivé il veut pouvoir mettre tous les atouts de son côté et pouvoir bien travailler. il sollicite de WAGES un deuxième crédit pour acheter les matières premières indispensable à son activité d'imprimerie pour pouvoir répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle en ce début de rentrée scolaire.
texts.en:
About nine years ago, Mr. Soussou has opened a printing shop he still operates. When the new school year approaches, he is able to raise significant revenues. Now that this time of the year has come again, he would like to be able to do everything possible in order to do a good job. He is seeking his tenth loan from WAGES in order to purchase supplies necessary to his printing shop in order to meet to his client’s needs at the beginning of this new school y

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing printing supplies

loans.name: Angel Francisco

texts.es: Ángel Francisco tiene su actividad económica que es la venta de de mercadería en general, hace mas de 29 años que se dedica a esta actividad, pues siempre está buscando la forma de sacar a su familia, pues ha demostrado que es una hombre responsable ya que ha pagado sus cuotas a tiempo. A pesar de los costos tan altos de los productos que ofrece. Este financiamiento será para la compra de ropa y calzado.
texts.en:
Ángel Francisco sells general merchandise for a living. He has been doing this for more than 29 years and is always looking for ways to provide for his family. He has shown that he is a responsible man by making his payments on time, despite the high cost of the products he offers. With this loan he will purchase clothing and footwear.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and footwear for his business

loans.name: Aku Justine

texts.fr: A. est une dame mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de wonyémé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de lomé. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes et de produits cosmétiques. elle a commencé ce commerce en 2000. Sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. son stock de pagnes est en baisse, elle voudrait se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 6 pièces de pagnes hollande et divers autres qualités de pagnes
texts.en:
Mrs. A. is married and the mother of two children. She lives with her family in the Wonyéme district, one of the peripheral areas of the city of Lomé. She makes a living by selling “pagnes” [traditional colorful fabric] and cosmetic person. Her customer base is very diverse. As she is running low on “pagnes”, she would like to restock, which is why she is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to purchase six sets of [high-quality] Holland “pagnes” as well as other "pagnes" of various quality grades

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing traditional "pagnes" fabric

loans.name: Los Genios De La Alcancia Comunal Group

texts.es:
ELIZABETH M. C. tiene 43 años vive en el AA.HH diez de octubre en el distrito de san Juan de Lurigancho.-es conviviente madre de siete hijos de los cuales cuatro hijos ya son independientes y tres mas pequeños que aun los tiene que educar.
 Elizabeth anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de cosmeticos,hace un año y medio se dedica a la venta de ropa, pero no es el único trabajo también es auxiliar de educación en un colegio y dentro de ello también dicta clases de alfabetización.
 Elizabeth ejerce el cargo de presidenta de la alcancía“LOS GENIOS DE LA ALCANCIA COMUNAL”es una alcancía nueva formada por 7 entusiasta y comprometidas socias que viven en una misma urbanización; conocieron a EDAPROSPO –PROSPERIDA gracias a una amiga que ya había realizado prestamos con nosotros; Ella agradece la confianza  que lo brindamos al otorgarle el primer préstamo.
 El sueño de Elizabeth es ver a sus hijos desarrollados profesionalmente y terminar con algunos acabados en su casa, porque ella nos cuenta que todo lo que gana como educadora y parte de su negociolo lo invierte en educar a sus hijos porque es la mejor herecia que los puede dejar, ya que su esposo lo ayuda con los gastos de la canasta familiar.
El reciente préstamo lo utilizara en pagar los estudios de uno de sus hijos que se encuentran estudiando en la universidad.
  En la foto la señora Elizabeth se encuentra de pie tiene el cabello rubio y viste una polera manga larga color gris.
texts.en:
Elizabeth M. C. is 43 years old and lives with her common-law husband in a community called "Diez de Octubre" [October 10th] in the San Juan de Lurigancho district of Lima, Peru. They have seven children, four of whom are already living independently. The three youngest are still in school. Elizabeth used to work selling cosmetics, but for the past year and a half she has been selling clothing. This is not her only job, as she also works as a teaching assistant at a local school and teaches literacy classes there. Elizabeth is the president of a communal bank called “Los Genios de la Alcancía Comunal” [The Geniuses of Communal Banking]. It is a new communal bank whose members are 7 enthusiastic and dedicated women who live in the same community. They found out about EDAPROSPO –PROSPERIDA [the Kiva field partner] thanks to a friend who had taken out a loan with the group. Elizabeth is grateful for the confidence shown in her with the granting of this loan. Elizabeth's dream is to see her children have successful careers and to finish with some home improvements. The money she earns as a teacher and part of her business profits go towards her children's education, because it is the best legacy that she can leave them. Her husband helps to cover the family's everyday expenses. This loan will be used to pay educational expenses for one of her children, who is a college student. In the photograph, Elizabeth is standing up. She has light hair and is wearing a long-sleeved gray shirt.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for educational expenses for one of the member's children, who is a college student

loans.name: Casiano

texts.es:
El cliente es un señor de 38 años está casado con la señora Florencia Claros, juntos tienen 2 hijas las cuales están estudiando, son una familia de escasos recursos  económicos ya que no tienen casa propia, viven en la casa de su padre de 80 años  el cual está muy enfermo se quedo siego, por lo tanto el cliente tiene que estar al cuidado de su padre, ya que después les heredara la casa aunque dicha casa está en muy malas condiciones.
El señor Casiano vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la provincia de Punata en la comunidad de Chilcar Grande, su principal actividad es la agricultura, produce Papa, Tomate, Cebolla, Zanahoria y flor, desde muy pequeños ambos se dedican a esta actividad ya que su esposa no sabe leer y escribir, ella no tenía la oportunidad de estudiar por falta de recursos económicos.

El préstamo es destinado para la compra de semillas y abonos y así empezar la siembra de sus productos para la cosecha de este fin de año.
Entre sus sueños y metas del señor Casiano realizar una nueva construcción en la casa antigua que le heredara su padre, otra de sus sueños más importantes es que sus dos hijas estudien una carrera profesional y de esa manera tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Casiano, 38, is married to Florencia Claros and they have two daughters who are in school. They are a family with few economic resources. They don’t own their own house but live in his 80-year-old father’s house. The father is very very ill and is now blind so Casiano must care for him. Eventually he will inherit the house even though it is in very bad condition. Casiano lives in the city of Cochabamba, Punata province, Chilcar Grande community. His main activity is farming: he grows potatoes, tomatoes, onions, carrots and flowers. From very young ages, both of them have been farmers for his wife is illiterate; she never had the economic resources to make schooling possible. The loan will be used to buy seed and manure to start this end of year planting cycle. Among his dreams and goals is to rebuild the old house he’ll inherit from his father and another important goal is that his two daughters study professional careers so that they can have a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed and manure.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama O. sells cloth at Elmina. She has acquired a senior high level of education. She is divorced and has two children.

Ama has been selling cloth for five years and, with the income she makes from her sales, she is able to take care of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more cloth to sell.

Ama hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more cloth to sell

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame E. is married and has seven dependents. She has no educational background.

Maame sells fresh plantains, cassava and tomatoes at Elmina and uses her income to educate her children as a way of supporting her husband in taking care of them.

Maame will use the loan to purchase more plantain and cassava to sell. With the new earnings from her expanded business, she plans to save to invest in the sale of other foodstuffs.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava and plantain to sell

loans.name: Esther Ekua

texts.en:
Esther Ekua E. is divorced and has five dependents. She has been through junior high school.

Esther sells fresh and fried fish at Elima and uses the income she makes from her sales to take care of her dependents. She will use the loan to purchase more fish to sell.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Esther plans to save to further her dependents’ education.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Kakraba Ekua

texts.en:
Kakraba Ekua E. is divorced and has ten dependents. 

Kakraba is into the sale of hair pomade, body lotions, powder and so on and has been in this trade for ten years years now. She uses her income to take care of her children.

Kakraba will use the loan to purchase more of her cosmetics to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans on reinvesting in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more of her cosmetics to resell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. sells cooked rice and yams and serves them with tomato sauce and palava sauce (a type of stew) at Elmina.

Comfort has been through junior high school. She is divorced with two children. 

Comfort’s loan will be used to buy a bag of rice and more yams to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy a bag of rice and more yams to cook for sale

loans.name: Aurea

texts.es: Aurea, de 41 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Luis tiene 44 años y de su joven hija, juntos y con muchas ganas de salir adelante habitan en un barrio ubicado  al norte de la ciudad. Cada día se despierta con los primeros rayos de luz, pues debe empezar a preparar los desayunos que ofrece a sus asiduos comensales, negocio que viene realizando desde hace 3 años. Es así que antes de las 8 de la mañana sale con su pequeña carretilla a ofrecer  desayuno a sus clientes, quienes trabajan en diferentes negocios de la zona. De esta manera expende bebidas calientes y panes con distintos rellenos, en donde casi toda la mañana hasta el mediodía termina por vender todo lo que había preparado, y satisfecha se dirige a su casa para luego continuar suministrarse de ingrediente para el día siguiente que tiene que preparar desayuno. De las ganancias que recibe ayuda a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su hija cuando no estudia, pero generalmente el trabajo lo realiza sola. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar el negocio e instalar un puesto de venta de desayunos y comidas en algún mercado de su zona. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete  pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Aurea tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes al por mayor que necesita para seguir ofreciendo desayunos; además una parte también la destinará para comprar 2 llantas para cambiar las antiguas del auto con el que trabaja su esposo.
texts.en:
Aurea, 41, lives in her own house with her husband, Luis, 44, and their young daughter. Together, with a strong wish to get ahead in life, they live in a neighborhood in the north side of the city. She rises at dawn every day to start preparing the breakfasts that she offers her regular diners. She has been in this business for 3 years. So it is that before 8am we can find her out with her cart selling breakfasts to her customers who are employed in various area businesses. She sells hot beverages and various stuffed breads all morning and is usually sold out by noon. She returns home satisfied with her sales and starts to get the ingredients for the next day’s breakfast preparation. Profits from these sales help her husband meet household expenses. Sometimes, when her daughter isn’t doing school work, she helps out but she usually works by herself.
