As an enterprising woman, she plans for the future to expand her business and set up a stand in one of the area markets to sell breakfasts and lunches. This is the 2nd loan from MFP and she promises to repay on time because she is very grateful to all the people who funded the loan that will allow her to keep working in search of progress. Aurea plans to use the funds to buy ingredients she needs to continue making breakfasts at wholesale. In addition, she will use part of the funds to buy two tires to replace the old ones on her husband’s car that he uses for work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and ingredients for the breakfasts she makes.

loans.name: Ewura

texts.en:
Ewura E. sells kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) and fish at Elmina. She has not received any form of education. She lives together with her husband and five dependents, supporting her husband in the general upkeep of the home.

Ewura’s loan will be used to acquire more maize to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to further her dependents’ education.

loans.use: To acquire more maize to cook for sale

loans.name: Geogina

texts.en:
Geogina A. sells grilled fish at Elmina. She has received junior high education. She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a trader. She supports her husband in providing food, clothing and shelter for the family.

Geogina’s loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to grill and sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save for a commercially-made grill.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to grill to sell

loans.name: Sister Abena

texts.en:
Sister Abena E. sells raw maize and as well banku (a local dish made from corn dough and served hot with soup) at Elmina. She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a trader. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She has attained a junior high level of education.

Abena’s loan will be used to buy more bags of maize to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a storehouse.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize to sell

loans.name: Theresah

texts.en:
Theresah E. goes to the market to buy maize and sells it in both small and large quantities at Elmina. She has received junior high education. She is divorced and responsibly takes care of seven dependents.

Theresah’s loan will be used to buy more bags of maize to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to provide a meaningful education to her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba A. sells kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) at Elmina. She has no educational background. She is married and lives with her four children.

Aba has been selling kenkey for some time now and responsibly supports her husband in educating her children.

Aba’s loan will be used to buy extra bags of maize to prepare more kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy extra bags of maize to prepare more kenkey for sale

loans.name: Rilmar Roman

texts.es:
El señor Rilmar tiene 33 años es soltero y tiene un hijo de 9 años a su cargo, ya que la madre los abandono y se fue a España por lo tanto el cliente tuvo que hacerse cargo de su hijo, aunque tiene un poco de dificultad para cuidarlo ya que él trabaja todo el día  y lo deja a cargo de su hermana, como se puede ver la vida del niño es muy triste ya que no puede disfrutar de una familia estable como cualquier niño de su edad.

Rilmar vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba  en la zona de Pacata Alta, no tiene casa propia vive en la casa de sus padres, pero él tiene un terreno en Villa Tunari  en la zona del trópico en la  cual está construyendo una cabañas y posteriormente alquilarlas a los turistas y de esa manera tener más ingresos para ofrecer un mejor nivel de vida.

Rilmar trabaja en la alcaldía de la comunidad de Chimore el cargo que ocupa es Cotizador.
El préstamo será destinado para la compra de material para la construcción de dichas cabañas. Entre sus principales metas y sueños es terminar de construir las cabañas y de esta manera generar más ingresos para poder ofrecer un mejor nivel de vida y que su hijo estudia una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Rilmer, 33, is single but has a 9-year-old son in his care because the child’s mother abandoned them and went to Spain. He was left in charge of his son’s care. However, it is a bit difficult to care for him because he must be at work all day. His sister takes care of his son but one can see that the child’s life is very sad because he can’t enjoy life in a stable family like any other child his age. Rilmer lives in the city of Cochabamba, Pacata Alta zone. He doesn’t own his own home but lives in his parents’ house. However, he does have a lot in Villa Tunari in the tropical zone where he is building cabins to rent eventually to tourists and thus have more income in order to offer a better standard of living. Rilmer is employed by the City of Chimore as an Estimator. The loan will be used to buy building materials and supplies for the above mentioned cabins. Among his main goals and dreams are to finish building the cabins thus generating more income to offer a better quality of life and that his son study a professional career.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Elshad

texts.ru:
Elshad G. 23 qoda. On ne jenat. Elshad  yavlyayetsya IDP personom ,on pereselenec iz Fuzuli regiona seychas projivayet v Absheron regione. 

Elshad 3 qod tamu nazad nachal etot bizness. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo dyadi,kotoriy pomoq yemu otkrit kafe. Seychas Elshad nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit stoli i stulya dlya kafe.
texts.en:
Elshad G. is 23 years old and single. He is an Internally Displaced Person, a refugee from the Fuzuli Region currently living in the Absheron Region. He launched his business there years ago, having learned it from his uncle, who helped him get the café started. Now Elshad needs 2000 AZN in order to buy tables and chairs for his café.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Papa Kouly

texts.fr: Monsieur Papa Kouly T. est un jeune commerçant célibataire en son état est un boutiquier vendeur d'alimentation générale dans la communauté rurale de FISSEl située à quelque 50 km de Mbour .Monsieur T. a une expérience de plus de 3ans dans le secteur . Ainsi il sollicite ce prêt pour accroitre son commerce dans sa localité également étant soutien de sa famille il pourra générer plus de bénéfice pour aider ses parents
texts.en:
Mr. Papa Kouly T., a young unmarried trader, is a grocery shopkeeper in the rural community of Fissel located about 50 km from Mbour. Mr. T. has more than 3 years experience in the business. He is requesting this loan to increase his trade in his community. As he is supporting his family, he will also be able to generate more profit to help his parents.

Translated from French by viviane reignier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMMERCE

loans.name: Zenon

texts.es:
El señor Zenón López V. tiene 38 años de edad es conviviente más de 7 años con la señora Aurelia Peralta Fernández, tienen 4 hijos dependientes que estudian en nivel primaria, se dedican a la producción agrícola de papa, haba, oca, papaliza, tienen 5 cabezas de ganado vacuno lo cual se encarga de cuidar la esposa aparte de ayudar a su esposo en la parte agrícola y del cuidado de sus hijos mandar  a la escuela en la hora, la familia viven en Colomi comunidad Segunda Candelaria sindicato Chullpani hacia el norte.

El señor Zenón y su esposa vinieron a consultar a CIDRE para sacar un crédito razones que les falto dinero para comprar abono orgánico (gallinaza) y dos cabezas de ganado vacuno (yunta) de tal modo necesita para usar en las faenas agrícolas arar la tierra, sembrar y aporcar sus cultivos, según ellos nos comentan lo que producen les sirve para alimentación y ingreso económico anual, de esta forma mantiene a su familia a la vez que sus hijos salgan profesionales y que ya no se queden como el así en este rubro.
texts.en:
Mr. Zenón López V., 38, has lived with his life partner, Mrs. Aurelia Peralta Fernández, for over 7 years. They have four dependent children in elementary school. They farm potatoes, lima beans, oca (an Andean tuber), papalisa (another Andean tuber). They also own five head of cattle that his wife tends to besides helping him with the farming chores and caring for the children seeing that they are sent off to school on time. The family lives in Colomi, Segunda Candelaria community, Chullpany syndicate, towards the north. Zenón and his wife came to CIDRE to see if they could get a loan because they needed funds to buy organic manure (fowl) and two head of cattle (yoke team) to use for the farming chores of plowing, planting and hilling. They tell us that what they produce serves both for their own nutrition and for annual income. This way he can support his family and help his children become professionals so that they won’t have to stay in the same line of work as their parents.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure.

loans.name: Djifa

texts.fr: A. exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes, elle fait ce commerce depuis  2000, le stock dont elle dispose actuellement ne lui permet pas de satisfaire les besoins de ses clients.elle sollicite donc de WAGES un crédit qui lui permettra de rehausser son stock avec 4 pièces de pagnes de qualité phoénix, 3 pièces de pagnes de qualité hitarget et divers. elle est mariée et a une personne à sa charge.
texts.en:
Mrs.A. is a retailer of « pagnes », she has been in this business since 2000. Her current stock does not allow her to satisfy her customers needs, so she requests a loan from WAGES, in order to increase her stock with 4 pieces of Phoenix "pagnes", 3 pieces of Hitarget "pagnes" and others. She is married and has one dependent person.

Translated from French by viviane reignier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing "pagnes"

loans.name: Maria Betty

texts.es: La Señora Betty tiene su librería - bazar, donde atiende también con su fotocopiadora en el dia y venta de salchipapas y hot dog, por las noches, su tienda esta en la zona de Pampahasi al frente de un colegio de la zona, por esto tiene mucha venta, es una cliente antigua y muy responsable, trabaja desde el año 2006 con nuestra institución, vive en la misma zona con su esposo que tiene su trailer con el que viaja constantemente llevando carga y constantemente esta fuera de la ciudad, tiene una pequeña hijita. El crédito que solicita ahora es para comprar material de escritorio y juguetes para el bazar ya que como esta al frente del colegio, tiene pedidos de estos productos, esta muy agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Betty has a bookstore-general store where she also offers photocopying services during the daytime and at night she sells salchipapas (fried potatoes with fried sausages). Her store is located in the Pampahasi neighborhood in front of an area school so her sales are good. She is a longstanding, very responsible client who has collaborated with our institution since 2006. She lives in the same neighborhood with her husband who owns a truck that he uses constantly to haul cargo so he’s often out of town. She has a young daughter. The loan she is asking for will be used to buy office supplies and toys for the store because, since it’s in front of a school, she has pending orders for these kinds of items. She is very grateful to the institution for the support given.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies and toys.

loans.name: Samba

texts.fr: Monsieur Samba D. est un jeune cultivateur qui s'active dans le maraichage dans la communauté rurale de FISSEL, marié et père de famille il a une expérience de 10 ans dans le secteur . Ce prêt intervient dans le cadre de l'acquisition de semence et de produits phytosanitaires liés à son exploitation agricole .Ainsi il pourra produire plus de légumes et lui permettra de survivre et de générer plus de bénéfices et être en même temps auto suffisant
texts.en:
Mr. Samba D. is a young farmer who engages in truck farming in the rural community of FISSEL. Married and the head of household, he has 10 years experience in the sector. This loan is for the purpose of purchasing seeds and phytosanitary products for his farm. Thus, he will be able to produce more vegetables, which will enable him to survive and to make a larger profit. At the same time, this will make him self-sufficient.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Truck Farming

loans.name: Diaga

texts.fr: Monsieur Diaga D. est un jeune cultivateur qui s'active dans le maraichage dans la communauté rurale de FISSEL, marié et père de famille il a une expérience de 10 ans dans le secteur . Ce prêt intervient dans le cadre de l'acquisition de semence et de produits phytosanitaires liés à son exploitation agricole .Ainsi il pourra produire plus de légumes et lui permettra de survivre et de générer plus de bénéfices et être en même temps auto suffisant
texts.en:
Mr. Diaga D. is a young farmer engaged in truck farming in the rural community of FISSEL. Married and the head of household, he has 10 years experience in the sector. This loan is for the purpose of purchasing seeds and phytosanitary products for his farm. Thus, he will be able to produce more vegetables, which will enable him to survive and to make a larger profit. At the same time, this will make him self-sufficient.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Truck Farming

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: El Sr. Roberto Vive en la localidad de Porvenir distante a 40 km del municipio de  el Torno, nació en el departamento de Sucre Capital del Estado Plurinacional de Bolivia, su actividad principal es la agricultura, su esposa se dedica  al cuidado de sus dos hijos pequeños, no tienen domicilio propio viven en casa alquilada, tienen una parcela donde pronto edificaran una casa de madera, el destino del crédito es para contratar mano de obra para preparar la tierra donde sembrara maíz, la cual es su única fuente de ingreso para su familia ya que con esta actividad el solo mantiene el hogar, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Roberto lives in Porvenir located 40 kilometers from El Torno. He was born in Sucre, capital of Bolivia. He is a farmer. His wife cares for their two young children. They don’t own their own home but live in a rented abode. They own a lot where they will soon build a wood house. The loan will be used to hire laborers to prepare the soil for corn planting which is the family’s only source of income since this activity supports the home. He is very grateful for the help the institution has provided.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For planting and covering young plants.

loans.name: Adjoa Sika

texts.fr: M. adjoa est une femme très dynamique, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de soviépé. elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans la ville de kpalimé. elle vend son charbon aux femmes de son quartier qui l'utilise pour faire cuir les aliments. elle a constaté une baisse de son stock de marchandises. elle voudrait se réapprovisionner en achetant 20 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
M. Adjoa is a very dynamic woman. She is married, has one child and lives with her family in the Soviépé neighbourhood. She gets her supplies in the interior of the country, in the town of Kpalimé. She sells her charcoal to women in the neighbourhood who use it for cooking. She has noticed a decrease in her stock of merchandise. She would like to stock up by purchasing 20 bags of charcoal.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy charcoal

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
El señor Tomas Domínguez Ramírez tiene 32 años de edad es casado con la señora Carmen Mairana Siles hace 10 años atrás, viven en Colomi Comunidad Duraznos Pampa más de 6 años, tienen dos hijos con edad de 9 y de 7 años que estudian en nivel primaria.                                                                                                             
El señor y su esposa nos cuentan que mas antes vivían en el Municipio de Ayopaya lo cual no tenían suficiente recursos económicos ni para el estudio de sus hijos, porque en el rubro a la que se dedicaban producción agrícola les fue mal, mucha enfermedad en sus cultivos que causaron pérdidas totales; De tal modo el señor Tomas Domínguez y su esposa se decidieron trasladarse a la comunidad de Duraznos Pampa dentro del Municipio de Colomi, ahora que económicamente no tienen ningún problema siembran papa, locoto llevan a vender a la feria semanal de Colomi y variedad de verduras para la alimentación de su familia, ellos se apersonaron a la oficina de CIDRE a solicitar un préstamo para comprar un camión de abono orgánico (gallinaza) y productos agroquímicos, con el dinero que tenia compro un vehículo y para la siembra no tienen capital para comprar los insumos agrícolas, ellos piensan no volver más a la comunidad donde vivían mas antes.
texts.en:
Tomas Domínguez Ramírez, age 32, has been married to Carmen Marrana Siles for ten years. They have lived Colomi in the Duraznos Pampa community for over six years. They have two children, ages nine and seven. The children go to elementary school. He and his wife tell us that they used to live in the Ayopaya municipality. It did not have sufficient economic resources, not even for their children’s education. In their area, farming production, it went very poorly for them. There were a lot of diseases in their crops, which caused total losses. Therefore, Tomas and his wife decided to move to the Duraznos Pampa community in the Colomi municipality. Now they do not have financial problems planting potatoes and chilies. They take them to sell at the weekly fair in Colomi, and an assortment of vegetable is for feeding their family. They came to CIDRE’s office to request a loan to buy a truckload of organic fertilizer (poultry manure) and agrochemical products. They used the money they had to buy a vehicle, and they do not have the money to buy agricultural supplies for planting. They do not plan on returning to the community where they used to live.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and seeds for their agricultural activity

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El Sr. FRANCISCO vive en la zona del Plan 3000, tiene su taller de gomería, tiene 2 hijos, su esposa tiene en el mismo taller una venta de dulces, soda, panchito, asadito y empanadas, el Sr. Francisco se dedica a la gomería desde hace 20 años, el crédito que esta solicitando es para comprar una compresora de aire mas grande porque la que tiene no le abastece para atender a sus clientes, el ha aumentado su clientela y por esa razón esta invirtiendo en otra compresora, tiene muchas ganas de superación junto con su esposa que le ayuda, desean comprarse una casita, están muy agradecidos con la institución por apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco lives in the Plan 3000 zone. He has a tire repair shop. He has two children and his wife works from the same shop, selling sweets, sodas, panchito [fried and salted peanuts], barbecue, and empanadas. Mr. Francisco has been working in tire repair for 20 years. He is requesting this loan to buy a larger air compressor because the one he has does not serve to meet his customers' needs. He has increased his clientele, so this is why he is investing in another compressor. He has a strong desire to get ahead, together with his wife, who helps him. They hope to buy a small house. They are also very grateful to the organization for the support offered to them.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy an air compressor

loans.name: Leonid

texts.en:
Leonid is married with two grown up children. He lives and works in Berdyansk, which is a great resort place on Azov Sea. Leonid owns a small business selling various electrical goods such as outlets, wires, drills, and so forth.

He started this business 15 years ago. Affordable prices and excellent client service have been the keys to success. Leonid enjoys his business and plans to develop it further. Leonid's business goal is to start another location. 

Leonid is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnas to purchase additional inventory. He hopes to receive additional income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase  additional inventory.

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es:
Blanca de 52 años, vive en una zona urbana llamada “Orquídeas” fue llamada así porque encontraron una gran cantidad de flores orquídeas en su descubrimiento. Ella tiene una papelería, desde hace años para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares. 

Ella inicio su negocio vendiendo confites pero como necesitaba mas dinero para tener su negocio, comenzó a ser grupos de prestamos en la Fundación D-miro, con las ganancias que obtuvo readecuo su casa para ubicar en la parte delantera su papelería. Ahora trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. Vende cuadernos, plumas, papeles. 

Para tener mejor surtido su negocio quiere comprar con el préstamo papelería, cuadernos y vitrinas. En el futuro quiere arreglar su negocio y asi darles una mejor atencion a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Blanca, 52 years old, lives in an urban area named "Orquídeas” because there were many orchids there at the time it was first discovered. For years now she has had a paper shop in order to help with family expenses. She started her business selling confections. When she needed more money to have her business she started requesting group loans with the D-miro Foundation. With the income she made improvements to the front of her house to accommodate the paper shop. She now works from 7am to 10pm every day. She sells notebooks, pens and paper. With the money from the loan she wants to purchase paper goods, notebooks and displays to diversify her inventory. In the future she wants to renovate her shop to better serve her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Displays, notebooks

loans.name: Edelmira Felix

texts.es: Edelmira Félix tiene 51 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de cerdos y molino. Hace más 15 años tiene de dedicarse a este negocio, ella tiene 2 hijos que trabajan de manera independiente, por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar sus ingresos. Ella siempre ha sido una mujer trabajadora ya que desde joven ha logrado aprender este medio de vida que es muy necesario para mantener a su familia. Este crédito lo solicita para la compra de cerdos ya que les gusta comprarlos bien gorditos. Sueña con tener un camión para transportar a los cerdos.
texts.en:
Edelmira Félix is 51 years old. She buys and sells pigs, and she has a grinder. She has had this business for over 15 years. She has two children who work in an independent manner. Therefore, she is always looking for a way to improve her income. She has always been a hard-working woman. Ever since she was young she managed to learn this way of life, which is very necessary to the support of her family. The loan she is requesting is to buy pigs; she likes to buy them pretty fat. She dreams of having a truck to transport the pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena Muñoz V. tiene 37 años de edad es madre soltera con un hijo de 17 años de edad que estudia en nivel secundaria viven junto a sus padres en zona rural comunidad Canco hacia el norte del Municipio de Colomi, La señora Elena nos cuenta que mas antes su actividad principal era producción agrícola lo cual no le fue bien económicamente, de tal modo ahora se dedica más a la actividad pecuaria venta de queso y leche.
 
La institución CIDRE tuvo la oportunidad de pasar por la zona, lo cual la señora Elena se acerco a consultarnos que necesita un crédito para comprar una cabeza de ganado vacuno lechero con cría y avena (forraje) para sus ganados, en la actividad pecuaria obtiene mejores ingresos económicamente que permite mantener en su estudio de su hijo hasta que salga profesional ya que ella no tenia oportunidad para terminar ni nivel primaria porque sus padres eran de pocos recursos económicos,  finalmente ella piensa vivir más cómodos junto a sus padres que son ya de la tercera edad.
texts.en:
Elena Muñoz V., 37, is a single mother of a 17-year-old son who is in secondary school. They live with her parents in a rural area of Canco towards the north of Colomi. Elena tells us that she used to be primarily a famer but didn’t do too well economically so she decided to go into animal raising and cheese and milk sales. CIDRE had the opportunity to travel through the area and Elena approached us to consult regarding her need of funds to buy a nursing dairy cow and oats (forage) for her cattle. Raising cattle provides the higher income and makes it possible for her to keep her son in school until he becomes a professional since she never had the chance to even finish elementary school because her parents were of such scarce resources. She intends finally to live more comfortably alongside her parents who are now senior citizens.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dairy cows and animal feed for them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: PREPARING THE EARTH TO SOW ÑAME

loans.name: Flander

texts.es:
Flander C. M. es un señor de 40 años que vive con sui esposa e hijos en un pequeño pueblo en Guanacaste llamado la Garita. La garita es una planicie de clima bastante cálido donde se desarrollan actividades  tales como la ganadería, Agricultura y el turismo, entre otros.

 La familia de Flander se ha dedicado toda su vida al negocio de la ganadería de doble propósito. Pero hace 2 años el decidió crear  su propio negocio, y fue así como nació la Carnicería La Garita. 
Después de que abrió su negocio, no ha parado de crecer y la demanda es cada ves mayor. Es por eso que está solicitando otro préstamo de KIVA, esta vez  de ¢500.000 (quinientos  mil colones) para la compra de una vaca y unos cerdos para surtir su carnicería.

Don Flander   es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal La Garita una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este segundo  crédito KIVA, esta muy feliz por que asegura que ha crecido bastante gracias a KIVA
texts.en:
Flander C. M. is 40 years old. He lives with his wife and children in a small town in Guanacaste called La Garita. La Garita is a plain with a pretty warm climate where the activities are livestock, farming, and tourism, among others. All of his life the Flander family has dedicated itself to the livestock business. Two years ago he decided to create his own business. That is how the “Carnicerí La Garita” (La Garita Butcher Shop) was born. After he opened his business it did not stop growing, and the demand is also growing. That is why he is requesting a loan from Kiva. This time the loan is for ¢500.000 (five hundred thousand colones) to buy a cow and some pigs to stock his butcher shop. Flander is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal La Garita, one of the 100 member organizations with EDESA in Costa Rica. This is his second Kiva loan, and he is very happy because he has grown a great deal thanks to Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cow and pig for his butcher shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy material to construct a corral for the pigs she raises

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina tiene 48 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio. ella inicio este negocio por su esposo que trabaja como ganadero así el decide ayudar a su esposa estableciendo este medio de vida, por lo que es una mujer muy inteligente ella tiene varios clientes que llegan a comprar sus productos, pues siempre se muestra muy atenta con sus clientes. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, pan, refrescos naturales y jugo. Ella sueña con lograr convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Cristina is 48 years old and has a general store. She has had this business for more than 4 years. She began this business for her husband that worked as a rancher. He decided to help his wife establish this means to make a living. Since she is a smart woman, she has many clients that come to buy her products, and she is always very attentive to her clients. It is for this reason that she is requesting financing to buy basic grains, sweets, breads, natural soft drinks, and juices. She dreams to one day convert her general store into a distribution company.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sweets, breads, natural soft drinks, and juices

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La Sra. María,  es Sacabeña, Nacida en Sacaba Cochabamba, es muy conocida por la zona por la actividad que realiza que es el decorado D. altares para matrimonios, quince años, fiestas religiosas es muy cotizada por la puntualidad, responsabilidad y calidad D. trabajo que ofrece, el préstamo lo destinara para comprar variedad D. telas y floreros D. cristal para centros D. mesa  su objetivo es tener una diversidad D. telas D. colores y adornos  para ofrecer a  las personas que solicitan sus servicios variedad en sus productos, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
María is Sacabeña, meaning she was born in Sacaba Cochabamba. She is very well known in the area for the work that she does, which is decorating altars for weddings, 15th birthday celebrations, and religious festivals. She is much sought-after because of her punctuality, responsibility, and the quality of her work. She will use the loan to buy a variety of cloths and glass vases for table centerpieces. Her goal is to have a range of different colored decorative fabrics to offer to the people who request her services. She is very grateful to the institution for the support offered to her.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of fabrics and glass vases

loans.name: Juan Hermogenes

texts.es:
El Señor Juan Hermogenes G. S. tiene 46 años está separado de su pareja por más de 10 años es padre de 3 hijos  a los cuales ayuda y ayuda en su educación; el trabaja actualmente como moto taxista  en el sindicato“10 de Noviembre”  en el cual esta hace mas de 6 años como socio activo, el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia. El sindicato cuenta con paradas y turnos para cada afiliado, en diferentes puntos de la localidad de Ivirgarzama donde las personas acuden para solicitar dicho servicio.

 El cliente solicita el credito para la compra de una nueva motocicleta, debido a que la que tiene actualmente ya cumplió su ciclo de trabajo y de esta forma poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos consecuente mente mejorar su calidad de vida.
 Cabe señalar que el señor Juan Hermogenes G. S. se apersono a CIDRE a solicitar su préstamo luego de que sus compañeros de trabajo le Comentaron de las buenas condiciones crediticias con las que trabaja nuestra institución
texts.en:
Juan Hermogenes G. S. is 46 years old. He’s been separated for more than 10 years and has three children whom he supports and provides an education for. [Juan] works with the “10 de Noviembre” union as a moto-taxi driver, and has been an active member for more than six years. His services are profitable because of the quality of people who request this service, given its convenience, speed, and efficiency. The union provides stops and shifts for each member, in different locations around Ivirgarzama, where people gather to request services. [Juan] is requesting this loan in order to buy a new motorcycle because the one he has is at the end of its lifecycle and a new one will allow him to provide better service to his customers. It will also allow him to improve his income and quality of life. We should mention that Juan approached CIDRE for a loan after his coworkers told him of the favorable loan terms that our institution provides.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Martha Edith

texts.es:
Martha de 54 años, vende comida y distribuye bebidas. Vive en una zona urbana llamada “Orquídeas” fue llamada así porque encontraron una gran cantidad de flores orquídeas en su descubrimiento.  

Ella es madre soltera tiene una hija de 21 años que aun vive con ella, comenzó a vender almuerzos y meriendas para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar, también con esfuerzo comenzó a vender agua en botellones y colas. Ahora ella trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días con ayuda de su hija. Vende la botella de cola a $ 0.50, la botella de agua a $ 0.30. 

Para poder surtir mas el negocio de bebidas quiere comprar con el préstamo botellas de colas, aguas. En el futuro tiene pensado tener su propio local.
texts.en:
Martha, aged 54, sells meals and drinks. She lives in a urban area called “Orquídeas” (“Orchids”) after the huge number of orchids encountered there when the area was discovered. She is a single mother and her daughter, aged 21, lives with her. She started selling packed lunches and snacks in order to pay for her family’s expenses, to this she then added the sale of water jugs and colas, thus working even harder. She now works form 7 am to 10 pm every day and she can also count on her daughter’s help. She sells a bottle of cola for $ 0.50 and a bottle of water for $ 0.30. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy bottles of cola and of water, in order to better supply her drinks stock. In the future she wishes to have a shop of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bottles of waters and colas.

loans.name: Ramona Antonia

texts.es: Ramona Antonia tiene la actividad económica de mercadería en general. Hace más de 6 años que ella tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre busca la forma de mejorar sus ingresos. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues ha sido muy satisfactorio sacar a su negocio y familia adelante. Por lo que siempre recorre lugares muy lejanos para ofrecer sus diferentes productos. Este crédito es para la compra de tratamientos, perfumes, cremas, calzado y ropa. Ella sueña con mejorar su inventario para ofrecer diferentes productos.
texts.en:
Ramona Antonia engages in retail, selling a variety of products. She has been engaging in this activity for more than 6 years, and she is always looking for ways to improve her income. This is not the first time she has asked for a loan, as this method has been very helpful in allowing her to provide for her family and to progress with her activity. She always visits different and faraway places to offer her variety of products. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy health treatments, perfumes, creams, shoes and clothes. She dreams of augment her stock in order to keep on offering a variety of items.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital.

loans.name: Pastor

texts.es:
El Señor pastor Cuizara P. tiene 23 años vive en concubinato y es padre de un hijo, actualmente el vive en la casa de su tío el cual lo apoya y ayuda en la vida que lleva; él desde muy temprana edad empezó a trabajar en diferentes actividades tales como ayudante de albañil y como jornalero, actualmente el trabaja como moto taxista  en el sindicato “CARRASCO”  en el cual esta hace mas de 3 años como socio activo, el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia. El sindicato cuenta con paradas y turnos para cada afiliado, en diferentes puntos de la localidad de Ivirgarzama donde las personas acuden para solicitar dicho servicio.

Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo, cuyo destino será la compra de una nueva motocicleta, debido a que la que tiene actualmente ya cumplió su ciclo de trabajo y de esta forma poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos consecuente mente mejorar su calidad de vida.

Cabe señalar que el señor Pastor Cuizara P. se apersono a CIDRE a solicitar su préstamo luego de que sus compañeros de trabajo le  comentaron de las buenas condiciones crediticias con las que trabaja nuestra institución
texts.en:
Mr. Pastor Cuizara P. is 23 years old and lives with his wife and son in his uncle’s home, whom he supports and helps. He started working a variety of jobs when he was very young; things like a working as mason’s assistant or as a day laborer. He currently works as a taxi driver for the “Carrasco” union, and has been an active member for more than three years. His services are profitable because of the quality of people who request this service, given its convenience, speed, and efficiency. The union provides stops and shifts for each member, in different locations around Ivirgarzama, where people gather to request services.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica tiene 33 años, vive en su casa que es propia a lado de sus 3 hijos, de los cuales uno es mayor, y 2 están a su cargo, juntos y con muchas ganas de salir adelante viven en un populoso barrio al norte de la ciudad. Desde muy joven esta dedicada mujer se dedica a trabajar, y ahora más para sacar adelante a sus hijos, por tal motivo se le ocurrió instalar una tienda en el interior de su casa, para vender  productos comestibles, a la vez para no descuidar su hogar. Con el tiempo ha logrado complementar sus ventas con productos de primera necesidad y cosméticos, de esa manera obtiene las ganancias que necesita para cubrir con los gastos que le generan la educación de sus hijos, además que cuenta con el apoyo de ellos en el negocio. Como es una emprendedora mujer,  para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar su negocio y ofrecer mayor variedad de mercadería a sus clientes. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues quiere continuar trabajando en busca del progreso, también esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que le permitirá impulsar las  actividades de personas laboriosas como ella . Jessica tiene planeado invertir el crédito en la compra de mercadería, pues quiere ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes y espera obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Jessica is 33 years old and lives in her own home with her 3 children, of which one is an adult and 2 are dependent on her. She has a great desire to progress; they live in a neighborhood in the northern part of the city. Since she was young, she has been a hard-working woman and now she works even harder to help her children. This is why she decided to put up a general store in her home to sell products and food while being able to take care of her home. Over time, she has been able to add essential products and cosmetics to her store and has been able to earn the income that she needs to cover her children's educational expenses. Her children also help her run the store. As she is an enterprising woman, she plans to expand her store and offer a greater variety of goods to her customers. This is her second loan from MFP and she promises to pay it back punctually; she would like to continue working hard to progress. She is very grateful to all the people who make this loan possible that will allow her to encourage other hard-working women like herself. Jessica plans to invest the money to buy more merchandise as she would like to offer the best to her customers and hopes to improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supply a large quantity of products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy baking materials

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La Sra. Elizabeth cliente que  se dedica al comercio de fruta en la zona del Chapare quien además debe despertar en la madrugada para poder comprar y comercializar su producto  solo realiza la comercialización los fines de semana y juntamente con la madre quien es también comerciante de este rubro, la cliente es huérfana de padre por tanto desea obtener su dinero de manera independiente y así poder  salir adelante sola, es muy trabajadora , desea superarse y mejorar su calidad de vida, con el dinero del crédito comprara variedad de frutas como ser Chirimoya, naranja, plátano, etc.  Esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Elizabeth sells fruit in the Chapare zone. She rises early in the morning to buy and sell her products, but she only sells on the weekends, along with her mother who also works in this field. She is fatherless and prefers to earn her own money so that she can succeed on her own. She is very hard working and wants to be successful and improve her quality of life. She will use the money from this loan to buy a variety of fruits, such as apples, oranges, bananas, etc. She is very grateful to the institution for its support.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fruit for resale

loans.name: Kadévi

texts.fr: kadévi est un homme  de 33 ans marié et père de 2 enfants. il est chauffeur, voulant gagner plus de revenu il s'est lancé en 2000 dans l'élevage et le commerce de lapin. ce commerce marche bien pour lieu. il vend les lapins à de grands restaurant de la place. il sollicite un premier crédit chez WAGES pour acheter 10 sacs de son cubé, 30 cages pour les lapins et divers.
texts.en:
Kadévi is 33 years old, married and the father of two children. He is a driver. Wishing to increase his income, in 2000 he started breeding rabbits for sale. This business has been going well for him. He sells rabbits to big local restaurants. He is seeking his first loan from WAGES in order to purchase 10 bags of bran cubes [feed], 30 cages for rabbits and other miscellaneous items.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing feed and supplies necessary for breeding rabbits

loans.name: Luisa Antonia

texts.es: Luisa Antonia tiene 44 años tiene 2 hijos menores a su cargo. Empezó a congeniarse con sus clientes potenciales, como clientes nuevos, con el propósito de que pueda ofrecer una buena variedad  ya que le resulta buenos ingresos económicos. El se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, ya que de esa manera tiene diferentes clientes que siempre le solicitan una gran variedad. Este es su segundo crédito, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus pagos, con el comprara calzado, toallas, sabanas, cosméticos y calzado.
texts.en:
Luisa Antonia is 44 years old and she has 2 young children economically dependent on her. Wishing to offer a good variety of products, she stared building solid relationships with her potential customers, who then turned into regular customers and allowed her to gain a good income. She engages in selling a variety of products because this way she always have different customers asking for a wide variety of items. This is her second loan, and she commits to comply with the repayment of her dues. The loan will be used to buy shoes, towels, sheets and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: La Sra. Marlene vive  en la localidad de la Guardia distante a 20 km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, en el barrio 8 de diciembre, su esposo es de profesión mecánico, ella se dedica a la venta de lubricantes de vehículo, vive en casa en alquiler, tiene tres hijos en edad escolar, el destino del crédito es para comprar mercadería para el negocio comprar una variedad de aceites , es nacida en la localidad de Camiri, provincia Cordillera del Departamento de Santa Cruz, la Sra. Es muy responsable y trabajadora, le ayuda también a su esposo en el taller mecánico, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el poyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Marlene lives in the La Guardia settlement, located 20 km away from the town of Santa Cruz, in the 8 de Diciembre (December 8th) neighborood. Her husband is a mechanic, while she sells vehicle lubricants. They live in a house they rent, and they have three children of school age. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products for her activity, notably a variety of motor oils. A native of Camiri, a settlement located in the Cordillera province of the Santa Cruz region, Marlene is very responsible and hard-working, also helping out her husband in his garage; she is very grateful to this institution for the support she received through the granting of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vehicle lubricants and motor oils.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: abra a commencé il y a plus de 5 ans le commerce de céréales, elle exerce son activité au marché local de hanoukopé. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés locaux de Lomé.elle a constaté une baisse de son stock de marchandises, raison pour laquelle elle voudrait s'approvisionner avec 7 sacs de maïs, 4 sacs d'haricots, 3 sacs de farine. elle est célibataire avec une personne à sa charge, c'est avec le revenu de son commerce qu'elle subvient à ses charges.
texts.en:
Abra started selling cereals over 5 years ago. She sets up shop at Hanoukopé's local market, where her customers are all kinds of people.
She has seen a decrease in her stock of merchandise, which is why she wants to buy 7 bags of corn, 4 bags of beans and 3 bags of flour. She stocks up in the local markets in Lomé.
She is unmarried with one person in her care. She covers her expenses with the revenue from her business.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, beans and flour

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
la sra. Domitila A. se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, su negocio esta ubicado en la colonia San Francisco, desde hace varios años, realiza sus ventas todos los días de la semana, se levanta a las 5:00 de la mañana todos los dias y vende hasta las 8:00 de la noche, Domitila cuenta con clientes fijos quienes le encargan las tortillas.
El credito lo utilizara para la construcción de un cuarto para uso de alquiler, actualmente alquila un cuatro y le deja buenas ganancias.
en la contruccion no paga mano de obra porque su esposo es albañil.
texts.en:
Domitila A. engages in producing and selling tortillas. Her stall is located in the San Francisco village, where she has been working for a few years selling her product every day of the week. She wakes up at 5 am every day and keeps on working until 8 pm. Domitila can count on regular customers for the tortillas orders. The loan she is requesting will be used to build a second room to rent out, as she is currently renting out a room and gaining a good income from this activity. As her husband is a mason, she will not need to pay any workforce to build the new room.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy constrcution materials.

loans.name: Sindy Anael

texts.es: Sindy Anael es una mujer muy sabia, que conoce perfectamente que estrategias poner en marcha en cada momento de su vida, especialmente en lo que se refiere a su negocio como es una pulpería con el paso del tiempo es que gradualmente fue atrayendo más clientes y con ellos mas pedidos, generando la necesidad de aumentar la inversión, con los que ha logrado diversificar sus y mejorar su servicio. Aunque la competencia es su máximo desafío y siempre la obliga a recurrir a estrategias para permitirle sostener sus clientes. Con él préstamo  comprará granos básicos, leche, golosinas, pan y otras cosas.  Su sueño de continuar siendo exitosa.
texts.en:
Sindy Anael is a very wise woman who knows well the strategies to employ at each moment of her life. This is especially true about her business, a grocery store. As time went by she was gradually attracting more customers, and with the customers came more orders. This generated the need to increase her investment, which she managed to use to diversify and improve her service. Even though the competition is her biggest challenge, she is always obliged to turn to strategies that allow her to keep her customers. She will use the loan to buy basic grains, milk, sweets, and bread, among other things. Her dream is to continue being successful.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: La Union Group

texts.es:
El comité La Union nace hace un año despues de que la mayoria de la gente que estuviera en un comité se retiro y decidieron entre ellas volver a formar un nuevo comité, ya con la esperanza de crecer y no volver a cometer los mismos errores que en el pasado.
Actualmente el grupo esta conformado por señoras que viven en Barcequillo de San Lorenzo - asi tuvieron la posibilidad de seguir trabajando con la institucion y fueron mejorando dia a dia.
La Sra. Cinthia posee un puesto de venta de frutas y verduras, el mismo posee buena demanda teniendo en cuenta la calidad de sus productos además de la buena atención.
La señora desea aumentar sus ingresos, abaratando el costo de sus mercaderías, mediante la adquisición en mayores cantidades, de modo a obtener mayores ingresos. 
Así también desea adquirir más variedad de frutas como son las de estación.
texts.en:
One year after their initial committee was progressively abandoned by its members, a few of these women decided to join forces and create another committee, hoping to grow and to avoid the same mistakes they had made in the past; this is how the group named Comité La Union (The Union Committee) was born. The women who currently compose the group are residents of the Barcequillo neighborhood in the town of San Lorenzo: they have had the chance to keep on working with the same institution, and their work has progressed on a daily basis. Cinthia owns a fruits & vegetables stall that attracts many customers, thanks to the quality of her products as well as to the caring way she tends to her customers. She wishes to improve her income, and she plans to do so by lowering the price of her products through the wholesale purchase of bigger quantities of products. She would also like to buy a wider variety of seasonal fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of a wider varity of seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Juan Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Juan Cesar S. Montaño tiene 27 años es soltero vive actualmente con sus padres, es profesor trabaja en la escuela de la comunidad económicamente ayuda a sus hermanos menores en gastos de estudios, son 4 hermanos, 3 de ellos estudian en nivel secundaria y 1 en la Universidad de Mayor de San Simón  Juan Cesar después de pasar clases en la escuela, por las tarde realiza la actividad agrícola juntamente con su hermanos menores produce papa, haba, oca en su terreno de sus padres que tienen 2 hectáreas en la comunidad de  Rosario.

Colomi está a una distancia de 50 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba por lo tanto para ellos es muy difícil acudir a los Banco para un préstamo de dinero. El CIDRE tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esta zona rural, Juan Cesar nos comenta necesita dinero para comprar insumos agrícolas para ampliar la producción agrícola este año y así tener dinero suficiente y ahorro para los gastos de estudio de sus hermanos, Juan Cesar es una persona joven muy emprendedor y ayudar a sus hermanos hasta que salgan profesionales.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Cesar S. Montaño is 27 years old. He is single and currently lives with his parents. A professor in the local school, he economically helps paying for the education of his younger brothers with his wage. He has 4 younger bothers, 3 attending school and 1 attending the University of San Simón (Universidad Mayor de San Simón). On top of teaching classes in the school, Juan Cesar also engages in agriculture, working every afternoon with his younger brothers on their parent’s land, 2 hectares (4.94 acres) in the Rosario community: here they produce potatoes and broad beans and breed geese. As Colomi is located at about 50 km from the town of Cochabamba, it is very difficult for him to visit the bank to obtain a loan. CIDRE took the initiative to go to this rural area, and Juan Cesar told them he needed money to buy agriculture materials to increase the yearly production and earn enough and save enough to pay for the education of his brothers. Juan Cesar is a very resourceful young man, and he wants to help his brothers until they become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material to increase the production.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 58 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposo Aedo de 59 años, pues sus 3 hijos ya no viven con ellos porque tienen sus propias familias. sta trabajadora mujer, ha pesar de sacar adelante a sus hijos, ya mayores, lo hace hasta ahora con mucho trabajo, pues junto a su esposo luchan para salir adelante; es por eso que hace algunos años decidieron comprar un auto, en el que su esposo ofrece el servicio de taxi, negocio que le esta yendo muy bien. De esta manera, él conduce el auto durante el día,  mientras que Juana administra las ganancias que recibe. Ahora están ahorrando ya que desean comprarse un auto más para poder alquilarlo. Esta emprendedora mujer tiene muchos planes por concretar y espera lograrlos con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, y se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas pues desea seguir trabajando, además esta muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su grupo pues esta compuesto por personas responsables y solidarias. Juana tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de 4 llantas nuevas para cambiar las que tiene en su auto, para que así pueda ofrecer un mejor servicio de taxi.
texts.en:
Juana is 58 years old, and she lives with her husband Aedo, aged 59, in a house that belongs to them. Her 3 children do not live with them, as they all have families of their own. On top of having provided and keep providing for her grown-up children with great dedication, this hard-working woman strives together with her husband to make ends meet; this is why a few years ago they decided to buy a car her husband works with as a taxi driver, and the activity is going very well. This is how they work: Aedo drives the car every day, while Juana administrates the incomes. They are now saving in order to buy another car that they will then rent out. There are many plans that this resourceful woman wants to accomplish, and she hopes to realize them thanks to her great effort and dedication. This is the second loan she is asking to MFP, and she is really satisfied with the work done by her group, being it composed of caring and responsible people. To improve her taxi and offer a better service, Juana plans to invest the loan she is requesting in the purchase of 4 new tires to replace the old ones on her car.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 4 tires to replace the old ones on her car.

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
la sra. Teodosia M. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia desde hace 10 años, en estos momentos teodosia cuenta con poca mercadería.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio.
en su pulperia vende productos básicas de consumo diario como ser: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, huevos, leche, papel higiénico, pan, refrescos y otros.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar y de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teodosia M. engages in selling products to the general public: she has been running a small corner shop for 10 years, but right now Teodosia is low on supplies. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more products and supply her shop. In her corner shop she sells everyday products such as rice, beans, sugar, eggs, milk, toilet paper, bread, drinks and so on. She needs the income to pay for her family’s expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products to supply her shop.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Guadalupe G. se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tamalitos de Elotes, su hija le ayuda a vender en la colonia San Francisco y Maria tiene un puesto en el mercado Zonal Belén, donde ya tiene clientes fijos.
Todos los días compra la materia prima que va utilizar y los fines de semana vende Sopa de Mondongo.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar de leña, azúcar, aceite, elotes y un termo para llevar el atol.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe G. works making and selling ‘tamal de elote’ (a dish made with yellow corn, sometimes with a sweet or dry taste). Her daughter helps her sell them in the area of San Francisco and Maria has a stand in the Zonal Belén market where she already has regular customers.

Every day she purchases raw materials to use and on weekends, she sells tripe soup. She will use the loan to purchase firewood, sugar, oil, corn, and a thermos to transport the atol. She needs the earnings to cover the household and family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn, sugar, water, firewood

loans.name: Lizeth

texts.es: La Sra. Lizeth vive en el municipio de la Guardia distante 20 km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz de la Sierra, nacida  en la provincia cordillera municipio de Camiri,  considerada la capital Petrolera de Bolivia, su actividad es el servicio de transporte de pasajeros en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, por lo que percibe renta de sus dos vehículos ya que les da a choferes para que lo trabajen, su esposo es empleado, trabajan  conjuntamente para sostener  a su familia, el destino del crédito solicitado es para comprar accesorios  y mantenimiento de su vehículo para el buen funcionamiento y así brindar un  servicio calificado, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del credito.
texts.en:
Lizeth lives in the town of Guardia, 20km from the city of Santa Cruz de la Sierra. She was born in the mountain province of Camiri, which is considered to be the petroleum capital of Bolivia. She provides a transportation service for passengers in the city of Santa Cruz and gets income from her two vehicles for which she has two drivers. Her husband is an employee. They work together to support their family. They will use the loan to buy parts and maintain the vehicles so that they function well and they can offer a good service. She is very grateful to the institution for the support offered to her in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: MANTENIMIENTOS DE VEHICULO

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
la sra. Consuelo C. E. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, cuenta con una pequeña pulperia en la cual vende varios productos, en estos momentos no tiene muy surtido su negocio.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtirlo para cubrir con las exigencias de sus clientes.
su negocio esta ubicado en la colonia Venecia, hace cuatro meses abrió una pequeña pulpería en la Calera ubicada a treinta minutos de Tegucigalpa y ha tenido que llevar mercadería de su pulperia, por eso su esta un poco vacía.
necesita surtir sus dos pulperias para tener mejores ganancias las cuales las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y de su familia.
texts.en:
Consuelo C. E. works selling common products. She has a small store where she sells her items, but her store is not very well stocked right now.

She will use the loan to purchase more merchandise to stock her store and meet the demands of her customers.

Her store is located in the Venecia neighborhood. Four months ago, she opened another small store in Calera, located 30 minutes from Tegucigalpa and she has had to bring merchandise from her other store. This is why it is a bit empty.

She needs to stock her two stores to have better earnings, which she needs to cover the household and family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, coffee, crackers, milk, refreshments, juices, pastas, soups, soaps, spaghetti, eggs, pills, spices, butter, oil, margarine

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ricardo Jose

texts.es: Ricardo José tiene 30 anos. Ricardo es un hombre. El se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos. El sabe que de manera ambulante puede obtener nuevos clientes y nuevos productos. Solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas y cosméticos. Su sueño es darle educación a su hijo para que tenga éxito. Un desafío que ha enfrentado es que el precio de ciertos productos están muy caros. Le gusta el conversar con sus clientes y aconsejarlos a obtener lo mejor.
texts.en:
Ricardo José is a 30 year old man. He sells clothing and cosmetics. As a street vendor, he is able to obtain new customers and purchase new products. He is requesting the loan to purchase trousers, shirts, skirts, and cosmetics. His dream is to give his son an education so that he will be successful. One challenge which he has faced is the expensive prices of certain products. He enjoys talking with his customers and persuading them to buy the best quality products.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Delia Maria

texts.es:
Delia de 39 años, vive en una zona urbana llamada “Orquídeas” fue llamada así porque encontraron una gran cantidad de flores orquídeas en su descubrimiento. Ella tiene una tienda variada con servicio de telefonía y papelería.    

Desde que su esposo la abandono ella comenzó con una pequeña tienda para poder mantener a sus tres hijos, desde ese tiempo hasta ahora ella trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. Su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el “Bastión Popular”, en su local tiene servicio telefónico, papelería y víveres a la venta. 

Con el préstamo quiere compra vitrinas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener un Cyber para poder asegurar el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Delia is 39 years old. She lives in the urban area of “Orquídeas”. (It was named “the orchids” because a large number of these flowers were found there at the time of its discovery). She owns a variety store where she provides telephone services and sells stationery. After her husband left her, she opened a small shop in order to support her three children. Since then, she has worked from 6:00 AM until 8:00 PM every day. Her business is located in the “Bastión Popular”. In her shop, she offers telephone services, and sells stationery and supplies. With this loan she wants to purchase display cases for her business. In the future, she wants to buy a computer and be able to provide a secure future for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Display Cases

loans.name: Marlo Leonel

texts.es:
el sr. Marlo Leonel C. se dedica al comercio, tiene un negocio que opera bajo el nombre de BODEGUITA BELLA, tiene seis años de tener su negocio el cual esta ubicado en la calle principal de la colonia Predios del Recreo.
Su negocio cuenta con una variedad de productos desde carnes, lácteos, agua y recargas telefónicas.
Marlo atiende todos los días de la semana, el se encarga de ir al mercado a comprar sus productos y su esposa le ayuda con la atención de sus clientes cuando el no esta.
Así mismo recibe otros ingresos ya que se dedica a la producción de plátanos y a la cría de cerdos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir su bodeguita, ya que las exigencias de sus clientes son muchas y desea tener contenta su clientela.
las ganancias las necesita para sacar adelante a su familia que es lo mas importante que tiene en la vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Marlo Leonel C. is a merchant. He has had a store called BODEGUITA BELLA for six years located on Predios del Recreo neighborhood’s main street. His store is stocked with a variety of products from meats to dairy products, water and telephone time cards. Marlo is open for business every day of the week. He goes to the market to buy his products and his wife helps him tend to customers when he’s away. He also earns extra income as a banana grower and raising pigs. He will use the loan to buy stock merchandise for the store because his customer demands are many and he wants to keep them happy. He needs the profits to support his family which is the most important thing he has in his life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toothpaste, toilet paper, eggs, margarine, lard, cooking oil, pills, plastic bags, sweets, balls, batteries, candles, matches, powdered drink mix, rice, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Comprar: Una paca de sabanas usada, una paca de pantalones usados de adultos y una paca de toallas usadas.

loans.name: Dinora Delmi

texts.es:
Dinora es una señora D. 46 años D. edad, esta casada y su grupo familiar lo conforman: su esposo, dos hijas D. 24 y 26 años D. edad, el esposo D. una D. sus hijas y dos nietos todos ellos residen en El Transito D. San Miguel, ella posee un negocio el cual lo administra con sus hijas, el negocio lo desarrollaron por iniciativa propia trabajando desD. las siete D. la mañana hasta las seis D. la tarD.. Actualmente su negocio es pequeño y ellas no cuentan con el capital suficiente para invertirlo en producto.
Dinora esta solicitando un préstamo el cual necesita para comprar mercaderia para abastecer su negocio y poder ofrecer a sus clientes variedad D. productos.  Esta inversion le ayudara a brindar a sus clientes todo lo necesario para el hogar y satisfacer así la demanda D. productos, logrando una mejor venta y mayores ingresos que solventen las necesidades del hogar D. Dinora.
Los sueños D. ella son tener un negocio fuerte y estable que le brinD. una estabilidad economica y mejore sus condiciones D. vida.
texts.en:
Dinora is a woman of 46 years of age. She is married and her family group consists of: her husband, two daughters who are 24 and 26 years old, the husband of one of her daughters, and two grandchildren. They all live in El Transito D. San Miguel. She has a business that she runs with her daughters. They developed the business through their own initiative, working from 6 in the morning until 6 at night. The business is currently small and they don't have sufficient capital to invest in supplies. Dinora is requesting a loan that she needs to buy merchandise to supply her business and to offer her clients a greater variety of products. This will help her to offer her clients everything necessary for the home and satisfy their demand for products and will achieve better sales and greater income that will meet the needs of Dinora's own home. Her dreams are to have a strong and stable business that will offer economic stability and a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy home products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase packs of used clothing for children and adults

loans.name: Luci Magdalena

texts.es:
la joven Luci Magdalena G. se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene 6 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, cuenta con cliente fijos.
Su negocio está ubicado en la colonia Venecia, recibe la ayuda de su mama para la elaboracion de las tortillas, todos los dias Luci se levanta bien temprano para empezar la produccion y tenerla lista a las 7 de la mañana.
las ventas son desde las 7:00 A.M., hasta las 8:00 P.M.,
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maíz, leña, cal, agua.
Los fines de semana Luci vende tamales, elotes cocidos y tamalitos de elote.
Luci es una mujer con muchos deseos de superarse y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Luci Magdalena G. is a young woman who works making and selling tortillas; she has done this type of work for the past 6 years and has many loyal customers. Her business is located in the Venecia colony. Her mother helps her to make the tortillas. Every day, Luci gets up very early to start making the tortillas to have them ready by 7 am. She sells from 7 am to 8 pm. She will use the loan to buy corn, firewood, lime, and water. On the weekends, Luci sells tamales, elotes, and tamalitos de elote. Luci is a woman with goals of progressing and moving forward in life.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, firewood, lime, water and matches

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase 20 gallones of scallops, 200 pounds of shrimp with heads on, and 80 dozen crabs

loans.name: Martha Argentina

texts.es: La señora Martha Argentina L. A., tiene la edad de 30 años vive en el Barrio Laureles Norte, es casada y su esposo es taxista, ellos tienen un negocio de venta de productos domésticos, personales, abarrotes en si productos en general, ellos tienen 3 hijos menores de edad que estudian la escuela primaria, ellos desean invertir y abrirse paso a una nueva fuente de ingreso en la que ha observado una magnifica venta, es por esta razón que solicita  un préstamo para la compra de ropa usada, e instalación de una tienda que ofrezca ropa de segunda, este apoyo le favorecerá a su economía y la reinversión a sus negocios a favor de mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Martha Argentina L. A. is 30 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood; she is married and her husband is a taxi driver. They have a business selling domestic products, personal items, and groceries. They have 3 young children that are all in elementary school. They would like to invest in order to find a new source of income which they believe will have high sales. They are seeking a loan to buy used clothing and to put up a storefront to sell the clothing. This loan will help them economically and they will reinvest the money in their businesses and to support their children.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase second hand clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase packs of used clothing for youth and children and pack of used sheets

loans.name: Petronila Del Carmen

texts.es:
Petronila reside en El Transito de San Miguel, es madre soltera tiene dos hijos uno 17 años y el otro de 13 años de edad, los dos dependen económicamente de ella, Petronila se dedica a la venta de tortillas y tiene 40 años de edad, comenzó el negocio por iniciativa propia trabajando desde las ocho de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde. Ella por el momento no posee el capital necesario para realizar una inversión que le permita obtener mayores ingresos.
Ella esta solicitando un Préstamo para la compra de Maíz, Leña y gas que son los materiales que necesita para la elaboración de las tortillas, el préstamo ayudara a que Petronila fortalezca su negocio con más recursos y ganar más ingresos a su hogar. 
El sueño de ella es crecer  con su negocio logrando estabilizarse y proveyendo para sus hijos lo más necesario mejorando las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Petronila lives in Transito de San Miguel. She is a single mother of two sons who are 17 and 13 years old. Both children are supported by her. She sells tortillas and is 40 years old. She started her business on her own working from 8am to 5pm. For the time being, she does not have the necessary capital to invest in order to increase her income. She requests a loan to buy corn, wood and gas, which are the materials she needs to make tortillas. The loan will help Petronila strengthen her business with more resources and therefore more income to her home. Her dream is to grow her business, establish herself and provide her children what they need by improving their living condition.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn, wood and gas to make tortillas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy nails, plates, and screws for fixing fractures

loans.name: Mirna Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Mirna del Rosario O. es una mujer de 57 años habitante del Barrio Laureles Norte, es madre soltera de 3 hijos mayores de edad que trabajan y sobreviven gracias a sus esfuerzos propios, le apoyan a su madre en sus gastos mensuales, ella vende ropa y productos Botánicos desde hace mas de 30 años que se gana el sustento trabajando en esta actividad, ahora solicita un  préstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario de mercadería en la copmpra de ropa y articulos personales asi como botanicos, y aumentar sus ventas que le permitan mejores condiciones y remodelaciones a su vivienda con el objetivo de heredarle a su hijo menor su hogar. Espera le brindan un apoyo pues es una mujer sola que ha salido adelante gracias a su trabajo proveyéndole un buen porvenir a sus hijos que ahora son padres de familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mirna del Rosario O., 57, is a single mother of three adult children who work and survive thanks to their own efforts. They help their mother with her monthly expenses. She lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. She has sold clothes and botanicals for over 30 years to support herself. She is asking for funds to buy a larger amount of stock merchandise; to buy clothes, personal articles and botanicals to increase sales that will make it possible for her to live in better conditions and to remodel her home with the aim of passing on to her son a better home. She hopes the support will be forthcoming because she’s a woman alone who has gotten ahead through her work providing a good future for her children who are now themselves parents.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To reinvest in stock merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Freddy Daniel

texts.es: Freddy tiene 52 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de taller de soldadura. Hace más de 30 años Freddy. El dio inicio este negocio por que no tenía un trabajo, y su esposa y su hijo necesitaban el sustento diario, por lo que no es la primera vez que tiene experiencia con financiamientos pues ha sido de buena ayuda. El financiamiento es para comprar materia prima como hierro liso, corrugado entre otros productos. A pesar de los difíciles problemas que enfrenta como las cuentas por cobrar.
texts.en:
Freddy is 52. He offers a welding shop service. Over 30 years ago Freddy started this business because he did not have a job, and his wife and child needed their daily sustenance. This is not his first experience with loans, and they have been a great help to him. This loan is for the purchase of basic materials such as flat and corrugated iron, among other products, despite the difficulties he has had such as charge accounts.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Justina C. R.  es una señora de 50 años que  vive con su esposo e Hijo  en una comunidad llamada Coquital  en la provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. 

Doña Justina tiene  5  años de tener  su propia venta de helados, la cual se ha convertido poco a poco una tiendita donde vende todo tipo de  comidas rápidas tradicionales de Costa Rica. Sus especialidades son los helados de leche agria y las popusas (Tortilla con quesos). Por eso ella solicita un préstamo de 609.000 (seiscientos nueve mil colones) para la compra de una vaca lechera, para producir los productos que ella vende en su tienda como la leche agraria y el queso.

Ella  forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Rapicrédito Progreso Futuro Coquital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo  crédito  y con el espera  mejorar la calidad  de sus servicios.
texts.en:
Justina C. R. is a 50 year old woman who lives with her husband and child in a community called Coquital in the province of Alajuela. This community stands out because it is in a mountainous zone very close to the north border of the country. Justina has had her own ice cream sales business for 5 years, which she has converted bit by bit into a small store where she sells all sorts of traditional Costa Rican fast food. Her specialties are sour milk ice cream and popusas (tortillas with cheeses). She is requesting a loan of 609,000 (six hundred nine thousand colones) for the purchase of a dairy cow to produce the products that she sells in her store, such as sour milk and cheese. She is part of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Rapicrédito Progreso Futuro Coquital, one of the over 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her second loan and with it she hopes to improve the quality of her services.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula  G. T.   es una señora de 41 años que  vive con su esposo y 5  Hijos  en una comunidad llamada Coquital, es destacada por ser una zona montañosa y por su cercanía con la frontera Norte de Costa Rica.

Dona Paula se dedica a la venta de leche agraria y de quesos. En su corral tiene ya varias vaquitas pero asegura que ya no son suficientes para abastecer la demanda de su comunidad. Por eso ella necesita un préstamo de ¢609.000 (seiscientos  nueve mil colones) para la comprar de más vaquitas y así aumentar su producción 


Ella  forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Rapicrédito Progreso Futuro Coquital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  crédito  y asegura que será un gran impulso para su negocio.
texts.en:
Paula G. T. is a 41 year old woman who lives with her husband and 5 children in a community called Coquital. Coquital stands out as a mountainous zone that is located near to the Northern border of Costa Rica. Paula sells cow's milk and cheeses. In her farmyard, she has several cows, but she says that she does not have enough to fill the demand in her community. For this reason, she needs a loan of ¢609.000 (six hundred nine thousand colones) to purchase more cows and thus increase her production. She is part of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Rapicrédito Progreso Futuro Coquital, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan and she knows that it will provide a great boost for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing fattened cows

loans.name: Jorge Antonio
