The loan will allow her to continue working in the pursuit of progress. Judith plans to use the requested loan to buy merchandise for her grocery store. She wants to offer her customers greater variety. She wants to make their shopping easier because the place where she lives is somewhat far away.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to stock her store

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua M. sells various kinds of cloth at Elmina. She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a petty trader and she supports him in providing the basic needs of the family. Ekua has received junior high education.

Ekua’s loan will be used to buy more cloth to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a shop.

loans.use: To buy more cloth to sell

loans.name: Kpormah Group

texts.en:
Parker K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Kpormah. He is 26 years old and single. He was able to attend school only through twelfth grade due to lack of financial support.
 
For 6 years, he has been selling used clothes in “Red light Market” on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 LRD portion of this 26,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of used clothes to sell. 

He describes himself as a determined man whose dream is to improve his business and to continue his education.

loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa S. sells different types of washing soap at Elmina. She has four children and is married to a trader. She uses her revenue to support her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Adjoa was able to attain a senior high school level of education.

Adjoa will use the loan to purchase more assorted soaps to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to complete her kitchen which she has already started.

loans.use: To purchase more assorted soaps to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more plantain to sell

loans.name: Wainha Womens Group-Jinja

texts.en:
M. Jesca, who belongs to the Wainha Women's group-Jinja, reckons that she has been able to succeed even in the hardest of situations that she has experienced as she operates her 19-year-old business. This 40-year-old married mother of four also credits her resolve, open mindedness and affable nature as winning attributes that she has relied upon in her tailoring business in Jinja Taxi Park-Jinja.  

Jesca says that after school she could not find a job so she was compelled to start this business. In a week she makes profits that add up to around $67 and with this loan she is expecting to buy more fabric and textile materials to make more clothes to sell.

loans.use: The purchase of more fabric and textile materials to make more clothes

loans.name: Laura Maribel

texts.es:
Laura es  de la ciudad de Pilar, tiene 20 años y  está cursando el 3° año de la carrera de Ciencias Jurídicas en la Universidad Nacional de Pilar (UNP) en la ciudad de Pilar, es la hija mayor de 2 en la flia.
Su madre es comerciante junto con su padre en la ciudad de Pilar,
Laura se encuentra trabajando como administradora de la funeraria de sus padres desde hace años.
Gracias a este trabajo la misma se puede mantener y estudiar a la vez, está en los últimos 3 años de la carrera y tiene muchos deseos de concluir.
 La finalidad del mismo es el de poder contar el día de mañana con  excelente ingreso como para poder ayudar al progreso de su familia ya que son gentes de una zona muy humilde comento Laura. Actualmente es soltera y vive con sus padres, pero piensa en el día de mañana poder contar con su familia propia y poder brindarle todas las comodidades.
El solicita el préstamo para el pago de la mensualidad de su facultad y también para la compra de libros que está necesitando para estudiar.
texts.en:
Laura, 20, is from the city of Pilar. She is in the third year of Judicial Sciences at the National University of Pilar (UNP) in the city of Pilar. She is the oldest of two daughters. Her mother and father are merchants in the city of Pilar. Laura has worked administering her parents’ funeral home for many years. Thanks to this work she can support herself and go to school. She is in the last three years of the career and she very much wants to finish with the goal in mind of being able to have excellent income in the future to help her family’s progress because they are from a very humble area, Laura comments. She is currently single and living with her parents but hopes to have a family of her own in the future and be able to provide them with all the comforts. She is asking for funds to pay for her monthly tuition at the university as well as to buy textbooks she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for her monthly tuition and other school supplies.

loans.name: Luís Wilton

texts.es: Luís vive en casa propia en la zona de Alto Miraflores, de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltero, y de oficio cerrajero, trabaja en un taller como asalariado, con los ingresos que obtiene logra mantenerse. El crédito será destinado para la construcción de una cocina para su casa. Luís es cliente de Impro con 3 créditos. Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito y es un buen cliente.
texts.en:
Luis lives in his own home in La Paz’s Alto Miraflores neighborhood. He’s single and is employed as a salaried worker in a locksmith’s shop. His income allows him to support himself. The loan will be used to build a kitchen in his house. Luis has had three Impro loans. His credit history qualifies him for a new loan and he’s a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kitchen.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María reside en San Francisco Gotera, tiene 37 años, es madre de 3 hijos de las edades de 18, 14, 13 años vive junto a su esposo, Posee un negocio de ropa desde hace 10 años y elabora bolsos de hilo plástico, no posee un horario fijo porque le dedica tiempo a la elaboración de los bolsos y luego visita a sus clientes de la zona para ofrecer sus productos. Ella está solicitando un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de mercadería y los materiales para la preparación de los bolsos, Con este préstamo María incrementara su inventario de materiales y podrá elaborar mas bolsos,  podrá ofrecer a sus clientes ropa de diferentes estilos, aumentaran sus ventas y sus ingresos serán mayores; Ella aspira tener un negocio grande que pueda ofrecer lo que el cliente necesita y poder darle a sus hijos la educación que necesitan y que mejoren sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
37-year old María lives in San Francisco Gotera with her husband and three children aged 18, 14, and 13. She has run a clothing business for ten years and also makes bags from strands of plastic. She doesn’t have a fixed schedule as sometimes she is making the bags and other times she is selling her products to customers in the neighbourhood. María is seeking a loan to buy merchandise and also materials for making the bags. With the money she will increase her inventory of clothing and be able to offer a wider range to her customers. She will also be able to make more bags. In this way she will make more sales and have a bigger income. One day she hopes to have a larger business so she can offer her customers what they need, be able to provide her children with a good education so they can improve their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise and plastic yarn to make bags

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es: Lorenza vive en casa propia en la zona D. Pasankeri  D. la ciudad D. La Paz, vive con su esposo, con el cual elaboran chompas que venden al por mayor en puestos D. venta D. la ciudad D. LaPaz, con los ingresos que obtienen  mantienen a su familia, esta es la primera ves que solicita un crédito en IMPRO y el mismo será destinado a la construcción D. una habitación.Por su análisis socio económico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito se considera buen cliente.
texts.en:
Lorenza lives in La Paz’s Pasankeri neighborhood with her husband. Together they make sweaters that they sell at wholesale in sales stalls in La Paz. Their income makes it possible for them to support their family. This is the first time she’s requested an IMPRO loan; it will be used to build a room. She is considered to be a good client and the socio-economic evaluation done on her qualifies her for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: María, de 23 años, vive en su casa que es propia a lado de su esposo Barbiyoe de 19 años y de su pequeño hijo de 2 años, juntos habitan una apacible casa ubicada en un populoso barrio al norte de la ciudad. Recuerda como desde muy pequeña ayudaba a sus padres, que eran grandes comerciantes de flores, en un inicio empezó en el atado de flores, luego envolvía las macetas, y conforme pasaba el tiempo desempeñaba labores más complejas. Luego de unos años, casada, decidió junto con su pareja, comercializar flores y macetas, ya que vio que este negocio es bastante rentable. de esta manera ella y su esposo compran las flores a los mayoristas de la ciudad, luego de preparar los ramos y macetas, su esposo las traslada a provincias. Su mayor anhelo es tener un negocio de venta de flores en un centro comercial y para ello debe trabajar con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete cumplir con sus pagos puntualmente, pues desea seguir trabajando para alcanzar el progreso, además esta muy satisfecha con el trabajo que desempeñan los integrantes de su grupo, ya que esta compuesto por personas bastante responsables y solidarias. María tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de flores y variedad de macetas, ya que tiene varios pedidos en provincias y espera cumplir con todos.
texts.en:
Maria, 23, lives in her own home with her husband Barbiyoe, 19, and their small son who is 2 years old. They live together in a peaceful home located in a populated neighborhood to the north of the city. She remembers how when she was very small she used to help her parents, who were big flower merchants. At the beginning, she started bundling flowers, then later she decorated the pots and as time went on she performed more complicated tasks. A few years later, and after she was married, she decided along with her partner to sell flowers and pots, since she knew this business to be quite profitable. She and her husband buy flowers from the wholesalers in the city, and later prepare the arrangements and pots, and her husband takes them to the provinces. Her main desire is to have a business selling flowers in a shopping center. To do this she must work with a lot of effort and dedication. This is her second loan with MFP, and she pledges to make her payments on time, since she wants to continue working so that she can achieve progress. In addition, she is very satisfied with the work that she does with the members of her group, since her group is made up of very responsible and cooperative people. Maria plans to invest the loan requested in the purchase of a greater quantity of flowers and a greater variety of pots, since she has various orders from the provinces, and she wants to fill all of them.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to supply her business with flowers and pots

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, fish, meat, pepper, salt and so on

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es: Fabián vive en casa de sus parientes en la zona de Tacagua, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, actualmente se encuentra soltero. Fabián comercializa celulares al por menor, con los ingresos que obtiene se mantiene. El crédito será destinado para incrementar su capital de trabajo y por ende aumentar sus ventas. Está es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Por su evaluación socioeconómica califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Fabián lives with his parents in Tacagua on the west side of La Paz; he is single. He is a cell phone retailer. He supports himself with the income he earns. The loan will be used to increase working capital thus increasing his sales. This is the first time he’s asked for an Impro loan. The socio-economic evaluation done on him indicated that he qualifies for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For working capital.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.es: Merlinda, de 26 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Luis de 36 años, que es chofer y de su pequeño hijo, quien estudia en el colegio. Esta joven se dedica al comercio, es así que desde hace 8 meses, vende  productos de belleza, así como implementos para el hogar, de esta manera ayuda a su pareja en los constantes gastos del hogar. La modalidad de su negocio es el siguiente: compra al por mayor los productos en oferta, para luego ofrecerlos a sus clientes a un precio más alto, pero con la oportunidad de pagarlo a crédito. Así obtiene regulares ganancias con este negocio, y dice que le gusta mucho porque lo desempeña desde la comodidad de su casa y no descuida las labores de su hogar. Afirma que no le gusta vender sus productos a clientes nuevos, pues siempre tiene temor que no le puedan cancelar a tiempo, es por eso que prefiere trabajar con clientes conocidos. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda de ropa en algún centro comercial cercano a la zona donde vive. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Merlinda tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de mercadería, no solo  en productos para el hogar, si no también en ropa que ha planeado comercializar a sus clientes, por lo que ya tiene varios pedidos pendientes y espera cumplir con todos.
texts.en:
Merlinda, 26, lives in her own home with her husband, Luis, 36, who is a driver, and their small son who goes to school. She is a merchant and for the last 8 months has been selling beauty supplies as well as items for the home. This way she helps her spouse with household expenses. She works like this: she buys items that are on sale at wholesale and then resells them for a slightly higher price but gives her customers the chance to buy on credit. This way her profits are regular and she says she enjoys it a lot because it’s home based and she can attend to her household obligations. She states that she dislikes selling to new customers because she’s always fearful that they won’t pay her on time and this is why she prefers to work with customers that are known to her. Being an enterprising woman she plans for the future to set up a clothing store in some shopping center near her home. This is her 2nd loan with MFP and she promises to repay punctually because she is very grateful to all the people who funded the loan that will allow her to continue seeking progress. Merlinda plans to use the requested funds to buy merchandise, not only items for the home, but also clothing she plans to start to sell to her customers. She already has pending orders and she expects to fill all of them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy items for the home and clothing.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío, de 33 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de sus 4 hijos menores, con muchas ganas de salir adelante juntos  habitan en un populoso barrio ubicado al norte de la ciudad. Desde hace 1 año, luego de dedicarse a la comercialización de diferentes productos, decidió empezar a vender zapatos y zapatillas. Al principio no fue fácil, porque  sus clientes estaban acostumbrados en comprarle productos para el hogar, pero luego de comprar algunos calzados que ofrecía, percibieron que éstos eran de calidad. En la actualidad compra variedad de zapatos, ofreciéndoles a mayores precios con la modalidad de pago al crédito, por lo que le resulta rentable, permitiéndole solventar los gastos de su hogar sin problemas.  Afirma que le desagrada cuando sus clientes se demoran en cancelar, y esto atrasa la compra de  mayor cantidad de calzado, pero como es una mujer emprendedora, planea más adelante ampliar la mercadería de calzado que ofrece, pues desea instalar una pequeña tienda en algún mercado cerca del lugar donde vive. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete que pagara puntualmente sus cuotas en agradecimiento a todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Rocío tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de variedad de calzado y zapatillas, pues tiene varios pedidos pendientes y espera cumplir con todos, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Rocio, 33, lives in her own home with her 4 minor children, and she has a strong desire to get ahead. They live together in a populated neighborhood located to the north of the city. A year ago, she decided to sell different products, specifically shoes and sneakers. At first it was not easy, because her customers were used to buying products from the home from her. But later they started buying the shoes that she offered, because they realized that they were of good quality. Now she buys a variety of shoes, offering her customers the best prices and the ability to buy on credit. As a result, the business is profitable and this allows her to cover her household expenses without a problem. She states that she does not like it when her customers are slow to repay her; this delays her ability to buy a greater quantity of shoes. But since she is a very enterprising woman, she plans in the future to expand the merchandise that she offers. She wants to set up a small store in some market close to the place where she lives. This is her second loan with MFP, and she pledges that she will make her payments on time. She appreciates of all of the people who made this loan possible that will allow her to continue to work and seek progress. Rocio plans to invest the loan requested in the purchase of a variety of shoes and sneakers, as she has a number of pending orders and she hopes to fill all of them and in this way improve her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to supply her business with shoes and sneakers

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: El Sr. Reynaldo Vive en la localidad de la Guardia distante a 20 km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, en el barrio 23 de diciembre, su actividad principal es el trabajo en la construcciones civiles como albañil, su esposa  con la cual tiene 4 hijos en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta de pan de trigo, con lo cual le ayuda a su esposo en sostener a su familia, el destino del credito es para comprar insumos como harina de trigo, manteca, levadura, etc y así crecer en el negocio de su esposa quien elabora y comercializa el pan que realiza, es nacido en el departamento de Beni capital ganadera de Bolivia, hace 15 año que radica en el departamento de santa cruz, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Reynaldo lives in the town of La Guardia, which is 20km from the city of Santa Cruz, and resides in the December 23rd neighborhood. His main business activity is working as a mason on civil construction projects. He and his wife have four school age children. She makes a living by selling wheat bread, which helps to support their family.

This loan will be used to buy supplies such as wheat flour, butter, yeast, and other ingredients to grow his wife’s business of making and selling bread. Sr. Reynaldo was born in the Department of Beni, the livestock capital of Bolivia. Fifteen years ago, he settled in the Department of Santa Cruz. He is grateful to Emprender for the support that has been provided.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for his wife's business

loans.name: Dinara

texts.en:
Dinara K. is a 37-year-old mother of three children. She lives in the northern part of Kyrgyzstan, in Baetovo village.  In 1996, she graduated from the State Agricultural University and had great plans for the further development of her life. 

However, in 1998, she was given into marriage to a villager (in accordance with antiquated nomadic tradition which fortunately quite rarely exists at present times) and became a part of a large family. This moment became crucial and moved her life in another direction.  She found a job at a local company, but her salary didn’t cover all the expenses of her family.  In order to find a means of subsistence for her children,  Dinara decided to start her businesses of cattle breeding and farming the land, growing wheat and potatoes. Using her initial capital of 15,000 KGS, she bought one milk cow and sheep.  Thanks to Damira’s hardworking and persistent personality, today she has two milk cows, two calves, ten sheep and three goats.  

As Damira is the only breadwinner for the family, she needs this loan of 58,000 KGS to purchase five sheep for fattening and reselling. Also, she plans to buy two colts, which will be used as a means of transportation for her two sons (11 and 8 years old), who help her in farming and today need to travel the distance of about 10 kilometers from the village up to their land.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Micro-finance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase five sheep and two colts

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua O. sells secondhand bedsheets and towels at Elmina. She has no educational background.

Ekua is divorced and has two children. She provides all the needs of her family.

Ekua’s loan will be used to buy a bale of bedsheets and towels to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy a bale of bedsheets and towels to sell

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El Sr. Mario Vive en la localidad de la  Guardia, bario nuevo el Carmen distante a  18 km de  la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  cuenta con domicilio propio, su actividad de principal es la construcción(albañil), su esposa se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante, lo cual le ayuda a su esposo para sostener  su economía, hace 5 año que trabaja como albañil desde que se vino a vivir desde Chuquisaca Capital de Bolivia, el destino del crédito solicitado es para arreglo de su vivienda que se encuentra en mal estado, siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le esta brindando, tiene cuatros hijos en edad escolar, por lo que se le hace difícil con su ingresos sacar adelante a su familia por lo que tienen que trabajar ambos para sostener a la familia
texts.en:
Sr. Mario lives in his own home in the Nuevo El Carmen neighborhood of La Guardia, which is 18km from the city of Santa Cruz. His main business activity is working in construction as a mason. His wife sells clothing as a street vendor to help with the finances. Mario started working as a mason five years ago when he came here to live from Chuquisac, where the Bolivian capital is located.

The loan he is requesting will be used to remodel his home which is in poor condition. Mario is grateful to Emprender for the support that has been provided. He has four school age children, so it is difficult for his family to get ahead on his income. Therefore, both he and his wife must work to support their family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repairs

loans.name: Mujeres Talentosas Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a través de las Sras. Eladia A. y la Sra. Norma Martínez, quienes se habían  acercado hasta la Oficina de la Fundación Paraguaya para interiorizarse mas del  Programa  Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, las mismas decidieron invitar a sus amigas y compañeras del Barrio y decidieron sumarse al trabajo grupal para salir adelante y así mejorar su estilo de vida, son 16 mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los días. 
La señora Rosa es una de las integrantes, muy humilde, pero con su trabajo ella logra obtener ingresos para su familia.
Su actividad consiste en la venta de especias  como comino, ajos, pimienta blanca y negra, órganos, y remedios naturales que ella compra en gran cantidad y los fracciona para facilitar su venta y además para aumentar su ganancia.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de especias y ajos.
texts.en:
This committee was formed through Mrs. Eladia A. and Mrs. Norma Martínez who approached Fundación Paraguaya’s office to join the Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women) Committee’s Program. They then invited their friends and colleagues from the neighborhood to join in order to get ahead and improve their way of life as a group. They are 16 hard working, humble women who must earn their livelihood every day. One of the members is Rosa. She is very humble but succeeds in earning income for her family through her work. She sells spices like: cumin, garlic, white and black pepper, organs and natural remedies that she buys in bulk and repackages for ease of sale and to increase profits. She is asking for a loan to buy spices and garlic.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy garlic and spices.

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es: Zonia vive en la zona  Chauira Chico, Provincia  Omasuyos, del Departamento La Paz, junto a su  pequeña hija  la cual se encuentra en edad escolar, se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno cuya producción de leche la vende a Pil Andina (Planta industrializadota  de leche). El crédito será destinado a la compra de ganado. Es el primer  crédito en Impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Zonia lives in Chauira Chico, Omasuyos province, La Paz department, with her school aged daughter. She raises dairy cattle whose milk is sold to Pil Andina (large, commercial dairy products maker). The loan will be used to buy cattle. This is her first Impro and first Kiva loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge vive en la zona  Copajira, Provincia Los Andes, del departamento de La paz junto con su esposa y familia,  se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno cuya producción de leche lo vende a Pil Andina (Planta industrializadora  de leche), su esposa le colabora con el cuidado de su familia  y sembradíos de forraje para el ganado.El crédito será destina do a la compra de ganado. Es su primer crédito en Impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Jorge lives in Copajira, Los Andes province, La Paz department, with his wife and family. He is a dairy farmer; he sells the milk produced to Pil Andina (large, industrial dairy products firm). His wife cares for the family and for the forage fields for the cattle. The loan will be used to buy cattle. This is his first Impro and first Kiva loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dairy cattle.

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es:
Estela es de la ciudad de Santa María Misiones, tiene 21 años, es hija de padres separados y vive con su abuela y su hermano menor, está estudiando en la Universidad Católica Nuestra Señora de la Asunción en San Ignacio, es una joven luchadora y con su espíritu emprendedor ya se encuentra en el 4to. Año de la carrera de ciencias económicas con especialidad en  Administración de empresas, a pesar de todos los obstáculos que debió superar es alumna regular, dedicada y muy estudiosa.
 Actualmente se desempeña como empleada en una librería de su localidad.
Ella solicita el préstamo para el pago de  gastos de la facultad y materiales de estudio.
María Estela agradece este préstamo ya que le ayudará en su estudio.
texts.en:
Estela, 21, is from the city of Santa María Misiones. She is the daughter of separated parents and lives with her grandmother and younger brother. She is enrolled in the Catholic University of Our Lady of the Assumption in San Ignacio. She’s a tenacious young woman with an enterprising spirit. She is in her fourth year, majoring in Economic Sciences with a special focus on Business Administration. Despite all the obstacles she’s had to overcome she’s a regular, dedicated, very studious student. She is employed by a local bookstore. She is asking for the loan to pay for some school supplies and school fees. María Estela is grateful for this loan because it will help her with her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For school supplies and other university expenses.

loans.name: Luis Alverto

texts.es:
Luis de 52 años, tiene una tienda en la ventana delantera de su casa (sus hijos de 12 y 10 aparacen en la foto), vive en una zona periurbana con caminos de tierra llamada “Paraíso”. 

Hace año atrás el tenia muchas metas para hacer con su familia, pero cuando su esposa lo abandono con sus tres hijos pequeños el tubo que hacerse cargo de ellos y comenzar a trabajar como cargador en las madrugadas en un mercado para dedicarles tiempo a ellos. Con sus ahorros y un préstamo el pudo comprar víveres para ubicar una pequeña tienda en la ventana de su casa, poco a poco construyo mejor su casa y la hizo de cemento. Ahora sus hijos de 16,12 y 10 años le ayudan en la tienda cuando regresan de la escuela. Mientras el sale a buscar mas trabajo para darles una mejor vida a sus hijos. 

Para seguir con su negocio el quiere con el préstamo comprar arroz, bebidas, azúcar, golosinas. En el futuro quiere que sus hijos tengan una mejor vida y poder hacer separaciones en su casa para que cada uno tenga su propio cuarto.
texts.en:
Luis is 52 years old and has a store at the front of his house (his children, ages 12 and 10, appear in the photo). He lives in a periurban area with dirt roads called “Paraíso”.

Last year Luis had many goals for his family to accomplish, but his wife left him alone to take care of their three young children. He started working as a porter in the early morning hours at the market so that he could spend time with them. Using his savings and a loan, Luis bought provisions and opened a store in his house. Over time he improved his home by constructing it out of cement. His children are now 16, 12, and 10 and help him manage the store when they return from school. Meanwhile he goes out looking for more work so that he can provide his children with a better life.

To continue his business, Luis wants to use this loan to buy rice, beverages, sugar, and candy. In the future he wants his children to have a better life and create separate spaces in his house so that they can have their own rooms.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, beverages, sugar, and candy

loans.name: Ada Luz

texts.es: Ada Luz G. es una confeccionista de ropa y de calzado que vive en Costa Hermosa, barrió ubicado en el municipio de Soledad, y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 30 a 43 años. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora e inició  un negocio desde el año  1980 cuando compró a crédito una maquina singer por valor de $12.000 COP y desde entonces siempre ha elaborado ropa infantil y femenina, actividad a la que le agregó en el año 2009, cuando hizo un curso de calzado la comercialización de este producto y gradualmente fue adicionando otros, así vendiendo a crédito en su barrio llegó a incrementar un poco sus ingresos y a aportar significativamente a los gastos familiares, especialmente cuando recibió financiamiento de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo organización, organización de la que ha recibido 3 créditos, impulsando su capital de trabajo y con ello el aumento de su clientela.  Su sueño es perfeccionar el negocio de fabricación de calzado, mejorar la calidad de este producto, adquiriendo mediante procesos formativos, cada vez mejores técnicas y modernos diseños para competir con calidad, porque sabe que para ello hay que prepararse.  Su actual credikiva lo utilizará para comprar materias primas e insumos y fabricar calzado, así como también ropa de mujer para  venderla, aprovechando la temporada que se avecina donde el negocio se hace mas fuerte.
texts.en:
Ada Luz G. manufactures clothing and footwear for a living. She lives in Costa Hermosa, a neighborhood located in the town of Soledad. She has 3 children between the ages of 30 and 43 years old. She is an very enterprising woman and started her business in 1980 when she bought a Singer sewing machine valued at $12,000 Columbian pesos on credit. Since then she has always made children's clothing, but in 2009 she added women's clothing. When she took a course in marketing footwear, she gradually added others and was able to sell on credit in her neighborhood. She increased her income a bit this way and was able to contribute significantly to the family's expenses, especially when she received a loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo organization. She has received 3 loans from them which gave her working capital a boost and consequently, increased her customer base. Her dream is to perfect the shoe manufacturing side of her business. She would like to improve the quality of her products by learning better techniques and modern designs in order to be competitive. She knows that she needs to prepare for this. With the Kiva loan that she is requesting, she will buy raw materials and supplies to make footwear and women's clothing to sell, taking advantage of the upcoming season when business picks up.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and supplies to make footwear and women's clothing to sell

loans.name: Enma

texts.es: Enma, de 45 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Glicer de 33 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El negocio de Enma esta ubicado en el centro artesanal del poblado de San Pedro de Cajas, ella esta convencida que la variedad de sus productos incrementaran sus ventas, es por eso que se esmera mucho en no repetir modelos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y mientras más lo hace mejor se siente, además que de esta forma puede pagar los estudios de sus menores hijos, lleva 20 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus tejido hasta su puesto de venta, ya que vive muy lejos de ahí. Para el futuro, espera juntar el dinero necesario para poner una tienda donde pueda vender con mayor tranquilidad sus prendas tejidas. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP y es muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta y sabe que le ayudará a progresar. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más lana para incrementar la cantidad de prendas que produce.
texts.en:
Enma, 45, is an unassuming, hard working woman. She lives in her own home with her husband, Glicer, 33, and their two beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. Enma’s business is located in San Pedro de Cajas’ Artisan Center. She is convinced that the variety of her products are the reason for her increased sales. This is why she tries hard not to repeat any of her designs. What she most enjoys about her work is weaving and the more she does it the better she feels. Besides, this makes it possible for her to pay for her children’s education. She’s been in this line of work for 20 years and considers the most difficult part of it having to take her weavings all the way to her sales booth because she lives quite far from there. For the future she’d like to gather enough money to set up a store where she can sell her items more comfortably. This is her 3rd loan with MFP; she is very punctual with her repayments because she doesn’t want to cause any problems for her communal bank where she is very happy and knows that it will help her progress. She wil use the requested 500 new soles to buy wool to increase the amount of items she makes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool to increase her production of weavings.

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.en:
Mirtha is the treasurer for this communal bank “Fe en cada Paso” (Keeping Hope with Every Step) and resides in the commune of Maipú.  She operates a beauty salon from her house, in a small room that she recently had constructed.  She cuts hair for both adults and children, and is able to dye and style hair, and to provide head massages, waxing and manicures.  Martha gained these talents through various courses that she has been taking through the years. 

With this loan Martha intends to complete the finish work in her hair salon, as it lacks details of construction such as changing the wood floor to ceramic or tile, covering the walls and ceiling with plaster and painting throughout the interior. Mirtha has three daughters, ages 20, 17 and 11, all of whom she cares for with the support of her husband. 

Mirtha dreams of having the machines and tools that are missing from her hair salon, such as a steaming machine, a hair cutting machine (better than the one she has now) and a hair wash chair, among other things. 

Mirtha enjoys participating in the Fondo Esperanza weekly meetings, as she has learned a lot about how to manage her money, in addition to passing wonderful moments together with the companionship of the group. 

Maipú is a village located to the east of Santiago, Chile´s capital city.  Maipú has been designated as the most noteworthy village of Chile, and as a national heritage site, because of important historical events that occurred there during Chile´s fight for independence.

loans.use: Construction completion for beauty salon

loans.name: Las Esteritas Group

texts.es: Natividad tiene 66 años y es viuda, lleva 8 años sustentándose con el alquiler D. los cuartos en sus casa y ah trabajado con Edaprospo desD. hace 2 años y medio, hace poco acaba D. hacer mejoras en su casa para tener a sus clientes contentos y si tuviera un buen capital D. dinero lo invertiría techando su casa y haciendo mas cuartos. El grupo D. la cual es socia se llama “Las Esteritas” el cual esta conformado por sus vecinos  y lleva el mismo nombre D. la Urbanización.
texts.en:
Natividad, 66, is a widow. She has been supporting herself for 8 years renting out rooms in her house. She has collaborated with Edaprospo for two and a half years. A short while ago she completed improvements in her home to keep her lodgers happy and, if she had a good amount of capital, she’d invest it in reroofing her house and building more rooms. The group she is a member of is called “Las Esteritas” and its members are her neighbors and it’s named after their neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and ingredients.

loans.name: Embes Yazmani

texts.es:
Embes de 29 años, vive en una zona periurbana con caminos de tierra llamada “Paraíso”. tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, con su esposa tiene dos hijas gemelas de tres años. 

Inicio con su tienda hace 6 meses atrás, para poder mantener a su familia. Con su esposa trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano hasta el anochecer.  Una de las dificultades que tiene es la delincuencia que hay en el sector donde vive el tubo que poner unas rejas en su tienda para mayor seguridad. Vende arroz, bebidas, azúcar etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz bebidas, azúcar y otros víveres para mejorar su negocio. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su cas ay tener mejor surtida su tienda.
texts.en:
Embes, 29, lives in a periurban zone with unpaved streets called “Paraíso.” He has a small store in the front of his house. He and his wife have twin, three-year-old daughters. He started his store six months ago in order to support his family. He and his wife work every day from very early in the morning until nightfall. One of the difficulties he faces is the high crime rate in the area where he lives. He had to install metal grates on the store for better security. He sells rice, beverages, sugar, etc. He wil use the loan to buy rice, beverages, sugar and other foodstuffs to improve his store. In the future he wants to finish building his house and have his store better stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For rice, beverages and sugar.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, D. 56 años, es una mujer que siempre ha luchado por sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es vivir una vejez tranquila. Los tejidos artesanales que Gladys realiza, son muy novedosos y llamativos, ella los venD. en el puesto que tiene en el centro artesanal del poblado D. San Pedro D. Cajas, sus clientes prefieren comprarle por que ofrece muy buenos precios, además que es una vendedora muy carismática y persuasiva. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es tejer, es por eso que siempre hace modelos novedosos, lleva 26  años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tejer los inmensos telares que son lo que más se venden a los turistas. En adelante, espera poner una tienda más granD. donD. pueda vender sus tejidos. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, esta dispuesta a pagar sin demora sus cuotas, para no perjudicarse y no meter en problemas a las demás socias. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más lana para producir más tejidos artesanales.
texts.en:
Gladys, 56, is a woman who has always fought to get ahead in life. She lives in her own home and what she most wants is to have a carefree old age. The artisanal weavings that Gladys makes are quite unique and eye-catching. She sells them in a stand she has in San Pedro D. Cajas’ Artisanal Center. Her customers prefer to buy from her because her prices are very good. Besides, she is a persuasive and charismatic seller. What she likes best about her work is weaving and that’s why she always makes such unique patterns. She has been in this line of work for 26 years and considers the most difficult part of the job to be weaving the huge weavings that are the best sellers among tourists. In the future she plans to set up a larger store to sell her works. This is her 7th loan with MFP. She is determined to repay on time so as not to cause any problems with the other members. She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy more wool to produce more artisanal weavings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more wool to increase production.

loans.name: Lideres De Santa Rosa Group

texts.es: Zoraida tiene 51 años de edad y vive en la zona B de Huaycan, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales aun esta a cargo de 2, ya lleva 20 años vendiendo Herbalife y abarrotes en general, además de 7 años trabajando con Edaprospo con el cual últimamente pudo comprar una computadora, mejorar su tienda y cubrir los gastos de su casa y del colegio, espera pronto instalar un locutorio en la tienda y que también les valla bien a sus 14 socios del grupo “Lideres de Santa Rosa” los cuales son sus amigos del mercado donde trabajan el cual lleva el mismo nombre del grupo.
texts.en:
Zoraida, 51, lives in Huaycan’s Zone B. She has a life partner and three children two of whom are still in her care. She has sold Herbalife products and assorted groceries for 20 years. She has collaborated with Edaprospo for 7 years and recently was able to buy a computer, improve her store and cover her household and school expenses. She hopes to install a public phone booth soon in the store and that the 14 members of her communal bank, called “Lideres de Santa Rosa,” will all do well. They are all her friends from the market where they work and which has the same name as the group.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and ingredients.

loans.name: San Cayetano Ii Group

texts.es:
Este comité se denomina  San Cayetano y se encuentra conformado por mujeres talentosas y emprendedoras, que día  a día trabajan por sus familias para darle la mejor calidad de vida posible.
De esta manera todas procuran y una de ellas es la señora Francisca quien tiene una Despensa en su casa trabaja con sus hijos atendiendo su negocio y al mismo tiempo tiene animales en su casa los cuales cría para el consumo de ellos. 
El ingreso más importante y que cubre los gastos especialmente de alimentación de la familia es la que obtiene con la Despensa. 
Solicita el préstamo para compra de compra de mercaderías para su negocio como fideos, arroz, azúcar, harina, y otros.
texts.en:
This committee is called San Cayetano and is composed of talented, enterprising women who work daily to provide their families with the best possible quality of life. They all have the same goal. One of them is Francisca who has a grocery store in her home. Her children help her tend to the business and at the same time she raises small farm animals for the family’s consumption. The store provides the most important source of income for the family especially to cover nutritional expenses. She is asking for funds to buy stock merchandise like: pasta, rice, sugar, flour and others.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pasta, sugar, flour, rice, cleaning supplies, dairy products and baked goods.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua N. cooks beans and gari, popularly called red–red, at Elmina (gari is a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava). She has been in the sale of red-red for five years now.

Efua is married with four children and responsibly helps her husband to take care of the home. She has received junior high education.

Efua’s loan will be used to buy more gari and beans for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a shop so she can sell other foods in addition to the red-red.

loans.use: To buy more gari and beans to sell

loans.name: José Alejandro

texts.es: El señor José Alejandro A. P. es una persona muy trabajadora que esta dispuesto a ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. El hace tiempo obtuvo una vivienda de interés social, solo que la barda de la parte de atrás esta muy pequeña y quiere levantarla mas alto; ya que atrás hay mucha hierva y teme que cuando sus niños anden afuera alguna animal les pueda hacer daño. Para realizar su proyecto el requiere de un préstamo para compra el material y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
Mr. José Alejandro A. P. is a very hard working person who is determined to provide his family with a better quality of life. Some time ago he acquired a public housing unit but the rear wall is too short and he wants to make it higher because there are a lot of weeds in the rear and he’s afraid that when his children go out to play some animal that can harm them might be able to get in. To do this project he needs a loan to buy the materials and supplies and to pay labor costs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise a wall.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua S. is married and has six dependents. She has been through junior high education.

Efua sells plantain, cassava, and other vegetables at Elmina and uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase extra foodstuffs to meet the demand of her customers.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to save to support the welfare of her dependents.

loans.use: To purchase extra foodstuffs to meet the demand of her customers

loans.name: San Juana

texts.es: San Juana Díaz M. es madre soltera de un a niño al que quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida y por quien sale adelante. Por el momento ella requiere un préstamo para levantar cimientos al frente de su vivienda para empezar a construir una barda y así su casa quede protegida de algún delincuente. Para poder realizar su proyecto pide el apoyo para comprar material de construcción.
texts.en:
San Juana Díaz M. is a single mother of a son for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life and for whom she attempts to gets ahead. At the moment she needs a loan to build the foundations to build a wall in front of her house so that her house will have protection against delinquents. To do this project she is asking for help to buy the building materials.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build foundations for a wall.

loans.name: Esiquio

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la imagen es la esposa.
El señor Esiquio S. fuentes y su esposa se dedican a la venta de ropa usada en una de la colonia muy conocidas de la ciudad y que recurre mucha gente. Esta actividad la realizan desde hace 3 año; negocio por el cual ellos obtienen ingresos para sostener los gasto familiares. Para seguir vendiendo ropa, zapatos y más, en este momento requieren un préstamo para surtir el negocio para el cambio de temporada.
texts.en:
The person in the photo is his wife. Mr. Esiquio S. Fuentes and his wife sell used clothes in one of the city’s best known neighborhoods where many people come by. They have been doing his for 3 years and it produces income for them to support their family. In order to continue selling clothes, shoes and other items, they need a loan to stock the store with items for the new season. .

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Rafig

texts.ru:
Rafig D. 46 let. On ne jenat i imeyet 2 detey, sin kotoromu 15 let on uchistya v shkole  i zanimayetsya sportom , a dochka 18 let v etom qodu postupila v universitet. Rafig yavzlayetsya IDP personoy , on preselenec iz Fuzuli i seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste s semyoy. 

Uje 7 let tomu nazad Rafig nachal zanimatsya etim biznesom taxista. Ranshe eqo otec toje 15 let zanimalsya etim je delom vojdeniya taxi. Seychas Rafig nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti  dlya svoyey mashini.
texts.en:
Rafig D. is 46 years old. He is single. He has two children, a 15-year old son who goes to school and practices sports, and an 18-year old daughter who has been admitted to the university this year. Rafig is an Internally Displaced Person; he is a refugee from the Fuzuli Region currently living in the Absheron Region with his relatives. It has been 7 years since Rafig first started working as a taxi driver. His father too used to be a taxi driver for 15 years. At present Rafig needs 2,000 AZN in order to buy spare parts for his car.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing automotive spare parts

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La señora Patricia H. Cárdenas desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de comida como lo son hamburguesas, tacos, menudo y pozole que lo distribuye con sus conocidos. Este negocio le ha beneficiado mucho en su economía ya que es de la manera que ella cubre sus gastos. Para seguir con su venta requiere de un préstamo comprar mas mercancía.
texts.en:
For a year Patricia H. Cárdenas has sold food such as hamburgers, tacos, menudo, and pozole to her acquaintances. This business has improved her economic situation because it covers her bills. To continue with her sales she requires a loan to buy more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking her business

loans.name: Jhanet

texts.es: Jhanet, de 32 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Robert de 33 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Sus días los pasa tejiendo chompas, chalinas, guantes, entre otras prendas. Sus tejidos son comprados por tiendas de ropa en la ciudad de Huancayo, donde son vendidas con mucha rapidez, es por eso que tiene una gran demanda y trabaja mucho para satisfacerla, ya que sabe que es un muy buen ingreso para su negocio. Paralelamente a esta actividad, también ha logrado poner una tienda de abarrotes, negocio que la ayuda a obtener los ingresos familiares. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y lo hace con mucha habilidad, lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es realizar los acabados en las prendas que teje. Con todo el trabajo realiza, espera tener más adelante una tienda de ropa, donde pueda vender ella misma la ropa que teje y así mejorar sus ingresos. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP y esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más lana para confeccionar más prendas y así ofrecer una mayor variedad a las tiendas con las que trabaja.
texts.en:
Jhanet, 32-years-old, is a simple, hardworking woman. She lives in her own house with her husband, Robert (33-years-old), and their 3 beloved children, to whom she wants to be able to provide a better quality of life. She spends her days knitting sweaters, scarves, gloves, and other garments. Her knitted products are bought by clothing stores in the city of Huancayo, where they're sold very quickly. She works hard to satisfy the high demand for her products because she knows it's a good income for her business. In addition to this activity, she has also managed to start a grocery shop, a business that helps her cover her family expenses. What she loves most about her job is knitting, which she does very well. She's knitted for 12 years and says that the most difficult part is putting the finishing touches on the garments that she knits. With all the work she does, she hopes to eventually open a clothing shop, where she herself will be able to sell the garments she makes and improve her income. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she's saving money to make her payments on time because she doesn't want to cause problems with the members of her communal bank, where she is very happy. With the money she's requesting she will buy more wool to make more garments and offer a better variety to the stores with which she works.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a variety of wool to increase her knitting production

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: Reynaldo C. Zavala es un señor muy emprendedor a pesar de ser pensionado, el cuenta con un negocio donde repara automóviles cuando están en malas condiciones a causa de un choque, los cuales les arregla la parte y la pinta para quede mejor. Este negocio ya tiene dos años para así tener más ingresos y poder cubrir sus gastos.
texts.en:
Reynaldo C. Zavala is a hardworking man despite being on a pension. He repairs automobiles when they're in bad condition due to an accident. He fixes them and paints them. He's had this business for two years and has more income that helps to cover his expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Vilma Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doña Vilma es una señora D. 62 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio San Jorge D. San Miguel, es madre soltera y vive junto a su hija D. 25 años D. edad, Ella administra un negocio donD. venD. productos plásticos y lozas dicho negocio fue iniciativa propia para poder cubrir con los gastos del hogar. Ella necesita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra D. platos, tazas, ollas, sartenes y otros productos para ofrecer a los clientes; Este préstamo ayudara a que Dona Vilma crezca con su negocio y este le genere los ingresos necesarios para cubrir las necesidades como la alimentación diaria.
Su sueño es poseer un negocio granD. ayudar a su hija con sus estudios y mejorar sus condiciones D. vida.
texts.en:
Vilma is 62-years-old. She lives in the municipality of San Jorge D. San Miguel. She's a single mother and lives with her 25-year-old daughter. She runs a business where she sells plastic products and crockery. This business was her own initiative to cover her home expenses. She needs a loan to invest in the purchase of plates, cups, pots, pans, and other products to offer her customers. This loan will help Vilma grow her business and generate the income necessary to cover her basic daily expenses. Her dream is to own a large business to help her daughter with her studies and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of plastic products, pots, and pans

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban O. S. cuenta con una carpintería donde realiza trabajos como lo son closets, cocinas integrales, bases para camas, comedores, sillas depende de lo que el cliente requiera de acurdo a la medida deseada. 
El señor es una persona muy trabajadora que le gusta su oficio como carpintero ya que de esta manera; es como el gana más dinero para mantener los gastos de su familia. El es padre de dos pequeños a quienes quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida es por ello que requiere de un  préstamo para comprar mas madera y así seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Esteban O. S. is a carpenter who does jobs such as closets, built-in kitchens, bed frames, dining rooms, and chairs, depending on what the customer requires. He's a hardworking person who likes his job as an independent carpenter. He works to maintain his family. He's the father of two small children to whom he wants to offer a better quality of life. He requires a loan to buy more wood and continue with his business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood for carpentry business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita, de 38 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 queridos hijas Yoselin de 14 y Lisbeth de 12 años, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. En la comodidad de su hogar Margarita teje a mano sus coloridas prendas artesanales, todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano, ya que tiene que cumplir con los pedidos que le hacen sus compradores. Ella no solo se dedica a vender lo que teje, sino que también recolecta de otras tejedoras, quienes igualmente reciben una buena paga por su trabajo. Lo que más le gusta de su actividad, es que de cierta forma también ayuda a sus compañeras a progresar, lleva 15 años realizando esta labor y considera que lo más difícil es tener que amanecerse para cumplir con los pedidos. Para más adelante, espera formar una empresa con sus compañeras tejedoras, con la cual todas puedan desarrollarse. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, en sus anteriores pagos siempre fue muy puntual y espera serlo ahora también, las socias de su banco comunal le tiene mucho cariño, ya que es muy responsable. Con los cuatrocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más lana para elaborar nuevas prendas artesanales.
texts.en:
Margarita is 38 years old, and is a very simple and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house together with her two beloved daughters, Yoselin who is 14 and Lisbeth who is 12 years old, and to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life. In the comfort of her home, Margarita weaves colored handcrafted garments by hand. Every day she starts working very early, since she has to complete the orders that her buyers make. She not only sells what she weaves, but also she collects garments from other weavers, who also receive a good payment for their work. What she likes most about her work, is that she also helps her coworkers get ahead. She has been doing this work for 15 years, and what she considers most difficult is to be able to wake up early in order to complete the orders. In the future, she hopes to form a business with her weaving colleagues, so that they can all develop themselves. This is her fourth loan with MFP, in her previous payments she was always very punctual and she expects to be so now also. The members of her community bank are very fond of her, since she is very responsible. With the 400 soles requested, she will buy more wool in order to make new handcrafted garments.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool in order to make more woven garments

loans.name: Karina Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Karina Elizabeth Hernández A. cuenta cn un negocio de la venta de comida desde  hace 10 años  lo cual ofrece variedad en platillos como lo son s, tacos, tamales, menudo y pozole y mas depende del platillo que el cliente quiera comer y lo distribuye con sus conocidos aun bajo precio de acuerdo a la economía. Este negocio le ha beneficiado mucho en su economía ya que es de la manera que ella cubre sus gastos. Para seguir con su venta requiere de un préstamo comprar más mercancía.
texts.en:
Mrs. Karina Elizabeth Hernández A. has had a prepared food business for 10 years. She offers a variety of dishes like: tacos, tamales, menudo (tripe soup) and pozole (soup made with a pork and white corn base) and others depending on what the customer wants to eat. She sells to her acquaintances at a low price and according to the economy. The business has been of great benefit to her because this is how she meets household expenses. To continue selling she needs funds to buy more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Paola Andrea

texts.es:
Paola de 29 años, vende bebidas y comida en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil zona caracterizada por sus caminos montañosos. 

Inicio vendiendo bebida desde que su esposo la abandono para poder mantener a sus tres hijos, le presto a un amigo un congelador y compro barias pacas de bebidas, poco a poco con esfuerzo también comenzó a vende comida. Trabaja en ocasiones con ayuda de la mama para tener tiempo para sus hijos.     

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas y carnes para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener bien constituido su negocio para que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Paola, 29 years old, sells drinks and food from the front of her house. She lives in the Paraiso of Guayaquil, a mountainous area on the outskirts of the city. She began to sell drinks to support her 3 children when her husband abandoned her. A friend loaned her a freezer, and she purchased various bulk packs of drinks. Little by little, with much effort, she also began to sell food. On occasion her mother helps her; she then has time for her children. With this loan she wants to buy drinks and meat for her business. Her goal is to have her business well-established so that her children can have a brighter future.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of drinks and meat

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel, de 38 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Desde muy joven Maribel incursiono en el negocio de los tejidos artesanales, trabajando para otras personas logro mantener a su familia, ahora ella se ha comprado sus propias maquinas de tejer y trabaja a pedido. Su trabajo es de muy buena calidad, motivo por el cual cada vez tiene mas pedidos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite estar junto a sus hijos mientras cumple con sus pedidos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar todos los días sin descanso para alcanzar su meta. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más maquinas para poder incrementar su producción. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP y se siente en la capacidad de poder pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una socias muy alegre, por lo cual es muy querida dentro del grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más lana para incrementar la cantidad de tejidos que elabora.
texts.en:
Thirty-eight-year-old Maribel is a simple, hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her 3 dear children, to whom Maribel wishes to give a better quality of life. Since she was very young, Maribel worked at the business of craftwork weaving, working for others to support her family. Now she has purchased her own weaving machines and works to fill the requests she receives. Her work is very high quality; for this reason she always has more requests. She likes her work because she is able to stay with her children as she fills requests. She has done this work for 10 years and considers tha most difficult part of the work that she must work every day without rest to reach her goal. In time, she would like to buy more machines to increase production. This is her eighth loan from Microfinanzas Prisma (local lending institution), and she feels capable of making her payments on time. She is a very cheerful member of her village bank and is therefore well-liked within the group. With the 2000 nuevos soles ($725) requested, she will buy more wool to increase production.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool for use in weaving.

loans.name: Ma Consuelo

texts.es:
la sra. Ma Consuelo A. A. se dedica al comercio, tiene un pequeño negocio en el cual vende ropa para cama, cremas, perfumes, aceites y otra variedad de productos.
su negocio esta ubicado en la colonia Villa Nueva sector # 2, Ma se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 6 Años.
El credito lo utilizara para invertirlo en la compra de varios productos como ser: lociones, cremas,  desodorantes, shampoo, cosméticos, ropa de cama etc., 
tambien tiene un trabajo de medio tiempo en el Jardín de Niños de la misma colonia.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Consuelo A. A. has a small business where she sells pajamas, creams, perfumes, oils, and other products. Her business is located in the #2 sector of the Villa Nueva area and she has been doing this for six years. She will use the money from this loan to buy various products such as lotions, creams, deodorants, shampoo, cosmetics, pajamas, etc. She also works part time at t kindergarten in the same neighborhood. She needs this income so that she can support her children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam, de 37 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y su querido hijo menor, a quien desea brindarles una mejor calida de vida. El negocio al que Miriam se dedica es la elaboración de tejidos artesanales, su trabajo comienza muy temprano por la mañana, cuando junto a su esposo empiezan a trabajar en los modelos especiales que le han pedido. Ella es una tejedora muy buena, motivo por el cual sus confecciones son muy bonitas y llamativas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y más aun si son artesanías, lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar todo el día para cumplir con los pedidos que le realizan. Para el futuro, espera poder comprar nuevas maquinas, para avanzar más rápido en la producción Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, aunque para eso tenga que ir ahorrando poco a poco, en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más lana para incrementar la producción que tiene actualmente.
texts.en:
Miriam is 37 years old and is a very happy and hard working woman. She lives in a home of her own along with her husband and young son, to whom she wants to give a good quality of life. Mariam knits various types of crafts and she and her husband begin their work early each morning, working to fill orders that they’ve received. She is a good knitter, so her creations are very nice and attractive. What he enjoys most about her work is the knitting, especially if she is working on crafts. She’s been doing this for 12 years and feels that the most challenging part is having to work all day to fill her orders. In the future she hopes to be able to buy new machinery that will allow her to decrease her production time. This will be her fourth loan through MFP and she is prepared to make all of her payments on time, and she knows that it means that she will have to save little by little. She is well liked in her communal bank. She will use the 2,000 PEN ($725) from this loan to buy more yarn in order to increase her current production.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Elvis Gunnar

texts.es:
Elvis es un padre de familia de 51 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, un distrito agrícola caracterizado por presentar una geografía accidentada, dada su cercanía con la sierra norte del país. Se encuentra ubicado a mas de hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de veinte años a brindar servicio de reparación de todo tipo de calzado en un pequeño taller que tiene como nombre “La Favorita”. Este taller goza de bastante acogida debido al tiempo que lleva funcionando y a la calidad con la que suele realizar su trabajo. Este negocio le ha brindado los ingresos que necesitaba para sacar adelante a su familia por lo que siempre ha tratado de mantenerlo del mejor modo posible.

Elvis desea adquirir algunos repuestos y herramientas para contar son un stock permanente que le permita realizar su trabajo con mayor facilidad. Usualmente, cuando necesita adquirir algun repuesto o herramienta, suele viajar hasta la ciudad de Chiclayo para adquirirlo, esto hace que tenga que gastar en pasajes y hasta perder un dia de trabajo, es por ello que considera bastante importante la inversion que piensa realizar. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Elvis es una persona trabajadora, responsable y bastante entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir sacando adelante a su taller para poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Sus vecinos y conocidos de consideran alguien de confianza.
texts.en:
Elvis is the 51 year old father of four children. He and his family live in the Oyotún district, an agricultural district known for its haphazard geography, given its proximity to the country’s northern mountain range. It’s located more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. Elvis has been doing shoe repair for more than 20 years from his small shop, called “La Favorita” (The Favorite). This shop brings in plenty of business because of its good service and quality workmanship and provides the income he needs to move his family ahead and give them the best life possible. Elvis wants to buy some supplies and tools so that he can have them in stock, allowing him to improve the quality of his work. Usually, whenever her needs to buy tools or supplies, he travels to Chiclayo to buy them, so he has to pay for travel and lose work days. This is the reason that he considers this

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
el sr. Emilio A. A. se dedica al servicio de reparacion de Radiadores para automoviles, tiene un taller el cual opera bajo el nombre de “TALLER DE RADIADORES“ que esta ubicado en la colonia Honduras, cuenta con 6 años de experiencia en dicha actividad.
Emilio tiene clientes fijos como ser taxis y de otros talleres y empresas.
su negocio le genera una utilidad mensual que le ayuda para cubrir con los gastos del hogar, así mismo recibe otros ingresos ya que tiene un busito en el que transporta niños para una escuela.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas materiales para la reparacion de los radiadores.
nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que todo le va saliendo muy bien y que cada dia que pasa esta teniendo nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Emilio A. A. repairs automobile radiators from his shop called “Taller de Radiadores” (Radiator Repair Shop), located in the Honduras neighborhood. He has six years’ experience. Emilio has steady customers; taxis and other workshops and companies. His business generates him a monthly income that helps cover the household expenses. He also has another small business where he transports children to school in a small bus. He will use the money from this loan to buy more radiator repair supplies. He tells us that he is very happy because things are going well for him and he is bringing in new customers every day.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tools and supploes

loans.name: Martha Eliuth

texts.es:
la sra. Martha Eliuth S. C. se dedica a la fabricacion de reposteria en general, su negocio opera bajo el nombre de “REPOSTERIA MI PROSPERIDAD” que se encuentra ubicado en la calle principal de la colonia Kennedy. Martha tiene 2 meses de tener su negocio, anteriormente lo tenía dentro de las instalaciones de Coacel, pero se salió ya que quería hacer crecer su negocio con mas clientela.
Martha elabora pan, pasteles, galletas, boquitas, desayunos, almuerzos, refrescos naturales y golosinas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de una Batidora, moldes y materia prima para realizar el pan y la reposteria.
texts.en:
Martha Eliuth S. C. makes general desserts. Her business operates under the name “Reposteria Mi Prosperidad” (My Prosperity Desserts), and is located on the main street in the Kennedy neighborhood. Martha has had her business in this location for two months; it used to be located within the Coacel complex, but she moved it because she wanted to be able to grow her business and increase her customer base. Martha makes breads, cakes, cookies, snacks, breakfast, lunches, natural soft drinks, and sweets. She will use the money from this loan to buy a mixer, bread and dessert molds and supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tools of the trade

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Señor Nazareno Group

texts.es:
ALCOM: SEÑOR NAZARENO.

Alcancía Comunal creada hace 04 meses, conformadas por nueve socios emprendedores, nos cuentan que esta Alcancía se formó gracias al incentivo e influencia de una socia quien pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal “ Mi Amigo Jesús”.

Veamos el caso de María Mercedes Z., integrante de la ALCOM: “Señor Nazareno” con 37 años de edad, conviviente con una hija, ella se dedica al comercio, con las ventas de sandwichs, gaseosas, habitas fritas, chifles, chicharrón de pollo, agua de manzana,etc, que ofrece a los viajeros que llegan de diferentes lugares del interior del País, relata que desde muy jovencita ella aprendió hacer este tipo de negocios, ayudando a su mami vendiendo sandwichs (pollo, carne), y así fué esmerándose a diario,  hoy en dia cuenta con un negocio propio, ese esfuerzo la llevó a generar mayores ganancias; en la que las invierte para la educación de su menor hija, quien lleva cursando estudios primarios, y los gastos necesarios que se requiere; para ello solicitó su crédito a EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, con el fin de terminar con la construcción de su nuevo kiosko, como también para implementar sus mercaderías, así mismo nos cuenta que los gastos también lo asume su pareja, que ambos aportan para el beneficio y la comodidad de su familia.
texts.en:
SEÑOR NAZARENO COMMUNAL BANK A communal bank created four months ago with nine enterprising members. They tell us that this bank was formed thanks to the incentive and influence of a member who is part of the “Mi Amigo Jesús” communal bank. Let’s take a look at the case of María Mercedes Z., a member of “Señor Nazareno” communal bank. She is 37 years old, has a live-in partner and a daughter. She is a merchant selling sandwiches, soft drinks, fried lima beans, fried plantain, fried chicken, apple juice, etc. to travelers who arrive from the interior of the country. She relates that she learned this type of business while still very young helping her mother sell meat and chicken sandwiches. Every day she’d try harder. Today she has her own business and her efforts have led to greater profits that she uses to pay for expenses and her young daughter’s education; she is in elementary school. She asked EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD for a loan to finish building a new kiosk and to stock it with merchandise. She told us that her partner helps pay for household expenses and both contribute to the family’s wellbeing and comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a new kiosk and set up her merchandise.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Nora, de 45 años, es una mujer muy alegre y sincera, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Rolando de 45 años y su querido hijo menor Gerardo de 22 años, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El negocio al que se dedica Nora son los tejidos artesanales, tiene su puesto de venta en el centro artesanal del poblado de San Pedro de Cajas, en el cual vende las prendas que ella misma confecciona y que son rápidamente compradas por sus clientes, ya que los modelos que hace son muy novedosos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y mejor aun si son artesanías, lleva 7 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta sin poder salir, espera con el tiempo poner una tienda más grande donde pueda atender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es una de las socias más cumplidas y puntuales.
Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más lana para confeccionar más tejidos artesanales y aumentar su stock.
texts.en:
Nora is 45 years old and is a very happy and sincere lady. She lives in her own home, along with her husband, 45 year old Ronaldo, and her 22 year old son Gerardo, to whom she want to provide a better quality of life. Nora knits and has a stall in the cultural center of San Pablo de Cajas, where she sells the items that she makes. Customers buy them up quickly because her designs are very innovative. What she enjoys most about her work is knitting; especially when her items are artistic in nature. She’s been doing this for seven year and what she considers to be the most challenging part is having to spend all day in her stall without being able to leave. She hopes to one day be able to open a bigger store, where she will be able to attend to her customers more comfortably. This will be her sixth loan through MFP and she’s prepared to make all of her payments on time. She’s one of the most punctual and reliable members of her communal bank. She will use the 1,500 PEN ($550) from this loan to buy more yarn so that she can knit more items and increase her stock.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: María Carmen Adelaida

texts.es:
