The members of the loan group San Gregorio meet every fortnight in Ciudadela San Gregorio, in the outskirts of Portoviejo. Neida has been happily married for 43 years and as a result of this great love she has four grown-up children, who still live at home. From Monday to Friday she works in a snack factory. She sells Yanbal products (beauty products and perfumes), also to her workmates. She owns a business that sells car parts along with her eldest son, who is a mechanic and whose garage is next door. This closeness helps sales. She buys the parts from a gentlemen who sells them directly from the factory and gives her a lower wholesale price. She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of electric car parts. She has been part of the loan group for a number of cycles and is very grateful to Fundacion Espoir for the support received. She hopes to be able to continue for much longer. Her goals are to continue with her business and buy a car so as to be able to make her purchases herself.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy car repair parts.

loans.name: Arenas Del Mar Group

texts.es:
Una asociación comunal que ha renovado su crédito, nueve ciclos como “Arenas del Mar” en un Centro Focal, es considerada madura, pues ya han experimentado la convivencia en grupo.  Por otro lado la asociación comunal en el tiempo también desarrollan una relación con el Centro Focal, en este caso con el C.F. Santiago II.

La señora Dionicia es la presidenta de la asociación, es una de las socias más antiguas, ella comenta que ya trabaja con Pro Mujer cerca de cinco años.  Ingreso a esa asociación gracias a la invitación de su cuñada.  Inicio el negocio tejiendo para otras personas, es decir trabajó como mano de obra durante 6 años, luego viendo que podía independizarse, comenzó con su propio negocio de tejido y venta de mantas de lana de alpaca.  El primer préstamo fue de Bs1200.-, fue utilizado para la compra de lana de alpaca para elaborar las mantas. El préstamo actual que solicitó fue de Bs.1500.-, con la misma finalidad.  Le colaboran dos personas en este trabajo.  Al momento tiene solo un hijo y vive con su pareja.  Lo que le gusta más de Pro Mujer es la posibilidad de reunirse con sus compañeras y capacitarse.

Los integrantes de la asociación comunal, cuentan con negocios diferentes, como por ejemplo: venta de ropa, venta de carne, venta de verduras, venta de metales, tienda de barrio y fundición de metal, venta de chuño y papa, tejido y venta  de mantas en lana de alpaca.
texts.en:
A loan group which has completed nine cycles in a focus centre, "Arenas del Mar" is considered mature, as it has already experienced communal living. Over time the loan group has also developed a relationship with the focus centre, which in this case is Centro Focal Santiago II. Dionicia is the president of the association and one of its oldest members. She says she has been working with Pro Mujer for about five years. She became a member of the group at the invitation of her sister-in-law. She started by weaving for other people, that is, she worked as labourer for six years. Afterwards she realised that she could become independent and she started her own business weaving and selling alpaca wool blankets. Her first loan was for Bs1200, which she used to purchase alpaca wool to make the blankets. The loan she has now requested, for Bs.1500, is for the same purpose. Two more people help her with the business. At the moment she only has one child and lives with her partner. What she most likes about Pro Mujer is the chance to meet with the other members and get some training. The members in the loan group all have different business, including selling clothes, selling meat, selling vegetables, selling metals, a neighbourhood shop, metal smelting, selling potato flour and potato, weaving and selling alpaca wool blankets.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Alpaca wool

loans.name: María Marianita

texts.es:
La señora María  es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal San Gregorio que se reúne en la ciudadela del mismo nombre cada quince días.
 
Mantiene una relación de unión libre hace 26 años y tiene cuatro hijos,  tres mayores  de edad y el ultimo que vive con ella y que esta por graduarse del colegio.

Desde muy temprano se levanta a preparar el desayuno de su hijo y después se va a su negocio de venta de jugos naturales  en la  terminal terrestre de Portoviejo en el cual tiene un puesto. Dice que vende muchos jugos porque ella siempre demuestra su buen humor lo que según ella atrae muchos clientes.

Tiene su casa propia la cual aun está en construcción, es por eso que esta vez solicito este nuevo crédito ya que quiere invertirlo en arreglar su cocina  que no tiene las condiciones adecuadas para su uso.
  
Sus sueños son terminar su casa y tener una gran tienda de productos naturales.
texts.en:
Mrs. María is a founding member of the Communal Bank San Gregorio which meets in the city with the same name every fifteen days.

She lives with her partner of 26 years and has 4 children. Three are elders and the last one is living with her and is about to graduate from college.

She wakes up very early to make her son breakfast then goes to her natural juice stand which is located in the Portoviejo terminal. She says she sells a lot of juices since she always is in a good mood and that attracts lots of clients.

She owns her own home that is still under construction, which is why she is requesting this new loan. She wants to fix up her kitchen which is not in working condition.

Her dreams are to finish building her home and have a large store to sell natural products.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix the kitchen.

loans.name: Carmen Marisol

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo encontramos la ciudadela San Gregorio lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal San Gregorio.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Carmen que nos cuenta algo de su vida. Tiene una relación de unión libre hace 20 años, de esta relación tuvieron tres hijos, una mayor de edad que estudia en la Universidad y los dos menores en el colegio, el marido es chofer (realiza fletes).

Tiene una pequeña picantería en su casa en el cual vende encebolladlos, ceviches y otros platos deliciosos que se preparan con mariscos. Trabaja de Jueves a Domingo de 7am. a 1pm, con la ayuda de su marido y sus hijos, dice que este negocio lo puso con ayuda de un crédito que realizo en la Fundación Espoir y que le ha ido muy bien.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a emplear en comprar sillas y mesas para dar más comodidad a sus  clientes.
 
Tiene siete ciclos en el Banco Comunal y espera seguir muchos ciclos más.
texts.en:
In the outskirts of Portoviejo, we find the Ciudadela San Gregorio, a place where the members of the communal bank "San Gregorio" meet twice a month. Here we find Carmen, who tells us something about her life. She has been in a common-law marriage for 20 years, and from this marriage they have 3 children: one who is now grown and studies in the University, and 2 younger ones who are in school. Her husband is a driver who transports freight. They have a small family-style restaurant attached to their home where they sell traditional food such as: encebollados (a soup made of tuna, cassava and vegetables), ceviche, and other dishes made from seafood. She works from Thursday to Sunday from 7am until 1pm, with the help of her husband and their children. She says that this business was established with the help of a loan that was taken from the Fundación Espoir, and that it has done very well. This new loan will be used to buy tables and chairs to provide greater comfort to her customers. She has participated in 7 loan cycles with her communal bank, and she hopes to continue for many more cycles.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 39 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para sobresalir en la vida. Desde muy pequeña Luz ha trabajado junto a sus padres en el cultivo de la tierra, con los años ha logrado comprarse sus propias chacras y ahora es una de las principales productoras de plátano y café de la provincia de Chanchamayo, lugar muy concurrido por la demanda de los productos que cosechan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y lo hace con mucho cariño, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, ya que es muy difícil encontrar camiones que quieran llevar los pesados sacos de cultivo. Con el paso del tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, con las cuales pueda incrementar su producción. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, está muy segura de poder pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas, ya que siempre ha sido muy puntual. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más fertilizantes para mejorar la productividad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Luz is 39 years old and a very hard-working woman. She lives in her own home and wants to work hard so she can progress in life. Since she was little, she has worked with her parents cultivating their land. Over the years, she has been able to buy her own land and now she is one of the primary growers of bananas and coffee in the Chanchamayo province, a place known for its agricultural products. Her favorite part of her job is taking care of her products which she does lovingly; she has done this work for 15 years and feels like the most difficult part is taking the products to market. It is very difficult to find trucks that are willing to carry the heavy sacks of crops. Over time, she hopes to buy more land in order to increase her production. This is her 3rd loan through MFP and she is confident that she will pay it back punctually as she has always done. In her village bank, she is a very happy and unified member. With the 2000 soles ($725 USD) she is seeking, she will buy fertilizer to improve the production of her land.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer to improver her productivity

loans.name: Flor De Luna Group

texts.es:
“Flor de Luna” es el nombre del la Asociación Comunal que está iniciando su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Santiago II. “Flor de Luna” está integrada por siete mujeres y un varón.   

La señora Romualda es la presidenta de la asociación, al igual que para todas sus compañeras este es su primer ciclo en una asociación.  

Su negocio es la venta de chompas, aprendió poco a poco, debido a la necesidad que tenía de un ingreso para su familia.  La solicitud que hizo fue de Bs. 1000.-, ella espera con este dinero comprar una máquina de tejer doble. La materia prima es comprada en la zona 16 de Julio y las ventas se realizan los días martes y jueves por la tarde en la feria denominada Tihuanacu.

Los integrantes de la asociación comunal, cuentan con diferentes negocios, como ser: venta de mantas, venta de chompas, diseño gráfico y encuadernación, comerciante de ropa, albañil y confección.
texts.en:
Flor de Luna is the name of the communal association that is starting its first loan cycle in the Focal de Santiago II center. Flor de Luna is made up of seven women and one man. Mrs. Romualda is the president of the association and it is also the first loan cycle for her as it is for the other members of the association. Her business is selling sweaters. She learned little by little because she needed to have some income for her family. Her request was for 1000 Bs ($1200). She hopes to use the money to buy a knitting machine. She buys the materials in the 16 de Julio area and she sells the products on Tuesday and Thursday afternoons in the Tihuanacu market. The members of the association have different businesses such as: selling blankets, selling sweaters, graphic design and bookbinding, selling clothing, bricklaying and baking.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Knitting machine

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es: Nélida, de 45 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Jorge y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Trabajando todos los días arduamente en sus cultivos, Nélida trata de cambiar la vida que actualmente lleva, poniendo todo su esfuerzo siembra continuamente plátanos y café, productos que vende en el mercado de la ciudad de La Merced, ya que es ahí donde mejores precios obtiene. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar su siembra de la plaga de insectos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus cultivos hasta el mercado donde los vende, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. Para más adelante, espera mejorar sus productos y así obtener mejores precios. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, siente que este crédito le será muy beneficioso en su crecimiento como agricultora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y solidaria. Con los mil ochocientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Nelida is 45 years old and a very happy and hard-working woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Jorge and she really wants to improve her quality of life. As they work together everyday in their fields, Nelida tries to change their current life, putting all her effort into growing bananas and coffe. They sell their crops in the market in La Merced where they can get the best prices. Her favorite part of her work is protecting her crops from insects. She has worked in this for 10 years but she thinks the hardest part of her work is getting her products to market since the sacks of crops are very heavy. In the future, she would like to improve her crops and get better prices. This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she feels like this loan will really help her to grow as a farmer. In her village bank, she is a very unified and involved member. She will use the 1800 soles ($650 USD) to buy fertilizer for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more fertilizer to improve her crops

loans.name: Teresa Margarita

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo encontramos la ciudadela San Gregorio lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal San Gregorio.

Aquí conversamos con la señora Margarita, tienen seis hijos fruto de una relación de unión libre que mantiene  hace treinta años, vive en una casa alquilada en la cual habitan siete personas.

Ella se dedica a la  venta de ropa interior, su forma de trabajo es venta de puerta en puerta, trabaja de cuatro a cinco horas al día,  cuatro días de la semana. Nos cuenta que le va muy bien ya que la mercadería que ella vende es de  muy buena calidad y es seleccionada. Viaja a Guayaquil una vez al mes a comprar su mercadería  y  traer   variedad que es lo que le gusta a sus clientes.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar lencería de damas ya que tiene muchos pedidos por entregar. Está en el Banco hace cinco ciclos y le gusta porque le han brindado muchos beneficios.
 
Su sueño son tener su propia casa para bien personal y de su familia.
texts.en:
In the outskirts of Portoviejo, we find the Ciudadela San Gregorio, a place where the members of the communal bank "San Gregorio" meet twice a month. Here we talked to Margarita, who has 7 children resulting from a common-law marriage which has lasted for 30 years. She lives in a rented home with 7 people. She sells underwear door-to-door, working 4 to 5 hours a day, 4 days a week. She tells us that it is going very well, since she sells choice merchandise that is of good quality. She travels to Guayaquil once a month to buy her merchandise and to bring a variety that is appealing to her customers. She will use this loan to buy lingerie for women, since she has a lot of orders to deliver. She has been in the bank for 5 loan cycles, and she likes it because it has provided her with a lot of benefits. Her dream is to have her own home for the benefit of herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy underwear for women

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es: La sra. Maria Dionisia H. tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, y junto a su familia reside en el municipio de San Francisco de la Paz, Olancho. Hace 12 años y sin saber nada de negocios la sra. Maria Dionisia decidiò comenzar a ganarse la vida instalando una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion, con un horario de atencion de 6:00 am a 7:00 pm y gracias a los prestamos que ha recibido de FAMA ella ha podido ir invirtiendo mas en su negocio y ahora es uno de los negocios mas prosperos de la comunidad, tambien ha mejorado su calidad de vida y hasta a comprado unas cuantas vacas. Es la Coordinadora del Grupo Solidario Dios es Amor y junto a sus 6 compañeros de grupo ya tiene 4 años de ser cliente activa en FAMA. El prestamo que solicita lo necesita para surtir su pulperia de mas y variados productos como ser: arroz, frijoles, condimentos, salsas, espaguetis, churros, refrescos, margarina, aceite, dulces, pan, etc. Su sueño es que su negocio se convierta en un mercadito y tener mas ingresos porque sus hijos estudian y ella quiere que lleguen a ser profesionales universitarios.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Dionisia H. is 46 years old, married, has 4 children, and lives with her family in the town of San Francisco de la Paz, Olancho. Twelve years ago, without much knowledge about business, Mrs. Maria Dionisia decided to make a living by installing a small grocery store in her home. She works from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. and thanks to the loans she has received from FAMA she has been able to invest more in her business and now owns one of the most successful businesses in the community. Her quality of life has also improved and she has been able to buy some cows. She is coordinator of the Solidarity Group, God is Love, and together with her 6 fellow members has been active for 4 years in FAMA. The loan she is requesting is needed to supply her grocery store with more and varied products such as: rice, beans, condiments, salsas, spaghetti, churros, sodas, margarine, oil, candies, etc. Her dream is that her business develop into a small market and that she make more profits for her children to study so that they can become university students.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products to supply her grocery store.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: Lily arreglaba prendas y confeccionaba otras para sus hijas con la idea de hacer un taller, de esto ya hace 2 años, el mismo tiempo que lleva trabajando con Edaprospo y en el cual ah adquirido experiencia y puesto su propio negocio de Confecciones “ZuyNy”. Desde hace 1 año es presidenta del grupo “ Mujeres Emprendedoras”  el cual tiene 7 años y medio de haberse creado, junto a sus 8 socias esperan lograr sus metas particulares, en su caso poner su propio taller de confecciones o una boutique.
texts.en:
Lily used to make and alter clothes for her daughters with the idea of setting up a workshop. This was 2 years ago, the same time she has been collaborating with Edaprospo and in which she has gained experience and has opened her dress shop called “ZuyNy”. For the past year she has been President of the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women) group that has been established for seven and a half years. Its 8 members expect to reach particular goals which in her case is to set up her own dressmaking workshop or a boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and ingredients.

loans.name: Karen Xiomara

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo encontramos la ciudadela San Gregorio lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal San Gregorio.

La señora  Karen tiene21 años y seis de casada, fruto de esta linda relación tienen un hermoso bebe de 5 años el cual ya está en el jardín de infantes. Su esposo tiene un local de ventas de CD en la terminal terrestre de Portoviejo.

Trabaja en las tardes en una casa haciendo quehaceres domesticas, además vende productos de Yanbal y Avon( productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios de damas)negocio al cual se dedica tres horas al día cuatro días de la semana, dice que no es tan difícil porque solo entrega los productos  que son bajo pedido. Se  inició en este negocio por la necesidad, ya que en ese tiempo la situación era muy mala, pero ahora gracias a Dios las cosas han mejorado un poco.

Este primer crédito que solicito lo va a invertir en comprar productos que estén en ofertas ya que después los vende a mejor precio. Es su primer crédito en el Banco Comunal, la invito una amiga y está muy contenta porque ha sido fácil conseguir el crédito.
 
Su meta es tener un local propio en el Centro Comercial de Portoviejo.
texts.en:
In the outskirts of Portoviejo is the city of San Gregorio, a place where every fifteen days the members of the Communal Bank San Gregorio meet.

Mrs. Karen is 21 years old with six of those in marriage. Resulting from this wonderful marriage is their 5 year-old who is already in preschool. Her husband owns a CD stand in the Portoviejo terminal.

In the afternoons, she does housework as well as sell Yasbel and Avon products (beauty products, perfumes, and women's accessories) for three hours a day, four days a week. She says it not so difficult since she delivers a small order of products. She started this business from necessity since her situation was very difficult but now thanks to God things have gotten a little better.

She plans on using her first loan to buy products which are on sale to resell them at retail price. This is her first loan with the Communal Bank. A friend invited her and she is very happy because it was very easy to obtain the loan.

Her goal is to have her own stand in the Portoviejo Shopping Center.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, creams, perfumes, and jewelry.

loans.name: Rosmeri

texts.es: Rosmeri, de 20 años es una joven muy sencilla y alegre, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. En la pequeña comunidad de Miraflores, Rosmeri ha pasado la mayor parte de su vida, desde muy niña aprendió la actividad familiar y es por eso que ahora se dedica al cultivo de plátano y café, trabajo que le ha brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse. Todo lo cosechado, lo vende en el mercado de la ciudad de la Merced, que es donde mejores precios obtiene por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, ya que los medio de transportes son muy escasos por su zona. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, con el fin de incrementar su producción. Es el tercer crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus créditos y espera serlo también ahora, en su banco comunal es muy activa y es muy querida por el resto de las socias. Con los mil ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus chacras.
texts.en:
Rosmeri, who is 20, is a very simple and happy young woman. She lives in her parents' house and what she wishes for most is to get ahead in life. In the small community of Miraflores, Rosmeri has spent the greater part of her life. At a young age, she learned her family business and it is due to this that now she is dedicated to farming bananas and coffee, work that has provided her with the income necessary to support herself. Everything that she produces, she sells in the market in the city of Merced, which is where she obtains the greatest prices for her products. What she likes most about her job is sowing her land, which she does with much care. She has been doing this work for three years and considers transporting goods to market the most difficult part since the means of transportation are scarce in her area. With time, she wishes to buy new land with the goal of increasing production in mind. This is her third loan with MFP. She has been punctual with her payments and hopes to do the same now. In her community bank, she is very active and is well-liked by the rest of the members. With the 1,800 new "soles" requested, she will buy more fertilizer for her farm.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motor for a mill.

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es: Maria Gloria M. M. tiene 30 años de edad, reside en la Colonia Nazareth junto a su familia que esta conformada por su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos de 8 y 9 años. Maria Gloria es una persona muy simpatica y muy conocida por sus vecinos. Desde hace varios años ella y su esposo se dedican a la venta de helados. Ella vende en el domicilio y su esposo de forma ambulante de pulperia en pulperia. Una de las dificultades que enfrentan es que el corte de energia electrica es muy comun en la ciudad y ellos no cuentan con una planta electrica asi que en muchas ocasiones tienen perdidas, ya que los helados se derriten. El prestamo que solicita lo necesita para comprar mas productos como Ice Cream, paletas de uva, fresa, nance, coco, limon, etc y asi incrementar su inventario y poder ofrecer mas variedad a sus clientes. Su meta es poder tener su propia fabrica de helados y construir su casa propia, y que sus hijos sigan estudiando ya que son unos niños muy aplicados.
texts.en:
Maria Gloria M. M. is 30 years old resides in colonia Nazareth in Juticalpa, Olancho. Maria lives with her family that is made up of her husband and two small children who are 8 and 9 years old. Maria Gloria is a very nice person and very popular amongst her neighbors. For many years she and her husband have been selling ice cream. She sells from their home while her husband sells from different grocery stores. One of the biggest challenges they face is that their are often power outages in their city and they do not have a generator. When the power goes out they lose money as their ice cream melts. The loan they are soliciting will be used to buy ice cream, and grape, strawberry, coconut, lemon popsicles in order to increase their inventory and offer their clients more variety. Their goal is to open their own ice cream production facility and build their own home and that their children continue to study since their currently very enthralled in their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar helados

loans.name: Yesica Liseth

texts.es: Yesica Liseth R. T. de 20 años de edad, es una joven muy emprendedora y visionaria la cual trabaja muy duro por poder salir adelante en la vida. Yesica reside en el pueblo de San Juan Opico únicamente junto a su madre quien le ayuda en el negocio, el cual es un comedor, en el que se preparan desayunos y almuerzos. Yesica se dedica a tiempo completo a su negocio, ya que es de este del cual dependen para poder suplir todos sus gastos en el hogar, por lo que desea mejorarlo en gran manera, ofreciendo una mayor variedad de platillos, de forma que sus clientes puedan sentirse más estimulados a visitar el comedor. Yesica solicita un préstamo a Integral con el enorme deseo de poder invertir en la compra de verduras, pastas, arroz, frijoles, frutas, bebidas y todo lo necesario para la elaboración de alimentos y de esta forma contar con más materia prima para extender la carta de comida. Con todo lo anterior tanto Yesica como su madre guardan la esperanza de mejorar sus ganancias y de esta forma contar con una vida mejor para ambas.
texts.en:
Yesica Liseth R. T. is 20 years old. She is a young entrepreneur and visionary who works extremely hard to get ahead in life. Yesica resides in the town of San Juan Opico and lives with her mother who helps manage her business. She operates a diner where she prepares breakfast and lunch. Yesica devotes herself completely to her business since she relies on it to supply all of her daily needs. Since she wants to improve even more, she tries to offer a variety of dishes to encourage her customers to visit the diner.

Yesica is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral because she wants to invest in the purchase of vegetables, pastas, rice, beans, fruit, beverages, and everything else necessary for preparing her dishes. By having more ingredients, she will be able to expand her menu. Relying on all their previous experiences, Yesica and her mother are hopeful of improving their income so that both of them can have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables, basic grains, and other ingredients

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: El Renacer De Chacrasana Group

texts.es:
ALCOM: EL RENACER DE CHACRASANA

Alcancía comunal con 07 integrantes mujeres, con afan por trabajar y mejorar sus ventas, con los préstamos que recibieron cada uno invertirá en su negocio con objetivos diferentes pero con expectativas de mejorar la economía en sus hogares.

Maria, joven de 26 años, con 2 hijos pequeños, socia de esta Alcancia Comunal,   “El Renacer de Chacrasana” trabaja comercializando productos de belleza, lleva 4 años trabajando como consultora, María se animó a trabajar en esta línea de cosméticos, desde que la visitaron a su domicilio los consultores de este producto, y con otras mas por UNA amiga quien la animó; asi mismo los fines de semana ella trabaja en la discoteca cercana a su vivienda como mesera, nos cuenta que con los incentivos y comisiones que ella recibe por las ventas de productos de belleza, ha logrado comprar artefactos para su sala, cuarto, cocina y comedor; de igual manera ella adquiere algunos productos de ambas líneas que se encuentran en liquidación como shampoo, colonias, perfumes, etc, y los revende a mayor precio, es asi como ella asume los gastos de su casa para darles lo necesario a sus dos niños, además Maria nos comenta que semanalmente juega una Junta ( junta de dinero entre varias personas), y los fines de semana las sortean, con esos ingresos, ella invierte comprando abarrotes, utiles, y alimentos; para sus hijos, el reciente préstamo que se le otorgó, lo invertirà  para comprar mas productos stock de belleza y asi aumentar sus ventas y ganancias.
Esta contenta de poder participar en este sistema que apoya a los microempresarios como ella.
texts.en:
EL RENACER DE CHACRASANA (Chacrasana’s Rebirth) COMMUNAL BANK A communal bank with 7 female members aiming to work to improve sales. The loans each has received will be invested in their businesses with different objectives but with the expectation to improve their home economy. Maria, 26, is a member of this communal bank. She has two small children. She sells beauty products and has been working for four years as a beauty consultant. She ventured to sell this line of cosmetics ever since she was visited in her home by this brand’s consultants and by others thanks to a girlfriend that encouraged her. On weekends she also works at a discotheque near her home as a waitress. She tells us that the commissions and incentives she gets from the beauty products sales she has bought items for her living room, bedroom, kitchen and dining room. She also gets items that are on sale of both brands like shampoo, cologne, perfume, etc. and then resells them at a higher price. This is how she is able to cover household expenses and provide her two children with what they need. Besides, Maria tells us that every week she participates in a junta (a collection of money among several persons) that is raffled off on the weekend. She uses that income to buy groceries, school supplies and food for her children. The recent loan that she was granted she will use to buy more stock beauty supplies to increase sales and thus profits. She is happy to be able to participate in this system that supports micro businesspeople like her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Juana Celia

texts.es: Juana Celia L. D. M. es una señora muy responsable, la cual siempre ha deseado darle todo lo mejor a su familia, ella resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango, junto a su esposo, un señor muy trabajador, y junto a sus dos hijos quienes se dedican a estudiar. Juana posee un pequeño bazar en su casa D. habitación, en el cual comercializa productos varios como: cremas para el cabello y el cuerpo, shampoo, acondicionadores, desodorantes, cosméticos y muchos otros productos más los cuales poseen gran demanda en el lugar tanto para uso personal como para regalar en diferentes ocasiones. DesD. hace 10 que ella posee este negocio lo que le ha permitido ser muy conocida en la zona, por lo que posee muchas clientes las cuales disfrutan D. ir a comprar a su negocio. Juana solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir en su negocio, compran D. los productos que ya posee y D. esta misma forma comprar ropa, sandalias, y otros tipos D. accesorios los cuales son muy aptos para regalar.
texts.en:
Juana Celia L. D. M. is a responsible woman who always wants to proviD. the best for her family. She resides in the town of Soyapango with her husband, a hardworking gentleman, and their two children who are in school. Juana has a small bazaar in her home where she sells various products such as hair and body crèmes, shampoos, conditioners, deodorants, cosmetics, and many other items that are in great demand for both personal use and to give as presents for different occasions.

Juana has been in business for ten years and has become well-known in the area. As a result, she has many customers who enjoy shopping at her business. She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in her business. Juana will buy products she already sells as well as clothing, sandals, and other types of accessories that are suitable to buy as gifts.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase toiletries & gift merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies for her bakery

loans.name: Nilvia Luz

texts.es: Nilvia Luz M. H. tiene 39 años de edad, reside en la Colonia Miguel Barahona de la ciudad de Juticalpa, vive junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 9,14 y 16 años. Iniciò vendiendo solamente, churros, galletas y refrescos, luego de un tiempo decidiò poner en marcha una pulperia muy  bien surtida en su casa y ella junto a su esposo la atendian. Pero ella enfermò de Diabetes y se empezò a descuidar el negocio porque su esposo tenia que llevarla muy seguido al Hospital y no tenian a nadie que les atendiera la pulperia y la cerraban, asi que las ventas bajaron y los clientes que tenian credito no le pagaron. Actualmente Nilvia està solicitando este prestamo para comenzar a surtir su pulperia, con mucha fe espera que esta le genere las suficientes ganancias para el sustento de su familia y la compra de sus medicamentos. Su sueño es que Dios le de muchas fuerzas para sobrellevar la enfermedad y ver a sus hijos educados, y tambien mejorar su vivienda. Con los prestamos obtenidos en FAMA ha podido darle a sus hijos educacion y un mejorar nivel de vida, ha comprado articulos para el hogar que le permiten comodidad y tener un negocio que es su fuente de sustento diario.
texts.en:
Nilvia Luz M. H., age 39, lives in Colonia Miguel Barahona in the city of Juticalpa. She lives with her husband and their three children; ages 9, 14, and 16. She started out selling only churros, cookies, and soft drinks. After a time she decided to establish a very well-stocked grocery store in her house. She tended the store together with her husband. But, she became ill with diabetes, and the business started to be neglected . Her husband had to frequently take her to the hospital. They did not have anyone to take care of the store, and they closed it. Sales went down, and the customers who had credit did not pay. Nilvia is currently requesting this loan to start stocking her grocery store. She faithfully hope that this will generate enough income to support her family and to buy her medications. Her dream is that God will give her great strength to endure this illness. She also dreams of seeing her children become educated and improving her house. With the loans from FAMA she has been able to give her children an education and improve her standard of living. She has purchased things for the home that allow them to be comfortable. The loans have also allowed her to have a business, which is her source of daily support.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic needs products (rice, sugar, and beans, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy corn, vegetables, and chicken to make tamales

loans.name: Maritza Beatriz

texts.es: Maritza Beatriz R. D. L., resiD. en puerto el triunfo, ubicado en Usulután, ella es una madre soltera, la cual vive junto a una hija D. 15 años D. edad y un hijo D. 9 años, así mismo vive junto a su madre con quien trabajan en conjunto por salir adelante. Maritza posee un negocio D. venta D. ropa para hombres, mujeres, jóvenes y niños, la cual comercializa sobre la calle principal que conduce a Puerto El Triunfo, un lugar muy turístico ubicado al oriente del país. Maritza solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. prendas D. vestir, y así mismo invertir en el mes D. septiembre y octubre, tiempo en el cual aún pueda encontrar la ropa a precios bajos, D. manera que pueda contar con una gran variedad D. ropa para noviembre y diciembre, fechas en las cuales las ventas se aumentan. Maritza es una persona muy responsable quien a pesar D. tantas dificultades a sabido sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maritza Beatriz R. D. Lopez lives in Puerto el Triunfo in Usulutan, is a single mother who lives with her 15 year old daughter and 9 year old son. Her mother also lives with her and together they work to try to get ahead. Maritza has a business selling clothing for men, women, youth and children on the main road to Puerto el Triunfo. This is a tourist destination in the eastern part of the country. Maritza is requesting a loan to purchase more dress clothing during September and October when she can still get low prices in order to have a better inventory for November and December when sales increase. Maritza is a responsible person who despite many difficulties has succeeded with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

location.town: Puerto el Triunfo, departamento de Usulután

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es: Ana María M. R., es muy trabajadora y responsable y a sus 29 años de edad, cuenta con su propia familia, junto a la cual vive en el departamento de Ahuachapán, su esposo se dedica a trabajar como comerciante de productos varios mientras que sus dos hijos uno de 5 años quien estudia y el menor de 1 año de edad, se encuentran al cuidado de Ana, quien debe dividirse entre sus responsabilidades en el hogar y como madre, como también con su trabajo. Ella posee su negocio propio, en el cual comercializa ropa para niños y adultos, su puesto se encuentra dentro del mercado regional de Ahuachapán, en donde tiene dos años de dedicarse a este trabajo. Ana solicita un préstamo con la iniciativa de mejorar sus ventas, comprando ropa para niños y mujeres, ya que es esta la cual posee mayor demanda en el lugar, la cual ella desea aprovechar, con esto Ana espera no solo mejorar su economía familiar, sino también poder realizarse aún más como comerciante.
texts.en:
Ana María M. R. is 29 years old and is very hard-working and responsible. She has a family of her own and they live together in the department of Ahuachapán. Her husband works as a merchant selling various products while Ana cares for their two children, one who is 5 years old and attends school and the younger child, who is a year old. Ana must divide her time between her responsibilities at home and as a mother, as well as her job. She owns her own business selling clothing for children and adults. Her stand is in the Ahuachapán regional market where she has been selling for two years. Ana is requesting a loan to buy women's and children's clothing to improve her sales since this is what is in high demand here and she wishes to take advantage of this. Ana not only hopes to improve her family's economic situation, but also to be even more fulfilled as a merchant.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase women's and children's clothing

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Mrs. Elsie G. is from the Barangay of Gango, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years of age, married, and blessed with six children, all of whom are now at school age.  To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating a little canteen or carenderia business.  She’s been engaged in this kind of food business for five years already and earning an approximate amount $230 a month from this business activity.

In the year 2007, Elsie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. As an active member of PMPC under the Regular Loan program, she has successfully repaid a loan amount of 7,000 PHP. She is now requesting a loan amount of 30,000 PHP as her 4th loan, to be used for additional capital for her existing canteen business. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs. She is also planning for savings for future use, loan repayments, insurance, her children’s education and possible business expansions. 
		
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her existing carenderia/canteen business

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo T. is from the village of Biasong. He is 57 years old, widowed and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Alfredo owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Alfredo has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Alfredo joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. Alfredo is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be his third from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Mrs. Virginia A. is from the barangay of Aguada, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old and a widow. To make a living, she is engaged in dressmaking and making curtains, embroideries and house decorations. She also receives regular monthly support from her son, who is presently working as a nurse. Virginia has been engaged in this business for 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from this business activity.
In 2007, Virginia joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia is an active member of PMPC under the Regular Loan Program and has successfully repaid a loan of 25,000 PHP. She is now requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP as her seventh loan, which will be used as financial assistance for her son’s wedding.
Virginia plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve her family's general living conditions, especially in meeting basic needs, saving for future use, loan repayments, insurance and possible business expansion.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es: Jesús R. O. de 33 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como comerciante ambulante, y junto a sus dos hijos menores de edad, los cuales son estudiantes de educación básica en la escuela del lugar. La señora Jesús posee su negocio propio en el cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad como: papel higiénico, desodorantes, cremas para el cuerpo, rasuradoras, y otros más. Su negocio se encuentra en las instalaciones del mercado regional de La Libertad, lugar en el cual es muy conocida por su excelente servicio y por ser una persona muy trabajadora y amable. Ella solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder invertir en el negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de productos de primera necesidad, todo con el fin de poder obtener mayores ganancias las cuales se conviertan en una mayor ayuda económica para su esposo y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jesus Ramirez O., age 33, lives in the La Libertad department with her husband (a door to door salesman) and her two young children who are in the local primary school. Jesus has her own business selling basic needs items like: toilet paper, deodorant, body lotion, razors and others. Her business is in the La Libertad regional market and is known for her excellent service and for being hardworking and polite. She is requesting a loan in hopes of investing in the purchase of more goods. Her goal is to have more income which would be of great use for her husband and children.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de productos de primera necesidad.

loans.name: Milagro Del Carmen

texts.es: Milagro del Carmen V. H. de 50 años de edad, es una señora quien siempre ha luchado por salir adelante, ella posee una tienda la cual esta ubicada en el sector de la playa en el departamento de La Unión, su negocio ha estado ubicado por más de una década en este mismo lugar, el cual es una zona muy estratégica para ella ya que cuenta con una gran afluencia de turistas, quienes consumen sus productos, así como también clientes fijos los cuales viven en los alrededores del lugar. Milagro vive junto a su padre, dos hijos y su esposo, la tienda es la única fuente de ingresos con la cual esta familia cuenta, razón por la que todos trabajan en ella. Milagro solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir su negocio comprando mayor cantidad de productos perecederos y de primera necesidad tales como: agua, bebidas, golosinas y otros más. Milagro es una mujer muy fuerte que pese a tantas situaciones adversas no pierde su deseo por salir adelante y ser mejor cada día.
texts.en:
Milagro del Carmen V. H., 50, is a woman who has always fought to get ahead in life. She has a store in a beach area in La Unión department. It has been in the same place for over 10 years. It’s a very strategic spot because of the large number of tourists that frequent it and buy her products as well as the regular customers who live around the area. Milagro lives with her father, her two children and her husband. The store is the only source of income this family relies on so they all work in it. Milagro is asking for funds to stock the store with perishables and basic needs items like: water, beverages, sweets and others. Milagro is a very strong woman who despite many adverse situations does not lose her desire to get ahead and be better every day.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perishable goods.

texts.en:
Lilia T. is from the village of Militar, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 51 years old. Lilia is married and has five school-aged children. Lilia owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2009, Lilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from GDMPC, which was for 5,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Lilia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to expand the business. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to to expand the business. This loan will be her eighth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Flor Esmeralda

texts.es: Flor Esmeralda R. D. H. D. 36 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo quien se dedica a trabajar como comerciante, y junto a sus tres hijos D.: 15, 13 y 11 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Flor tiene como profesión el ser costurera, es por ello que cuenta con un taller D. costura en su casa D. habitación, la cual se encuentra en Soyapango, lugar en el cual atienD. a diferentes clientes los cuales hacen sus pedidos con algunos días D. anticipación y D. esta manera Flor pueda hacer diferentes prendas D. vestir. Así mismo ella elabora uniformes para empresas y escuelas, lo que le permite contar con muy buenas ganancias. Ella solicita un préstamo con el fin D. comprar mayor cantidad D. materia prima como: tela, botones, hilos D. diferentes colores y algunos repuestos para sus maquinas, D. esta manera ella espera poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así mismo obtener alguno nuevos.
texts.en:
Flor Esmeralda R. D. H., 36, lives with her husand, who is a merchant, and their three children who are 15, 13 and 11 years of age and who are students. Flor is a seamstress and has a workshop in her home in Soyapango. She has several customers who place orders with her a few days ahead of time so that Flor can make the various articles of clothing. She also manufactures uniforms for schools and business firms which provides good profits. She is asking for funds to buy larger amounts of raw materials like: fabric, buttons and threads in various colors as well as some replacement parts for her sewing machines so that she can proviD. better customer service as well as acquire new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, buttons and thread.

loans.name: Felicita Alfaro

texts.es: Felicita Alfaro D. M. D. 32 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. San Martín, lugar en el cual habita junto a su esposo y un hijo D. 6 años D. edad, el cual es el principal incentivo para ella D. seguir delante D. D. esforzarse día con día por dar lo mejor D. si en su trabajo. Felicita posee una pupusería, la cual esta ubicada sobre la calle principal D. San Martín, un lugar muy estratégico ya que es transitado por vehículos, transporte público y peatones, quienes en su mayoría se detienen por un momento a degustar D. sus productos. D. esta misma forma Felicita comercializa granos básicos como: arroz, frijoles y azúcar, lo cual le permite percibir ganancias extras. Debido a que este negocio es D. mucha ayuda en su hogar, ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para comprar toda la materia prima para la elaboración D. las pupusas y así mismo comprar más granos básicos para comercializar, así D. esta manera ella espera aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Felicita Alfaro D. M. is 32 and lives in municipality of San Martin along with her husband and 6 year old. Her child is her main motivation to work hard and do her best every day. Felicita has a pupusa restaurant on the main road in San Martin. This is an excellent location since it has lots of vehicle, pedestrian and public transportation traffic, many of whom stop for a moment for her food. Felicita also sells basic goods like rice, beans and sugar which helps earn a little extra. Since the business is important for her household she is requesting a loan to buy the basic ingredients to make pupusas as wells as purchase more basic goods to resell. That's how she hopes to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Ms. Corazon L. is from the Barangay (village) of Mayor’s Village, Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years of age and still single and is shown with her niece. Together with her mother as her business partner, Corazon is presently engaged in selling fried fish crackers: “chicharon” and “ampao” in local terms, sweetened fried rice in English. They have been engaged in this kind of business for ten years already, earning approximately Php 10,000 a month. Corazon also receives regular monthly support from her brother who is presently working abroad as a seaman. In 2008, Corazon joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. As an active member of PMPC under its Regular Loan program, she has successfully repaid a loan of Php 50,000. Corazon is requesting the same loan amount of Php 50,000 as her 3rd loan to be used as additional capital for her chicharon and ampao business with the remaining amount used for a hog-fattening activity. Corazon plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, as savings for future use, for loan repayments, insurances, and possible business expansions. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for selling chicharon and ampao, and for hog-fattening

loans.name: Rosa Melida

texts.es: Rosa Melida P. D. G. D. 59 años D. edad, vive junto a sus dos hijas mayores D. edad, y así mismo junto a tres nietos, con quienes resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango.  Rosa posee un comedor, en el cual se dedica a elaborar desayunos y almuerzos D. lunes a sábado, debido a que dicho negocio esta en las cercanías del mercado D. Soyapango ella cuenta con varios clientes fijos, los cuales le permiten mantener su negocio estable. Esta es la única fuente D. ingresos con la que ella cuenta por lo que sus hijas y sus nietos le ayudan en el comedor. Rosa depenD. por completo D. su negocio por lo que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir, comprando mayor cantidad D. verduras, granos básicos, frutas y todo lo necesario para aumentar sus ventas y D. esta manera poder contar con una estabilidad mejor junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Melida P. D. G. is 59 years old. She lives with her two grown daughters and three grandchildren in the Soyapango municipality. Rosa has an eatery where she makes breakfast and lunch from Monday through Saturday. Because her business is close to the Soyapango market she has many fixed customers. They allow her to maintain a stable business. This is the only source of income that she has, and her daughters and grandchildren help her in the eatery. Rosa is completely dependent upon her business. She is requesting a loan to buy a greater quantity of vegetables, basic grains, fruit, and everything that is needed to increase her sales. That way she and her family will be able to have more stability.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables, basic grains, and fruit

loans.name: Erkan

texts.en:
Erkan B. is 47 years old and lives with his family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Bayan-Ulgiy province in western Mongolia. His oldest two children, aged 21 and 22, currently live and study at a foreign university in Kazakhstan, while his youngest son, 17, attends a local high school.
Erkan owns and operates his own shoe repair business. He began his business in 2000 in a rented workspace at the local market. He has built his business to a consistent level and attributes its success to his strong selling and communication skills. He pays a monthly rent of 30,000 MNT. His service charge is between 1,000 and 4,000 MNT and he earns 50 per cent as net profit.
In the future, Erkan hopes to grow his business and have his own workplace. Therefore, he is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to buy more repair supplies and tools for his shoe repair center as well as to purchase three tons of coals (costing 180,000 MNT) to prepare for the winter.

loans.use: To buy more repair supplies and tools

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Amor Y Paz se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Calderón de la  ciudad de Portoviejo, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos.

La señora María tiene una tienda de víveres de consumo en su propia casa, también vende algunos medicamentos y tarjetas telefónicas que le dejan unas pequeñas ganancias. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 22h00, trabaja sola y en cuanto a sus productos los compra en Portoviejo y otros los recibe en su propio local.

Tiene 54 años y está casada hace 32 años, de esta relación tuvo 7 hijos aunque nos cuenta con mucha tristeza que uno murió en un accidente, tres de sus hijos viven con ella los mismos que junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar mas productos para la venta, especialmente arroz ya que se viene una temporada en la que escasea y no quiere quedarse sin este grano que es muy vendido en el país.

Ella es socia fundadora del Banco y le encanta por la seriedad que tienen para con sus clientes.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro para movilizarse.
texts.en:
The “Amor y Paz” (Love and Peace) communal bank meets every two weeks in Portoviejo’s Calderón parish. Most of the residents of this location are farmers and raise animals to sell. María has a grocery store installed in her home; she also sells a few medicines and telephone cards which provide some small profits. She is open for business every day from 6am until 10pm. She works by herself. She buys her products in Portoviejo and some are delivered directly to her store. She is 54 years old, has been married for 32 years and she had 7 children although she relates sadly that one of her children died in an accident. Three of them live with her and, like her husband, are farmers. She will use this loan to buy more stock items for her store, especially rice since a season is approaching when it becomes scarce and she doesn’t want to run out of this particular grain which is sold a lot in the country. She is a founding member of the communal bank and she loves it because of the seriousness with which they treat their clients. Her dream is to buy a car to get around in.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, eggs, cooking oil, soft drinks etc.

loans.name: Oyuntuya

texts.en:
Oyuntuya A. is a 32-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and two daughters in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent and fence, owned by her parents-in-law, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her oldest daughter, 8, attends an elementary school while her youngest daughter stays at home.
Oyuntuya operates a clothing retail trading business in the local community. She started her private business in 2002 by selling a variety of fancy articles and accessories and has been engaged in her current business since 2010. She has gained many years' experience in her trading business. Oyuntuya is a very open-minded, intelligent and resourceful person. In the future, she wants to expand her business and save money. She says "My husband and I are planning to have our own land for my family from using business earnings." Oyuntuya is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT to expand her business by increasing her product lines in order to attract new customers.

loans.use: To buy more clothes
